position: Research Intern - Neuro-Based Human Experience Prediction System
description:
Full Job Description Virtual Internship

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

Microsoft Research is offering a research internship with a focus on designing a system that uses biological signals (e.g. EEG, ECOG, HRV) to provide real-time subject indicators. This intern will be co-advised by a hardware group to help design viable sensor configurations. This intern should be comfortable with concepts from transfer learning and lifelong learning and have experience working with and processing multi-modal data. This intern will join a team of applied statisticians, computer scientists, and neuroscience collaborators who research the brain and complex HCI systems.

Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.

Required Qualifications
Must be currently enrolled in a PhD program in Mathematics, Neuroscience, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related STEM field.

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

Preferred Qualifications
Expertise in research in mathematics, neuroscience, statistics, computer science or a related field
Expertise in analyzing dynamic graph data or neurological data
Expertise in embeddings of graphs
Excellent research collaboration skills

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Full Job Description Position: STEM Education Internship Location: Lake Charles, LA Position description Learning Undefeated is seeking passionate and enthusiastic individuals to join its Lake Charles, LA based mobile laboratory teams. These innovative learning spaces offer schools and community partners teaching space, classroom resources, and captivating STEM learning experiences. Drop Anywhere LabsTM offers a one-of-a-kind environment and uses touchscreen walls, tablets, and projection mapping to immerse participants in an interactive learning environment. These custom outfitted STEM learning spaces are built inside a shipping container (Drop Anywhere Lab) that travel to a different school each week. The mobile laboratories offer a blend of career and skills education, providing flexible in-classroom resources that empower teachers. The Drop Anywhere Lab and will mostly serve Calcasieu Parish schools in the Spring of 2022. The STEM Education Intern’s primary responsibilities include presenting motivating and engaging STEM experiences onboard the Drop Anywhere Lab. Individuals will also assist in the development of programs and curriculum, coordinating school and community partner visits, and supporting the management of equipment, supplies, and technology for the program. The STEM Education Interns are the face of Learning Undefeated’s programming and will have the opportunity to impact thousands of Calcasieu Parish students personally. This is an incredible opportunity to be part of a team that is changing how STEM education is delivered, with a specific focus on underserved communities. The ideal team member will be high-energy, creative, flexible, solutions- oriented, and able to handle rapidly changing circumstances with grace. In return, we offer an unparalleled opportunity to be part of the next big thing in STEM education and an entrepreneurial work environment that supports individual success. Responsibilities include: Serve as a positive, flexible, solutions-oriented member of a fast-paced team Facilitate age-appropriate STEM activities and extended or enrichment opportunities to students, both onboard the mobile laboratory and in the classroom Staff after-school events, such as family science night, and public events, such as conferences, festivals, and sporting events Assist with development of curriculum, activities, and materials for middle and high school students and teachers in accordance with the Louisiana State Standards Position requirements: Must have completed a minimum of 24 hours of undergraduate coursework Must have completed at least sixteen (16) credits of undergraduate classwork in STEM related fields (e.g Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science) Outstanding customer service skills, a friendly, outgoing attitude, and the ability to work well as part of a team Must be flexible and adapt well in unpredictable situations Excellent organizational and communication skills Must be able to provide reliable transportation to/from school locations Must be able to report to a different school in Calcasieu Parish every two weeks Demonstrated commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment Must be able to pass a childcare background check Proof of COVID-19 vaccination required Hours and Compensation Must be able to work 30-35 hours/week (Monday-Friday) Must be able to work shifts on a school schedule (7AM- 4PM) Hourly rate is $15/hour The fine print This is a 30-35 hr/week . This is a full-time, 6-month position. Hourly rate is $15/hr. The candidate will be selected for hire based on the following criteria: education, experience, subject area of expertise, communication skills, professional references, background check, and availability. This position reports to the Texas Regional Director. Learning Undefeated embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. About Learning Undefeated, Inc. Learning Undefeated, Inc. is a non-profit organization that brings life-changing STEM education and career opportunities to underserved communities. Through innovative and experiential education programs for grades K-12, we are sparking interest in STEM careers, building the workforce that will drive the innovation economy, and bridging school, community, health, and business. Learning Undefeated interdisciplinary approach uses STEM to explore real-world, problem-centric curriculum that bridges school, community, health, and business. Learning Undefeated operates innovative and successful mobile STEM education programs in the mid-Atlantic region and Texas. Since 2003, Learning Undefeated mobile STEM education programs have served more than one million students across 50 states. Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary, Internship Pay: $15.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekend availability COVID-19 considerations: Proof of COVID-19 vaccination required; Face masks are required when working on lab or in the classroom License/Certification: Driver's License (Required) Shift availability: Day Shift (Required) Work Location: Multiple Locations

Full Job Description Title: UbiGro Modeling Intern Positions: 1 Start date: Fall 2021 Compensation: Hourly pay, federal holidays paid time off Company Summary: UbiQD is an advanced materials company powering product innovation in agriculture, clean energy, and security. Our quantum dots (QDs) enable industry leaders to harness the power of light. By licensing technology developed at Los Alamos National Laboratory, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Western Washington University, New Mexico-based UbiQD envisions a future where quantum dots are ubiquitous across a wide spectrum of applications. For additional information, please visit: UbiQD.com & UbiGro.com. Job Description: We are looking for an excited programmer to help create a tool that can be used by potential customers to model the effect of UbiGro on the solar spectra in their given location or plant type. Specifically, this includes developing a GUI that can be used on UbiGro’s website that uses available databases to calculate relevant optical values for the model, and validating predictions based on data from plant trials. Primary goals include converting an internal tool created in python into a working tool that can be interfaced through UbiGro’s website. This position involves sitting for extended periods of time, extensive computer work, and periodically presenting technical progress to the team and broader research community. Additionally, the company supports professional development and career advancement activities for employees. Job Requirements Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in computer science, physics, or similar discipline Experience with data bases and programming Ability to work independently with minimal supervision Ability to organize/analyze data and draw conclusions from technical data Strong scientific record keeping abilities Excellent written and verbal communication skills Residence in or re-location to Los Alamos, New Mexico Eligibility to work in the United States, and over the age of 18 Desired Experience Experience with Excel, Python, Java, or similar programs Experience handling large databases Knowledge of plant physiology and/or photophysics Knowledge or experience working with luminescent nanomaterials. Note: UbiQD is an at-will, equal opportunity employer. Job Types: Full-time, Internship Pay: $15.00 - $20.00 per hour Benefits: Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Application Question(s): * Bachelor’s (or higher) degree in computer science, physics, or similar discipline Work Location: One location

Full Job Description JOB SUMMARY The Technical Services Intern provides technical support to the Department of Technical Services. The position will be primarily focused on assisting with quantitative medical imaging analysis. Other tasks, such as producing technical documents, documentation, and assisting on other business and technical needs may be assigned as time and interest permits. The Technical Services Intern will liaise with staff from all divisions of the Department of Technical Services, as well as staff from the Departments of Client Services and Operations as needed. RESPONSIBILITIES: · Assist with conducting analysis and interpretation of medical imaging data · Conduct scientific literature reviews to justify and document imaging and analysis methodology · Assist in developing specialized image assessment techniques · Design and manage internal studies of assessment accuracy and reproducibility · Compare imaging outcomes with findings from the literature · Assist in the interpretation and resolution of unusual or unexpected findings · Assist with developing project-specific training materials for technical project staff, including project managers, analysts and physician consultants (i.e., radiologists and cardiologists) · Collaborate with cross-departmental teams to improve delivery and tracking of analysis work products and other technical documents · Understand MMI’s Quality Policy and support the achievement of MMI’s quality objectives · Comply with company policies and procedures, as well as ISO 9001:2015 and 21 CFR Part 820, and Good Clinical Practices (GCP) relative to job functions EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: · Senior-level Undergraduate in bio- or biomedical engineering, computer science / engineering or equivalent technical specialization, biomechanics, bio-imaging, physics, or related discipline from a reputable institution. · Students currently in graduate school (Masters or Doctoral level) are also encouraged to apply · GPA ≥ 3.2 SKILLS REQUIRED: · Solid analytical and problem-solving skills · Impeccable attention to detail and quality · Demonstrated experience in summarizing and synthesizing key scientific literature · Knowledge of clinical imaging modalities such as X-ray, MRI and CT · Excellent verbal communication, technical writing, and reporting skills · Ability to manage multiple ongoing projects/tasks under tight timelines · Highly self-motivated and committed to exceeding planned objectives SKILLS PREFERRED: · Familiarity with diagnostic imaging and radiology (e.g. XR, CT, MRI, US and/or Nuc. Medicine) · Prior experience in the area of imaging, orthopedics, medical devices, pharmaceuticals and/or tissue engineering research COMPANY & COMPENSATION: Medical Metrics Inc. (MMI) is a fast-growing, independent imaging core laboratory and medical imaging solutions company based in Houston, TX. MMI provides image analysis and consulting services to medical device, biologics, and pharmaceutical companies in support of their clinical trials and product R&D. Competitive wage, commensurate with experience and qualifications Job Types: Part-time, Internship Schedule: Monday to Friday Application Question(s): Do you have knowledge in clinical imaging modalities such as X-ray, MRI and CT? Do you have prior experience in the area of imaging, orthopedics, medical devices, pharmaceuticals and/or tissue engineering research? Are you a Senior-level Undergraduate in bio- or biomedical engineering, computer science / engineering or equivalent technical specialization, biomechanics, bio-imaging, physics, or related discipline from a reputable institution? Are you familiar with diagnostic imaging and radiology (e.g. XR, CT, MRI, US and/or Nuc. Medicine)? Work Location: One location

Full Job Description Data Science Intern - (Requisition ID: 210000HG)

Description

Company Overview

Nabors Industries owns and operates one of the world's largest land-based drilling rig fleet and is a provider of offshore drilling rigs in the United States and multiple international markets. Nabors also provides directional drilling services, performance tools, and innovative technologies for its own rig fleet and those of third parties. Leveraging our advanced drilling automation capabilities, Nabors’ highly skilled workforce continues to set new standards for operational excellence and transform our industry.

Nabors is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibiting discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, religion, age, color, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. To learn more about our Fair Employment practices, please refer to the Nabors Code of Conduct.

JOB SUMMARY

This is a paid summer internship program. Nabors team seeks a motivated student to participate in the organization’s day-to-day operations. The internship program will expose the student to real projects and learning opportunities that relate to their current area of interest or a similar area.

As part of the internship, Nabors will provide learning experiences throughout the organization, so that each intern understands Nabors businesses. From an everyday perspective, the interns will contribute to best-in-class research, assist with day-to-day responsibilities, contribute to business development initiatives, and carry out tasks for both internal and external clients. At the conclusion of the internship, the intern shall present the results of their work to management.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

You will be responsible for supporting the data science team. You’ll work closely with a mentor to ensure your developmental goals are met and that you meet your performance expectations.

You'll have the chance to work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment.

Duties will include:
Assist with developing data science solution for drilling applications based on given requirements and specification
Duties will include generation of Requirements documentation, preparations of project documentation and final presentation of results to management.
Perform basic troubleshooting of data extraction tools, solution methods
Recommend commercial implementation methodology

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS

Must be a junior or senior enrolled in a fulltime undergraduate or graduate level program pursuing a degree in math, electrical, computer science or a related software development discipline at an accredited University.
Must be able to work full time, 40 hours a week for a minimum of 10 weeks.
GPA of 2.7 or higher (on a scale of 4.0).
Must be able to work in the area of assignment for an unlimited amount of time without visa sponsorship.
Be able to travel as needed.
Complete the required pre-employment authorizations and tests.
No relocation or housing assistance is being offered.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Understanding of oil and gas industry
Machine Learning frameworks
Working knowledge of Python

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES

Must possess strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.
Demonstrate specialized skills (e.g. foreign language fluency, problem solving, social media, research and analytical skills).
Demonstrate competency in technology and business software packages (e.g. Microsoft Word, Excel and Access).
Be able to work in both team and individual environment.

TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

Software development experience in Python, C#, java or C++
Knowledge of TensorFlow or PyTorch

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment

Job: ADMINISTRATION

Primary Location: United States Of America-Texas-Houston-(Nabors Corporate Services) Houston Office

position: 2022 Summer PHD Data Analytics Research Intern
description:
Full Job Description Job Description

About CDAO:
Our Chief Data & Analytics Office(CDAO) enables GM to harness the power of data & analytics to make informed business decisions that drive results

About us:
The researchers of the Analytics Research team at General Motors Chief Data & Analytics Office help solve the most challenging problems related to GM's ambitious goal of building a safer, better, and more sustainable world with zero crashes, zero emissions, and zero congestion.

Our focus areas include customer insight analytics, marketing analytics, revenue management, quality, safety, future mobility, customer care and aftersales, supply chain, etc.

Our team employs talents with diverse background in Operations Research, Management Science, Applied Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Product Development, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, and Engineering.

We are looking for highly motivated students with excellent skills in modeling, analysis, simulation, and optimization of complex, dynamic, stochastic systems.

You will collaborate and exchange ideas with top research scientists in the field; and work on cutting edge research that pushes the state of the art and have an opportunity to test your findings on complex real-world problems.

Additional Job Description

Qualifications:
Required:
Current PhD students in a quantitative field including: Operations Research, Management Science, Transportation Research, Applied Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science, or equivalent.
Familiar with probability theory, mathematical models, and optimization and simulation methods
Good programming skills and familiar with modeling languages such as Python, R
Excellent team player and communicator with strong interpersonal skills.
Excellent oral, presentation and written communication skills
Quickly learns and adapts skills to work on projects in and with different technical areas
Self-starter and able to work independently on projects with minimal guidance
Great work ethic

Preferred:
Former experience with big data cleaning and processing, and familiar with SQL query language.
Familiar with C/C++, TensorFlow, GPU/parallel programming, or Simio simulation software.

This role offers the following Work Appropriately strategies:
Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

Remote: This position does not require employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work off-site on a permanent basis.

The Start date for these internships' roles are for May & June of 2022 Spring/Summer Internship

Full Job Description Position Description:
The General Dynamics Land Systems Intern Program provides an opportunity for students looking to start or continue the transition from academia into industry. Our three-month internship assignments provide compensation based on area of study and class standing, and have the students embedded in key functional areas of our business, getting real-world experience and mentorship from seasoned professionals.

Perform software requirements analysis and development for Vehicle Electronics systems. Ensure traceability between software and system level requirements. Create software architecture and design from the allocated requirements. Develop software detailed design interfaces and provide implementations consistent with the design. Develop software code based on requirements and design. Perform unit level tests and functional integration tests. Assist in the development and performance of systems level tests. Prototype proofs of concept as necessary. Participate and support technical reviews. Coordinate and collaborate with other GDLS organizations outside of the software area.
Position Requirements:
Must be pursuing a Bachelors degree from an accredited 4 year university or college in an Engineering / Software Engineering discipline. Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors are preferred.

Candidate must have attained Sophomore status based on university/college's class standing requirements at the start of the internship Preferred - GPA of 3.0 or higher Candidate must be at least 18 years old Must be a U.S. Person (i.e. a lawful permanent resident of the U.S.) Must successfully pass standard pre-employment screens and must provide an original transcript from their school before their first day of employment The Intern must be able to complete a minimum of a 3 month assignment and work full time for the duration. Occasional overtime, weekend, and off hours. Experience with C, C++, Java or ADA programming languages & UML and Object Oriented concepts. Familiarity with DOORS is desirable. An undergraduate level course in Operating Systems and/or compiler design highly preferred. Basic UNIX/Linux bash shell scripting Knowledge and experience in Linux desirable.

Full Job Description Job Description

About Team

Within GM, Global Connected Services (GCS) and Customer Experience (CX) focus on providing world class customer experiences and maximizing the value delivered by connected vehicle services such as OnStar, SiriusXM and the MyBrand App.

The Chief Data & Analytics Office (CDAO) operates to provide analytics, data and business intelligence support to businesses across the company. At the intersection of these two, the CDAO business facing team leverages both business and technical knowledge to deliver value to CX and GCS. This position will partner with the business to deliver data and analytic support GCS sales and marketing initiatives. A critical component of the role is to deliver insights that enable strategic decision making and future investment.

About the Internship:
As an intern you will collaborate with a diverse group of individuals across I&G to complete a project

In the past, interns have investigated problems related to subscriber acquisition and churn, identifying clear gaps in our performance metrics, exploring root causes, articulating insights with a data-driven approach and recommending solutions to drive performance. These are real-world problems whose solutions drive meaningful revenue for our business

You will support an analytical project from conception to completion with high velocity and quality, be cognizant of status, roadblocks and pace of project throughout and escalate as necessary to ensure success and on-time delivery to business partners
You will deliver data-driven insights and 'tell the story' that enables strategic and operational decisions
You will continuously enable to new solution trends and develop the skills for self and enable the practice to build the skills

Additional Job Description

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing Bachelor's degree in Business analytics, statistics, economics, data science, computer science, mathematics, applied mathematics, engineering or related quantitative field
Current Junior status in school graduating between December 2022 and June 2023
Preferred Qualifications

Involvement in a club(s), organization(s) or volunteer experience
Prior work experience is preferred

Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

Remote: This position does not require employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work off-site on a permanent basis.

Full Job Description About GM

There's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. Why Work for Us

Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

2022 Spring/Summer Internship

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.

#LI-Remote #GeneralMotors

At GM, we earn customers for life. We have a culture of building brands that inspire passion and loyalty. Therefore we've created a new group. This is an exciting area that is functioning as a startup but with the stability of a 100+ year old company.

About Customer Experience: Global Customer Experience (CX) organization to focus on delivering world-class experiences to our customers. The mission of CX organization is to design and build digital products, services, and experiences for General Motors customers globally. The group will accomplish this mission by bringing together customer, brand, and competitor insights from across the enterprise and using them to design, prioritize, and build the best enterprise-wide solutions.

There are variety of areas within CX and your summer internship can be based on your interest, qualifications and best fit for the business.

CX Chief Engineering Assistant Program Analyst - where you will be working with more technical teams in Engineering and IT to work cohesively in achieving an enterprise-wide customer experience vision. You will help construct, plan, and lead technical programs for products, services, and customer experience software.

System Operations Intern - where your primary responsibility is to provide analytical support to the System Vehicle team which often means pursuing independent projects and working closely with others. Here you will have responsibilities in robust quantitative analysis by manipulating data using Microsoft Excel, Oracle Database, Minitab and Hadoop data analytics.

Additional Job Description

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Software, or Technical Architecture

Able to work full-time, 40 hours per week

Must be Sophomore standing or higher

Ability to work in ambiguous situations

Shown capability to collaborate with different people and groups to gain trust and hit program objectives

Demonstrated learning agility

Desired Skills:
Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization as needed

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill complex subjects to a wider audience

Emerging partnership and collaboration skills and ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a fast-paced environment

High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, take initiative/self-directed

Evidence of strong character with honesty, accountability and trust

Consistently demonstrates innovative thinking that is customer-centric

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.

Full Job Description IT Internship Come join the dynamic team at Hytek Finishes, a diverse organization located in the heart of America’s aerospace industry. Boeing and its sub-tiers count on us to process their highly engineered components. Rooted in our culture, quality takes precedence, and our customers recognize us for our commitment to giving them complex processing at high quality, on time. Our employees are crafts people who enjoy hands-on work, problem solving, working within a team, and feeling a sense of accomplishment and pride at the end of their day. Our management team is very involved with every aspect of the business and is looking for high potential early career employees to mentor and help us grow. Qualities we are seeking in an Intern: Driven, Organized, Solution-oriented, Collaborative, Creative, Responsible, and can stick to commitments, & Smart! Some benefits will be offered in the internship position such as: 401(k) matching, paid time off accrual, life insurance, long-term care plan options, paid holidays if length of internship has holidays in it, and onsite health services that includes access to a massage therapist. Internship Overview Title: IT Intern Reports to: Infrastructure Systems Manager Location: Kent, WA Work Schedule: 1stShift; Part Time, 2-3 days per week. Full Job Description Black Sesame Technologies is looking for software engineering interns to join our team for an exciting and challenging internship. We are seeking interns who will thrive in a startup culture working alongside teammates to write tools to support the launch of products that will be utilized by customers across the globe. As an intern working with the Computer Vision team, you will be working on one or more highly impactful projects that will help create an exciting user experience. You will have opportunities to work with engineers across multiple teams to implement the latest iterations of Black Sesame Technologies products powered by computer vision and deep learning! Responsibilities o Develop novel computer vision and image processing algorithms o Work on algorithm deployment on target platforms Qualifications o Pursuing a Master or PhD degree in computer science, electrical engineering, or related field o Solid understanding of camera fundamentals and cutting-edge computer vision and deep learning approaches o Experience in applying computer vision, image and video processing, and/or deep learning algorithms o Solid programming skills with Python and C/C++ o Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch o Excellent independent working and communication skills About Black Sesame Technologies Our deep learning team helps autonomous vehicles sense and perceive the world. Full Job Description Job Description

About Team

The CDAO (Chief Data Analytics Office) Advanced Analytics CoE (Center of Excellence) is responsible for developing analytics-driven solutions to help GM business functions achieve their business goals. You will work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team of various experience levels that will be driving solution design and development of analytic models in support of business facing analytic groups. The team is responsible for both advanced analytics strategy and applied, project-based solutions, focusing on the company's most critical business areas. As a Data Scientist, you will be applying Data Science and Modeling techniques to tackle complex business problems. This includes opportunities to solve business problems using data mining, predictive modeling, simulation and visualization.

Are you driven and passionate about data analytics and data science?

Can you lead with our vision for the future?

Come be part of an industry whose vision is to change the future of mobility.

About the Internship:
As an Advanced Analytics intern, you will have an opportunity to work on a project that may entail:

Develop analytical solutions by applying Data Science and Modeling techniques actionable insights for better decisions and better business performance:
Perform hands-on analysis, design, and development of analytical solutions
Perform exploratory and targeted data analyses, which could include complex event and real-time event processing
Build predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Analyze large amounts of diverse information to discover trends and patterns
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Prepare and clean structured and/or unstructured data
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present complex information using data visualization techniques
Identify actionable insights, make recommendations, and communicate results to business and technical audiences
Establish strong working relationships with cross-functional teams to formulate business problems and validate assumptions
Assess new technologies, as needed, as related to solving business problems
Work under guidance of a senior data scientist on analytical solutions
Get exposure to other work being done in the Advanced Analytics CoE

Potential Projects

Potential summer projects may include:
Analyze trends and patterns using vehicle telemetry data to improve customer experience
Develop a propensity model to predict whether a customer with purchase a product or service
Develop a customer segmentation model to inform product marketing
Forecast customer churn rates for subscription services

Additional Job Description

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing Master's or PHD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Economics, Data Science, Advanced Analytics, or other quantitative field
Proficiency with at least one programming language such as Python, R, Scala or Java
Graduating no earlier than December 2022

Desired Prior Experiences, Skills & Competencies

Prior hands-on experience with several of following methods: classification, regression, similarity matching, clustering, co-occurrence grouping, profiling, link prediction, dimension reduction, tensor decomposition and regression, causal inference and etiology
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
Experience with SQL and familiarity with relational databases
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or similar
Cultivates open, inclusive culture that supports learning and encourages collaboration.
Has a thirst to learn the latest knowledge in software and hardware products or services, trends, help select best solutions to meet business requirements, and support the presentation and explanation of design solution to customers.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.) and Machine Learning pipelines (Scikit-learn, DASK, etc.)
Experience with deep learning libraries such as tensorflow or pytorch
Experience or deep interest in geographic information system (GIS) such as GIS data representation, coordinate system projection, geostatistics, geocoding and cartography

Able to work fulltime, 40 hours per week

Willing to work in a plantenvironment

Job Summary

Headquartered in Houston, Texas, CITGO Petroleum Corporation is a recognized leader in the refining industry with a well-known brand. CITGO operates three refineries located in Corpus Christi, Texas; Lake Charles, La.; and Lemont, Ill., and wholly and/or jointly owns 42 terminals, six pipelines and three lubricants blending and packaging plants. With approximately 3,400 employees and a combined crude capacity of approximately 769,000 barrels-per-day (bpd), CITGO is ranked as the sixth-largest, and one of the most complex independent refiners in the United States. CITGO transports and markets transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and other industrial products and supplies a network of approximately 4,600 locally owned and operated branded retail outlets, all located east of the Rocky Mountains. CITGO Petroleum Corporation is owned by CITGO Holding, Inc.

Full Job Description The Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) is a world leader in the design of virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) systems. The FRL Motion Sensing Team gathers world class expertise to drive the development and integration of new, cutting-edge Motion Sensing technologies that impact the entire AR/VR product portfolio.

Our team is looking for an intern candidates with strong electronics, embedded software (firmware), characterization, and debugging experience to help with the development and implementation of novel sensing technologies, while collaborating with domain experts across the FRL organization.

Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long, and we have various start dates throughout the year.

Collaborate with researchers and engineers across the FRL organization to help develop novel sensing platforms for AR/VR and wearable platforms
Deliver software (firmware) and hardware that enables the integration of high-performance sensors into AR/VR systems and wearables
Develop novel algorithms that enable breakthrough sensing capabilities and performance

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, an MS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related engineering discipline
Hands-on experience working with analog and digital circuit design, validation, and debug
Experience developing low-level, embedded firmware for ARM-based processors
Proficiency in using benchtop equipment such as oscilloscopes, signal generators, logic analyzers, etc.

Strong background in embedded architecture and firmware development
Proficient developing firmware in low-level languages such as C and C++
Hands-on experience developing drivers for and debugging common communication protocols such as I2C, I3C, SPI, UWB, WiFi, etc.
Experience in development, integration and/or validation of Microelectromechanical Systems (MEMS) sensors and actuators
Familiarity with Linux, Unix, and/or Android system software
High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving skills

position: Cadillac Global Research and Insights Masters Intern - Sales, Service and Marketing
description:
Full Job Description Job Description

Intern will be responsible for a customer-centered end-to-end project that will bring strategic value to either marketing strategy, a future advertising campaign, or a vehicle launch team. Example projects include calculating the business impact of vehicle launches, measuring performance of new brand campaign, performing early buyer study, personifying segmentation targets, etc. Exposure will to be to a broad base of stakeholders and the intern will potentially need to collaborate across a range of clients, service providers, and team members. Ideal candidate will be naturally curious with the ability to connect dots across disparate data and/or market insight streams. Final deliverable with be presented to the Cadillac Management Team.

Additional Job Description

Qualifications:
In progress graduate degree in computer science, analytics, market research, psychology, sociology, anthropology, marketing analytics, business administration or related field

Interest and curiosity in using data to influence business outcomes via impactful visualizations and story-lines

Proven analytical problem-solving ability

Demonstrated experience in quant analysis / constructs / paradigms / models

Strong project management skills

Strong teamwork and communication skills and ability to work with all management levels

Ability to collaborate successfully in cross functional and cross-regional teams

Strong presentation skills: ability to communicate complex concepts with compelling, simple and impactful delivery

Natural drive for contributing along with creating new processes and methodologies

Skills:
Experience with data manipulation (e.g., Excel pivot tables)

Experience with data visualization (e.g., PowerPoint, Tableau)

Understanding of market research methodologies & techniques

Experience with digital insight tools and/or vendors preferred (e.g., Google analytics, Facebook API)

Statistical software skills a plus (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, STATA, XLSTAT, Excel Stat Pack)

Database management skills a plus (e.g., Access, SQL, Hadoop)

This can be a remote and or hybrid position; Remote: The selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States. Hybrid: This position does not require an employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively.The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP.

GM will provide a one-time lump sum taxable stipend payment to each student selected for the 2022 Student Program

The median level of the monthly salary compensation for this role is $5300 dependent upon class status and degree. Benefit options are not available for this role.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. Full Job Description The Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) is a world leader in the design of virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) systems. The FRL Motion Sensing Team gathers world class expertise to drive the development and integration of new, cutting-edge Motion Sensing technologies that impact the entire AR/VR product portfolio.

Our team is looking for an intern candidates with strong electronics, embedded software (firmware), characterization, and debugging experience to help with the development and implementation of novel sensing technologies, while collaborating with domain experts across the FRL organization.

Our internships are twelve (12) to sixteen (16) weeks long, and we have various start dates throughout the year.

Collaborate with researchers and engineers across the FRL organization to help develop novel sensing platforms for AR/VR and wearable platforms
Deliver software (firmware) and hardware that enables the integration of high-performance sensors into AR/VR systems and wearables
Develop novel algorithms that enable breakthrough sensing capabilities and performance

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, an MS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related engineering discipline
Hands-on experience working with analog and digital circuit design, validation, and debug
Experience developing low-level, embedded firmware for ARM-based processors
Proficiency in using benchtop equipment such as oscilloscopes, signal generators, logic analyzers, etc.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Strong background in embedded architecture and firmware development
Proficient developing firmware in low-level languages such as C and C++
Hands-on experience developing drivers for and debugging common communication protocols such as I2C, I3C, SPI, UWB, WiFi, etc.
Experience in development, integration and/or validation of Microelectromechanical Systems (MEMS) sensors and actuators
Familiarity with Linux, Unix, and/or Android system software
High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving skills

position: Optical Scientist Intern, Imaging for Human-Computer Interaction (PhD)
description:
Full Job Description At Facebook Reality Labs, our goal is to invent the user interface technologies that will drive the next generation of augmented-reality experiences. Our aim is to unleash human potential by erasing the bottlenecks between intent and action. As an Optical Scientist Intern, you will focus on developing novel interactions and interfaces for augmented reality glasses. Your work would involve developing novel imaging modalities and image processing methods to understand the user input and/or the surrounding environment. Our research lies at the intersection of machine learning, computer vision, optical imaging, depth sensing, and human-computer interaction. You will work with world-leading collaborators and mentors in the AR/VR, optical imaging, depth sensing, machine learning, signal processing, and HCI fields.

Bring up, test, and validate new optical sensing and tracking systems to advance AR/VR interaction technologies for processing user input and/or object recognitions.
Develop novel optical sensing/imaging modalities and image processing methods to enable human computer interaction in real-time.
Research next generation wearable optical sensing devices for human-computer interaction.
Collaborate with researchers, engineers, and designers across disciplines to solve complex problems and evaluate the effectiveness of developed solutions through user evaluations.
Work with leading academic researchers to produce publishable research that appears in top-tier journals or at leading international conferences in the HCI or computer vision field.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD in the field of human-computer interaction, artificial intelligence, computer science, electrical engineering, optical engineering, or similar.
Experience in bringing up, testing, and validating optical sensing and tracking systems, e.g., time of flight, depth sensors, RGB or Monochrome camera systems.
3+ years of experience with scientific programming languages such as Matlab, Python, and/or C++/C#.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.

Familiarity with AR/VR technologies and literature.
Experience with computer vision or computational imaging.
Experience with depth sensing techniques.
Experience with computational interaction and/or building models of interaction intent for real-time interactive scenarios (e.g., gesture recognition, object recognition, task inference).
Experience with machine learning (e.g., time-series modeling, deep learning, RL, personalization).
Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at leading workshops or conferences such as CHI, ICML, CVPR, ECCV, SPIE, OSA, UIST and IMWUT, or similar.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Good knowledge of Knowledge graphs and linked data.

position: Research Intern, Infrastructure System Lab (PhD) - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Internships at TikTok aim to provide students the chance to work with our clients and teams to address key business problems and identify areas of growth for the company. With your education and experience, you will be able to take on real-world challenges from day one.

By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA and Bellevue, WA. This Internship Program is for 12 weeks duration beginning in May/June 2022.

Application deadline: February 15th, 2022
Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.

With the fast growth of TikTok's business, TikTok's system infrastructure is currently at a massive scale and requires versatile system solutions. Our lab collaborates with HQ teams on advanced R&D projects. Our lab focus on building new technologies and systems to advance TikTok's core computing, storage, database and networking infrastructure. To name a few, we are building new cloud data management systems that support real time analytics over massive amounts of data. We also work on new infrastructure systems to support large scale ML processing over large scale open source serverless platforms. We also look into hot technologies such as software-hardware codesign and applying ML models in automatic system tuning and smart scheduling etc. We hire students with great technical skills, willingness to learn and solve complex technical challenges and passion in making an impact on millions of users.

This internship will give you a great opportunity to work on building cutting-edge large-scale distributed software systems in early stages that requires research, awareness, interactivity, and the ability to ask the right questions.

Responsibilities
Do research surveys and come up with a new system and algorithm design Develop prototyping systems Be able to debug systems and measure system performance Collaborate with mentors and other lab members Write technical reports and publish papers Currently pursuing a PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields Able to commit to working for 12 weeks during Summer 2022 Understand how distributed systems work, such as distributed computing and distributed storage and database systems. Great programing skill in one or more of the following programming languages: C/C++, Go, Java or Python Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong past research experience in infrastructure system areas Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

Recommended Experience Currently enrolled or completed Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Marketing Business Management, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field(s) with a Cumulative GPA of 2.7 or above Familiarity with hootsuite Ability to write technical documentation Knowledge of programming Job Types: Part-time, Internship Pay: From $12.00 per hour Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Social Media Management: 1 year (Preferred) Marketing: 1 year (Preferred) Event marketing: 1 year (Preferred) Scheduling: 1 year (Preferred) Instagram: 1 year (Preferred) TikTok: 1 year (Preferred) Hootsuite: 1 year (Preferred) Business Strategy: 1 year (Preferred) Sales: 1 year (Preferred) Reddit: 1 year (Preferred) Product Demonstrations: 1 year (Preferred) Twitter: 1 year (Preferred) Online Moderation: 1 year (Preferred) Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred) Work Remotely: Yes

Full Job Description Description

At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.

Putting you first
As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience at a high-growth company that values its people. You'll earn a competitive starting wage while absorbing a culture that emphasizes collaboration, entrepreneurial thinking and quick decision-making. Start doing the best work of your life here.

Responsibilities

First Republic Information Services
First Republic Bank is looking for software engineers to help grow our centralized infrastructure team and participate in the development of application software that will be used in production workloads. You'll get to work in a professional environment and gain exposure to how enterprise software is built and deployed at a financial institution. You'll also get to work in a fun environment that celebrates creativity with interesting people.

What you'll do as an Software Engineer Intern:
You'll be assigned to work with in a dedicated feature team building infrastructure for First Republic Bank, Develop code in the DevSecOps platform space which will be used by the bank, Learn software development processes that related to financial institutions, Become familiar with software development in a secure compliant environment
Qualifications

You could be a great fit if you have:
Proficiency in a managed language: e.g. C#, Java, etc. Proficiency in a scripted language such as Python or Terraform, Knowledge of how the web applications work and experience with web-based markup, Some experience working in the cloud: e.g. Azure, AWS, etc. Major in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
Job Demands:
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient. Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.
Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

Full Job Description About PearlX Infrastructure LLC Founded in 2019, PearlX builds, owns, operates flexible infrastructure. For our energy customers, PearlX’s portfolio enables resilience and independence. For our infrastructure investors, PearlX eases capital formation and enables the energy transition. The Company’s mission is to generate long-life current yield for its partners and shareholders. We believe that mission is achieved by selling the most flexible electron with the highest energy margins. More insight into our mission & team can be obtained by visiting our website: https://www.pearlx.com Our Technology Stack Battery software for Virtual Power Plants (VPPs) has become mainstream, punctuated most recently by the IPO of Stem for $1.35B. Now that these software vendors have demonstrated that batteries installed in people’s homes and at commercial and industrial complexes can replace natural gas power plants, the next phase of software will enable investors and utilities to become completely comfortable relying on them. Investors and utilities need software to provide real time monitoring and fault tolerance capabilities for VPPs. Hardware and software that power workplaces, homes, schools, and hospitals needs to be rock solid. This software is not simple, it needs to: Orchestrate a large number of components: Virtual Bidders, Portfolio Optimizers, Energy Management Systems, Market Forecasting, and Real Estate Management Systems Back-test the output from those components to ensure optimal performance Perform A/B testing to validate assumptions Model connectivity and transmission issues in a geographically distributed multi-nodal network We believe that this software will unlock investor interest in the short term, and a developer ecosystem in the long term. In order to improve resiliency, PearlX intends to be at the center of incorporating blockchain technology that would also help improve data integrity and privacy by taking advantage of blockchain’s democratization of control. Building the monitoring and fault tolerance layer let’s us work with our component vendors to normalize their APIs, building an OS for Virtual Power Plants. That allows interoperability, extensions, and new innovations without our involvement. Imagine a virtual power plant that is aware of a critical data center job, saving enough energy to provide adequate compute. The technology team consists of members that bring together technology a vast experience in the smart grid, predictive analytics, and machine learning; utilizing MLOps and DevOps principles to drive business insights to help innovate in a traditional engineering industry. Our team has over 22 years of combined experience building technology solutions within the smart grid and energy space. The Role PearlX is seeking a new breed of data professionals with a passion for clean energy that can cut across disciplines as requirements dictate, blurring the lines between data analyst, scientist, and engineer, with the ability to work across a multitude of projects and contribute across various aspects as well as collaborate with a passionate team in a fast-paced environment. This candidate in the near-term will support the day-to-day, tactical activities associated with the growth of the Asset Management and Optimization business of PearlX Virtual and Battery Power Plants as well as be responsible for supporting internal financial reporting, forecasting and analytics. As we evolve and as requirements dictate the candidate will support working with other engineers to build, manage, integrate data pipelines as well as streamline the ETL process, generate actionable insights, and develop external and internal API’s. Knowledge in developing and deploying machine learning models at scale is a big plus. Core Responsibilities Support development and integration of software tools to automate financial reporting and compliance Provide analytical support for financial project assessments and investor due diligence Communicate analytical findings in an intuitive and visually compelling way Creating highly visual and interactive dashboards/reports using Business Intelligence tools or custom web applications Support implementation of large-scale data ecosystems, integration of unstructured and structured data sets, and development of custom reporting while maintaining a high degree of scientific rigor and discipline Extract, process and model energy market pricing, project development metrics, and misc. data Supports the team with engineering data pipelines and products to help stakeholders make and execute data driven decisions Skills Proficiency (can execute data ingestion to insight) in programmatic languages such as SQL, Python, R, VBA Working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases. Superb analytical and problem-solving abilities In-depth knowledge of mathematics and statistics Working knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks, libraries, data structures, data modeling, and software architecture Proficiency with Microsoft products and Google Business suite Familiarity with agile development process and methodology Familiarity with accounting practices and financial reporting Familiarity with distributed ledger technology, distributed infrastructure technology and Big Data Technologies Education & Experience Pursuing Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (graduating preferably in December 2021/March 2022) in quantitative studies including Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or computation-intensive Sciences. Benefits Competitive salary in a fast-paced, start-up company 100% remote position with the possibility of some travel Fun, fast-paced, start-up environment Full-time contract position with an option to extend to a permanent role based on performance U.S. Citizens, Green Card holders, and those authorized to work in the U.S. for any employer will be considered. Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Internship Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Experience: SQL: 1 year (Required) Python: 1 year (Required) Microsoft Office: 1 year (Required) Agile: 1 year (Required) Data analysis skills: 1 year (Required) Work Location: Remote

Full Job Description Subsidiary: Simon

Simon is a subsidiary of the Colas Group, a worldwide leader in infrastructure construction and maintenance. Simon specializes in aggregates, asphalt and ready-mix concrete production, asphalt paving, and concrete, bridge, highway, and utility construction. Through strong local ties backed by global resources, we focus on quality and value to deliver the best products and services for our clients. What we do is bigger than construction – it is about connecting communities, building new roads to the future, and keeping the spirit of the pioneers alive and well.

Program Overview:
At Simon, we strive for the highest levels of employee safety, ethical standards, environmental stewardship, and quality in our products and services. We believe that achieving these standards leads to positive revenue and profit – more importantly, they ensure we are doing business the right way.

Simon’s internship program is designed to provide first-hand exposure to industry operations, as well as 1:1 mentorship and networking opportunities to students in order to supplement college educational programs in the areas of business, engineering, and construction management. Students in the program have the opportunity to work in various administrative and operational areas, contribute to company goals through completion of focused project work, and apply concepts learned in the classroom to business operations.

Summary:
Under direct supervision, the IT Intern will be the first point of contact for end users and will provide remote and on-site technical support. The IT Intern will be a part of a customer service oriented team responsible for provisioning, installation, configuration, and maintenance of end-user hardware, software, and business applications.

IT Internship typically begins in early March/April, on a part-time basis, with approximately 5-10 hours per week and transition for the summer to full-time. Position will be located in our Corporate Office in Cheyenne, WY and will require occasional field visits to other Simon locations.

A successful candidate will be able to interact with a diverse group of employees at all levels, manage multiple concurrent tasks, and effectively address and manage service requests, incidents, emergencies, and monitor their status through resolution while keeping internal users up to date with status.

Responsibilities:
As part of the internship program, the IT intern will gain exposure to multiple areas of business technology, networking, and computer systems, including, but not limited to:
Assist with first line response for users requesting assistance with information technology and related issues
Utilize remote assistance tools to assist remote users
Install, configure, troubleshoot and repair workstations, smartphones, software, networks and business systems
Provide end-user training for specialized software
Complete tasks required for Simon internship program
Additional projects as assigned

Qualifications, Education, Skills and Experience:
Pursuing an Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
Previous experience in an IT support role is highly desired
Knowledge of Windows 7 and Windows 10 Operating Systems
Previous experience with Office 365
Knowledge of Power BI
Knowledge and experience with Ticketing/IT Service Management systems
Comfortable interacting with end users at all levels
Excellent customer service skills and a genuine desire to help people
Ability to learn and act in a faced paced environment
Ability to work independently and collaboratively
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong sense of urgency and accountability
Well organized to handle multiple tasks, requests, and assignments
Valid Driver’s License and clean driving history preferred

Physical Requirements/Working Conditions:
Regularly required to use hands to manipulate objects such as paperwork and office tools/equipment
Frequently required to sit or stand for long periods working on a computer or equipment
Frequently required to stand; walk; sit; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl
Frequently required to communicate professionally in-person, over the phone, and via e-mail
Occasionally required to lift and /or move up to 50 pounds with or without assistance
Travel (up to 50%) with overnight stays away from home may be required to visit job sites and/or attend meetings
Required to wear and maintain personal protective equipment (PPE) and follow safety guidelines when visiting job sites

Workplace Values Requirements:
Support, promote, and practice Simon core values, vision, and mission
Support, promote, and comply with Simon Code of Ethics, Workplace Conduct, Safety, and other established policies at all times
Embrace the Company’s safety culture, actively support all safety initiatives, and adhere to defined accountabilities implemented by the Safety Steering and Continuous Improvement teams
Align personal vision and goals with larger goals of the Company
Support continuous improvement to improve Simon processes, performance, safety, and overall success

The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

If you need accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Colas Inc. 973-290-9082 or send an email to ColasRecruiter@colasinc.com.

We are excited to bring on a Software Engineer Intern to work closely with our Risk Management team to join our 2022 Summer cohort.

College rising- junior or senior

Self-motivated and results-oriented
Exceptional communication skills
Effective networking skills

What’s it like to work here?

At Lincoln Financial Group, we love what we do. We make meaningful contributions each and every day to empower our customers to take charge of their lives. Working alongside dedicated and talented colleagues, we build fulfilling careers and stronger communities through a company that values our unique perspectives, insights and contributions and invests in programs that empower each of us to take charge of our own future.

What's in it for YOU:
Potential to turn into a full-time position after graduation
Receive ongoing coaching and mentoring
Add value to the organization through meaningful work
Effective productivity/technology tools and training
Gain exposure to senior executives and build a valuable network of peers, managers, and leaders across the company

Work Arrangement

Lincoln will evaluate the following when setting the successful candidate's wage rate:

Prior work or industry experience.
Education level to the extent education is relevant to the position.
Unique skills

About The Company
Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 200 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.

Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $324 billion in end-of-period account values as of June 30, 2021.

Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America and Best Employers for Women by Forbes magazine as well as one of Newsweek’s Most Responsible Companies, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.

Lincoln is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Lincoln Financial Group is a committed corporate citizen included on major sustainability indices including the Dow Jones Sustainability Index North America and FTSE4Good. Dedicated to diversity and inclusion, we earned perfect 100 percent scores on the Corporate Equality Index and the Disability Equality Index. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram. Sign up for email alerts at http://newsroom.lfg.com

Be Aware of Fraudulent Recruiting Activities

If you are interested in a career at Lincoln, we encourage you to review our current openings and apply on our website. Lincoln values the privacy and security of every applicant and urges all applicants to diligently protect their sensitive personal information from scams targeting job seekers. These scams can take many forms including fake employment applications, bogus interviews and falsified offer letters.

Lincoln will not ask applicants to provide their social security numbers, date of birth, bank account information or other sensitive information in job applications. Additionally, our recruiters do not communicate with applicants through free e-mail accounts (Gmail, Yahoo, Hotmail) or conduct interviews utilizing video chat rooms. We will never ask applicants to provide payment during the hiring process or extend an offer without conducting a phone, live video or in-person interview. Please contact Lincoln's fraud team at fraudhotline@lfg.com if you encounter a recruiter or see a job opportunity that seems suspicious.

Additional Information

This position may be subject to Lincoln’s Political Contribution Policy. An offer of employment may be contingent upon disclosing to Lincoln the details of certain political contributions. Lincoln may decline to extend an offer or terminate employment for this role if it determines political contributions made could have an adverse impact on Lincoln’s current or future business interests, misrepresentations were made, or for failure to fully disclose applicable political contributions and or fundraising activities.

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Lincoln Financial Group are considered property of Lincoln Financial Group and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

University Technology Incubator Intern - Spring 2022

Capital One is a diversified bank that offers a broad array of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses and commercial clients. A Fortune 500 company, Capital One has one of the most widely recognized brands in America and is one of the nation's top 10 largest banks based on deposits.

The Capital One Tech Incubator focuses on research and experimentation in computer science. A variety of software development groups within Capital One provide students with opportunities to contribute to innovative projects. Projects may involve development for web, tools, large scale data analytics, ML/AI/NLP, SQL/NoSQL databases, open source, cyber security, automation or mobile apps.
