Full Job Description Description: Sonalysts, Inc., is seeking exceptional college students for computer science summer internships to conduct studies on processing, networking and storage virtualization applications. Applicants must be working toward a graduate or undergraduate degree in computer science, computer engineering, or related fields and have completed at least their sophomore year of study by May 2022. Must be a U.S. citizen. * What you will be doing: * Potential projects you will work on during the summer include: Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) and automatic provisioning of network switch architectures Augmented Reality (AR) application development Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) algorithm development Establishing an internal cloud environment using Kubernetes and containers Drone control and processing software * What’s in it for you: * Opportunity to challenge yourself intellectually Participate in research of novel and cutting edge technology applications Potential to continue internship through the school year * Required Qualifications: * Must be a U.S. Citizen Completion of Sophomore year working towards a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical degree by May 2022 * Desired Qualifications: * Completion of Junior year working towards a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical degree by May 2022 Sonalysts, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, disability, or other basis protected by law. Sonalysts is a Federal contractor subject to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors (the “EO”). All new employees will be required to present proof they are fully-vaccinated against COVID-19 on the first day of employment. If you receive and decide to accept an offer of employment, but you believe you are entitled to a medical or religious exemption under the specific conditions permitted by the EO, you will be required to notify us as soon as possible, and prior to the beginning of your employment, to start the interactive process and explore what, if any, reasonable accommodations Sonalysts may be able to offer and what effect, if any, these may have on your start date or your employment. Every new employee must meet the requirements of the EO on the first day of employment, either by proof of vaccination or prior approval by Sonalysts of an exemption. This job is not available to residents of New York City because of local law restrictions there. Drug Testing Employer www.sonalysts.com Location: 9720 Capital Court,Unit 202, Manassas, VA 20110 Job Type: Internship

position: SHPE 2021 Annual Conference - Engineers & Information Technology (Full Time and Internships)
description:
Full Job Description More information about this job: Overview:
Please note: This posting is not an indication that there are job openings currently available for your preferred location(s). By applying to this opportunity, you are expressing interest in a Consultant Engineer or Information Technology job or internship should an opening be available.

We are a leading property insurer of the world's largest businesses providing more than one-third of FORTUNE 1000-size companies with engineering-based risk management and property insurance solutions. FM Global helps clients maintain continuity in their business operations by drawing upon state-of-the-art loss-prevention engineering and research; risk management skills and support services; tailored risk transfer capabilities; and superior financial strength. To do so, we rely on a dynamic, culturally diverse group of employees, working in more than 100 countries, in a variety of challenging roles.

Responsibilities:
FM Global has several challenging, full-time, co-op and internship opportunities for Engineers and Information Technology professionals and students.

Available full time and internship opportunities include

Consultant Engineer
Software Development
Cyber Security
Infrastructure - Networking & Server
Data Analytics
FM Appovals Certification Engineer
FM Approvals Materials Engineer
FM Approvals Electrical Engineer

Qualifications:
Skills and requirements for Consultant Engineer role:
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in engineering
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Good analytical, organizational, problem solving, and interpersonal skills
Efficient time management ability with minimal supervision
Solid technical aptitude including diverse knowledge of engineering principles
Valid driver’s license
Physical ability to climb ladders, lift >25 lbs., balance, and heights
Proficient in MS Office products
You will be expected to work independently and should be willing to operate from a home office.

Skills we are seeking for the Software Development role:
Enrolled in Computer Science or related degree program
Theory and principles of software engineering
Fluency in high-level programming languages, environments, and tools for computing
Knowledge of computer operating systems and basic knowledge of networks
Ability to work effectively in teams and solve problems

Skills we are seeking for the Cyber Security role:
Enrolled in a Computer Science, IT or MIS degree program
Have strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Organized, detail oriented and analytical
Able to generate creative ideas to solve problems and improve work methods
Able to demonstrate high personal work standards and a sense of urgency about results
Able to learn quickly on the job
Strong team players that can work independently when needed and have a solid understanding of basic concepts in at least one technology discipline (i.e.: Networking, Systems Administration, End-User Support, Development etc.

Skills we are seeking in the Server Specialist role:
Enrolled in a Computer Science, IT or MIS degree program
Familiarity and experience using Windows server operating systems.
Basic understanding of core server technologies, such as TCP/IP networking, database functions, Windows Endpoint OS (10,8,7), Windows servers and computer hardware.
Experienced with VMware Server Virtualization Software
Have strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Organized, detail oriented and analytical
Able to generate creative ideas to solve problems and improve work methods
Able to demonstrate high personal work standards and a sense of urgency about results
Able to learn quickly on the job
Strong team players that can work independently when needed and have a solid understanding of basic concepts in at least one technology discipline (i.e.: Networking, Systems Administration, End-User Support, Development etc.

Skills we are seeking for Networking role:
Enrolled in a Computer Science, IT or MIS degree program
Familiarity and experience using Windows Network operating systems.
Basic understanding of core Network technologies, such as TCP/IP networking, database functions, Windows Endpoint OS (10,8,7), Windows Networks and computer hardware.
Have strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Organized, detail oriented and analytical
Able to generate creative ideas to solve problems and improve work methods
Able to demonstrate high personal work standards and a sense of urgency about results
Able to learn quickly on the job
Strong team players that can work independently when needed and have a solid understanding of basic concepts in at least one technology discipline (i.e.: Networking, Systems Administration, End-User Support, Development etc.

Skills we are seeking in the Data Analytics role:
Data Literacy; understanding database fundamentals, including SQL
General knowledge of computer fundamentals, including operating systems and networks
Prior knowledge of one or more of the following is a plus: Python, R, C#, SQL, REST APIs, JavaScriptFrameworks, ASP.NET, DAX, PowerBI or similar data visualization tool

Skills we are seeking in the FM Approvals Engineer roles:
Materials Engineer

Plan, conduct and direct the evaluation and certification of property loss prevention products in the area of building materials and assemblies. The testing will push the product’s performance as it relates to wind, fire and other exposures in our world class, state of the art laboratories.
BS in technical area + 3 years experience or MS in technical area
Technical degree in civil, structural, mechanical or chemical engineering preferred. Knowledge of, and experience with, building materials, components, and assemblies is desired. A background in statics and/or material properties is beneficial

Electrical Engineer

Plan, conduct and direct testing and analysis of electronic equipment. This equipment is used primarily in fire protection and explosion prevention systems submitted for FM Approval.
BS in Electrical Engineering and a minimum of 10 years of experience with fire alarm equipment.

position: Animation Studios Data & Analytics Intern, Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description Job Summary:
The Production Data and Analytics team is responsible for developing a strategy and vision for cross-functional and complex data analysis projects. This team aggregates data across multiple CG-animated productions and transforms it into meaningful insights that inform decision making at both the operational and executive levels.

Responsibilities:
Participating in the building of the next generation of statistical models, metrics, and visualizations for our studio
Contributing to the building of production tools and visualizations that enable the production management teams to run scenarios and build informed plans for our films
Enhance performance by applying advanced mathematical modeling, simulation, data analytics, optimization techniques, and data visualization
Conducting ad-hoc analysis

Basic Qualifications:
Experience collecting, analyzing and manipulating large data sets
Experience using one or more programming languages (Python, Java, C++, etc.)
Experience in data visualization (D3.js, Tableau, Matplotlib, etc.)
Good communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Comfortable in a creative environment
Experience with statistical tools (R, SAS, etc.) and analysis, regression modeling and forecasting

Required Education
Working towards (or recently graduated with) an undergraduate degree in Analytics, Statistics, Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or other related field
GPA of 3.0 or higher

Additional Information:
Program Eligibility
At least 18 years of age
Unrestricted work authorization

description:
Full Job Description Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)

Our focus is simple; We're innovators in cost-effective health care management, and when you join our team, you'll be a partner in impacting the lives of our customers, and employees. We've joined OptumHealth, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of companies, and our mission is to help the health system work better for everyone. We're located on the banks of the beautiful Mississippi River in La Crosse, Wis., with a satellite office in Chicago and remote employees throughout the United States. We're supported by a national network of more than 25,000 medical and dental providers. Simply put, together we work toward a healthier tomorrow for everyone. Our team members are selected for their dedication and mission-driven focus. For you, that means one incredible team and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

In this role, you will assist in designing, developing and maintaining windows, web and web services based business software applications, systems, components and database objects using Microsoft .NET technologies based on requirements and specifications to support LHI's business operations as working alongside other Software Developers, Software Development Team Leads and Software Development Managers.

Assist in development of VB.NET/C#, ASP.NET, Angular, Web API and SQL software programs and components per assigned tasks by team leads and other developers.

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:
Uprising Junior or Senior student working towards a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or related field

Must be able to work durning the upcoming Fall 2021 - Spring 2022 school year for this roleMust be able to work durning the upcoming Fall 2021 - Spring 2022 school year for this role

Working knowledge of Visual Studio, VB.NET/C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, ASP.NET ADO.NET

Experience with SQL database applications

Understanding of object oriented programming concepts

Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship, now or in the future, for employment-based work authorization (F-1 students with practical training and candidates requiring H-1Bs, TNs, etc. will not be considered)

Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Optum, a part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, continues to evolve and make a bigger impact through its extensive expertise in combining technology, data and people to create novel health care solutions and services across the globe. OptumServe is following suit by creating and delivering care that meets the health needs of active duty service members, veterans and their families. We're partnering with federal and state government agencies to meet the readiness and health needs of active duty military members and veterans by providing preventive health screenings and assessments to ensure that troops are ready to answer the call of duty. For those who want to intensify their impact in a career that brings together challenge, learning and growth, OptumServe is the right place to do your life's best work.SM

Full Job Description Summary

Waybridge is a well-funded startup that is using technology and data science to create efficiencies in the multi-trillion dollar industry of trading and logistics of physical commodities. We are currently a team comprising of technology experts who have revolutionized the ad-tech industry, commodity experts with years of experience in various commodities, and award winning designers and product managers. We are based in New York, London, and remote.

This posting is for a software engineering intern to join our team in NYC during Summer 2022. You will be joined by past interns who are now full time employees.

In this role, you will be a full-fledged engineer as part of one of our tech teams:

You will work alongside other engineers, tackling different tickets allocated to you. You will be a part of daily standup meetings, and discussions with the product and design team

You will tackle problems from start to finish, writing tech specs, and implementing them in different parts of our application

You will be able to learn from other team members, particularly from your dedicated mentor, who will be a more senior member of the team

As a software engineer in a small team, you will be able to learn from some amazing engineers and start contributing almost straight away to our product. You will get to experience first hand at what it takes to make a successful startup and product.

Applicant Profile

You need to have some experience in computer programming. A computer science degree is not required, however you need to demonstrate an ability and interest in writing code and solving problems.

Our tech stack is:
Python and GraphQL

React, Relay, and Typescript

AWS, Kubernetes, Docker

Automated CI/CD with dev, staging, and production environments

So any experience in any of these will be useful, but do not be put off from applying if your experience does not match our stack.

If your internship goes well we will aim to offer you a job to start the subsequent year, as such undergraduate applicants will need to be in their penultimate year, graduating in 2023. You are welcome to apply if you are not in university, provided that you can expect to be able to start a job in summer/autumn 2023, and that you have the level of experience we would expect for an intern (i.e you are not just about to go to university, and you are not already a professional software engineer).

Project Summary

Think about how easy it is for you to purchase something online; you can see various options, filter by different features, and then once ordered, track where your delivery is until it arrives at your doorstep.

It might surprise you that such systems do not yet exist for manufacturers or suppliers who are looking to buy or sell raw material, such as aluminium, copper or cocoa. Such purchases are currently extremely manual, using a combination of emails, phone calls, text messages to track purchases, sales and deliveries.

We are tackling these problems by:
Bringing market intelligence and pricing tools to small and large manufacturers and producers of physical commodities

Providing financing, price discovery and other facilities to create a more transparent marketplace and enabling companies to trade with new counterparties

Improving ability to manage complex commodities trades and improve logistics and tracking of commodities around the world. This mean optimized delivery routes, with benefits such as a reduction in carbon footprint

More specifically, as an engineer here are some of the problems you might tackle:

Upgrading and expanding commodity trade functionality

Building a dashboard to gain insights into shipment tracking data

Implement new logging in Datadog to improve error handling

Improving the performance of particular component of the code by re-writing it, or using newer libraries

Interacting with client/data provider APIs to improve the visibility of commodity trades in our platform

Interview process

Right now our interview process is completely remote. An outline of the process is given below, and we will try to give you as much detail as we can on what to expect in each of these steps before you actually get to them.

If we like the look of your application, we will send you a take home coding challenge to do in your own time

You will then have an interview with one of our team, part of which may involve discussing your solution to the take home problem

There will then be a final round interview, which will largely devoted to discussing a different technical problem and how you would go about solving it

Diversity

We are proud to have a diverse team, with many of our current team comprising of people from underrepresented groups in the technology industry. We are an equal opportunity employer and we value and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our employees. However, we know we can always do better and are always happy to hear thoughts and recommendations.

Disability

We are happy to accommodate people who may need extra provisions to be able to work comfortably. Please do ask any questions you have with regard to this by reaching out to us directly at any time before or after applying.

description:
Full Job Description at Rivian Automotive
United States, California, Palo Alto

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

Internship Term: Summer 2022

Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term with an expected graduation date of December 2022 or May/June 2023.

If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Note that if your university has specific requirements for internship programs, it is your responsibility to fulfill those requirements.

Responsibilities

Write data pipelines in python to characterize the vehicle life
Build tools and infrastructure for decoding and processing vehicle log data at scale
Visualize and Analyze vehicle data to inform decisions and make a better product
Collaborate with other data scientists and field engineers to understand requirements
Write production quality code
Ability to complete ambiguous projects with minimal supervision

Qualifications

Proficiency in Python, statistics, big data, and machine learning
Pursuing a MS or PhD in Computer Science or other related field

#LI-SA5

Equal Opportunity

Full Job Description ArcherHall is growing fast. We’re seeking exceptionally motivated individuals looking to gain valuable experience in the digital forensics industry to be a part of our internship program. Interns will assist with the forensic examinations of computers, networks, mobile devices, and other digital media in support of our clients’ civil, criminal, or internal investigations. General duties include: Assisting in-lab, on-site and remote collections and investigations using a variety of forensic tools such as Cellebrite, Axiom, XWays, FEX, FTK, EnCase and other forensic software. Handling evidence and chain of custody forms to ensure the proper handling of evidence during litigation. Attending client meetings and updating case files. Researching forensic tools and troubleshooting technical issues. Uploading case data to e-discovery platforms such as Relativity. Keeping lab workstations updated with the latest versions of forensic software, and assisting with other lab responsibilities as needed. Interns will have the opportunity to learn from experienced digital forensics and e-discovery experts and gain exposure to a variety of tools and expertise on the team. At ArcherHall we constantly seek to push the envelope and get to the next level. Our Digital Forensics Division places a strong emphasis on both internal and external training and professional development, and the ideal candidate will be willing to try new things, continuously seeking opportunities to learn, and be eager to support their colleagues through challenges. Qualities of the ideal candidate : Dependable. High level of personal accountability and takes responsibilities seriously. Meticulous and conscientious. Understands how their work impacts others, and strives to do an exceptional job for the team and the client. Low ego. Not above taking on any task if it’s necessary for the success of the team. Driven. Excited about being part of a fast-growth company and building something great. Qualifications Current student or recent graduate in digital forensics, computer science or another technical field Able to commit at least 15 hours/week Previous experience in an IT-related role preferred Location: This position can be based out of any of ArcherHall’s offices, with locations in Sacramento, San Diego, Seattle, or Tucson. Dates: 4-month windows: Jan-Apr; May-Aug; Sept-Dec. Currently accepting applications for Spring 2022 Compensation: $20 per hour plus ArcherHall will work with your institution to design a program and learning objectives to meet credit requirements. About ArcherHall ArcherHall provides Digital Forensics, E-Discovery, and Litigation Support to law firms, corporations, and government agencies. Job Types: Part-time, Internship Pay: $20.00 per hour Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: Employees and customers must wear masks when indoors unless alone in the room. Social distancing (6 feet+) is required. Contact with customers has been minimized for most job functions. Work Location: Multiple Locations

Full Job Description Who We Are

Addepar's mission is to bring data, technology and people together to help investors make more informed and timely investment decisions. Our wealth management platform is transforming the fintech industry by providing data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Here, your voice matters. We believe that portfolio, market and client insights can make a significant and sustainable impact, one person and one community at a time. Working at the intersection of groundbreaking technology and limitless financial services industry growth, we are optimizing how capital is put to work.

Being a part of the AddeU Internship Program, you will be working on a meaningful project(s) that you can feel proud of and present back to the company at the end of the experience. In addition to having a supporting manager and mentor, we have a fantastic onboarding program to get you acclimated and ready for your time with us. Fun events and super cool swag are also included!

At the moment, our 12 week internship experience is remote. Dates are currently set for May - August, 2022 but please consult with your recruiter. Seeking US and Canadian students only.

The Role

We are currently seeking a Software Engineer Intern on the Addepar Operating Platform team.

Engineering is at the core of Addepar and we are looking to add the best, brightest, and most passionate software engineers to our team. If you are excited about doing the best work of your career and you enjoy the rush of shipping high quality code to production every day we're excited to meet you! Our software engineers come from a variety of backgrounds, ranging from Silicon Valley entrepreneurs to finance tech veterans. What they have in common is tremendous talent and dedication to architecting, implementing, and shipping high quality software.

What You'll Do

Implement or update a platform feature or tool by writing well-designed, testable code.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Collaborate effectively with product managers, engineers and stakeholders on your project.
Document software functionality, system design, and project plans; this includes clean, readable code with comments.
Learn and demonstrate engineering best practices and principles.
Produce a retrospective and demonstrate your summer project to an internal audience.

Who You Are

Must be currently enrolled in a post-secondary educational institution (university must be located in the US & Canada) & must be returning to school after internship
Available to intern for the full 12 weeks
Extraordinary talent in software engineering. Ability to write high quality object oriented code.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Working knowledge of development, best practices and experience working in a team.
Ability to explore complex problems spaces objectively from multiple points of view.

General familiarity with some of the technologies we use:
HTTP, REST and web API best practices.
Python, Java/Spring
Amazon Web Services
Modern JavaScript and/or Ember.js.
SQL, relational databases and key-value stores.
Messaging/queuing and transaction log frameworks.
Linux proficiency, basic shell scripting and a solid grasp of systems level programming is a plus.
Specific knowledge of Java, Python are a plus.
Specific experience in or knowledge of financial data systems is a plus.

About Addepar

Addepar was founded in 2009 by Palantir co-founder Joe Lonsdale, who currently serves as an active Chairman of its Board of Directors and General Partner at 8VC. Addepar works with hundreds of leading financial advisors, family offices and large financial institutions that manage data for over $3 trillion of assets on the company's platform. Addepar was named a Forbes Fintech 50 company and honored as a member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has offices in New York City, Salt Lake City and Edinburgh, Scotland.

At Addepar, we are driven by our core values:
Take Action - We believe in empowering each other to make decisions that elevate our colleagues and our communities.
Build Together - We celebrate success by recognizing the value of collaborating with each other, our clients and partners.
Best Ideas Win - We welcome new ideas that inspire change.
Demand Transparency - We encourage open discussion and information-sharing to strengthen communication across organizations.
Solve Problems that Matter - We put our community of clients and partners first by creating technology that meets their needs today

In addition to our core values, Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

To ensure the health and safety of all Addepeeps and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

Unfortunately, at this time we cannot accept Colorado applicants.

Full Job Description Equity makes a difference in our client’s lives by helping them reach financial freedom through the inclusion of Alternative Investments and educating clients on the options available. We have a world class online investing portal called myEquity that helps clients manage their accounts and Equity University is the ultimate resource for wealth building and self-directed IRA investing education. You will have the rewarding opportunity to help our clients navigate the world of non-traditional investing.Equity also has a strong value based culture where associates are asked to be innovative, do the right thing for our clients and all within a fun and supportive environment. Our leaders come from a wide variety of well known organizations in the Banking, Investment and Operations industries and are all committed to the growth and development of our associates. JOB SUMMARY: The IT Intern assists the Enterprise Technology Services (ETS) Department with a variety of tasks related to the design, development, and integration of Azure cloud-based API. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Maintains and modifies existing APIs while maintaining documentation and testing standards Research and propose technical and process improvements to senior technical team members for review Performs programming assignments, showing aptitude in programming standards, methods, and best practices Participates in code reviews OTHER FUNCTIONS: Learns about financial processes Performs other duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS: Education and Experience: Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s or master’s degree program in Information Technology or Computer Science at an accredited four-year college or university If undergrad, Junior or Senior status required Minimum GPA of 3.0 Must be available to work at least 20-24 hours per week, over at least 3 days per week Prior internship or co-op experience preferred Demonstrated leadership through extracurricular activities PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION(S): None required TECHNICAL SKILLS Basic knowledge of .NET/C#, Java, or any C-based programming language Familiarity with Node.js/JavaScript Familiarity with version control, preferably Git Basic understanding of Software Development Lifecycle BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES In addition to the Core Company competencies of Cultivates Innovation, Nimble Learning, Action Oriented, and Collaborates, and Being Resilient: Tech Savvy Communicates Effectively Resourcefulness Manages Complexity Equity Trust Company is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin. Job Type: Internship

Full Job Description Meta is seeking a Data Center Systems Engineer Intern who is looking to apply their technical skills in a fast-paced and complex environment. Our team is part of the Site Operations organization, responsible for delivering server capacity for the Meta fleet. This position will work to resolve and diagnose server issues at scale, take on projects that fix fleet wide issues, and work with remote engineering teams. If you like crunching data, figuring out puzzles, and fixing problems with code, this is the internship for you!

Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug challenging problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world
Build partnerships with some of the best engineers in the industry as you work to solve complex issues impacting the server fleet today
Assist with triage and root cause analysis to debug hardware, and Linux OS related issues

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
Knowledge of Linux and server hardware repairs
Experience coding in at least one language
Ability to rapidly learn new development languages (i.e. Python, PHP, C++, and Java are all in heavy use)
Ability to pick up new software, frameworks and APIs
Familiarity with installing and configuring common applications such as Apache, memcached, Squid, MySQL, NFS, DHCP, NTP, SSH, DNS, or SNMP
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Intent to return to degree program after completion of the internship/co-op

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Full Job Description About Us

One Medical is a primary care platform challenging the industry status quo by making quality care more affordable, accessible and enjoyable. But this isn't your average doctor's office. We're on a mission to radically transform healthcare, which means tackling the frustrations of everyone involved — from patients and providers to employers and health networks.

Across the country, our members enjoy seamless access to comprehensive care at more than 90 locations across thirteen cities (and counting!) as well as 24/7 access to virtual care powered by intelligent uses of technology. In addition to a direct-to-consumer membership model, we work with more than 7,000 companies to provide One Medical health benefits to their employees.

On January 31, 2020 we marked a milestone with our public listing on Nasdaq, but our work is far from over. As we continue to grow and broaden our impact, we're building a diverse, driven and empathetic team, while working hard to cultivate an environment where everyone can thrive.
The Opportunity

As a Quality Engineering Intern at One Medical, you will be a contributing member of our product development team working on software to improve the way healthcare is delivered.

Each product team at One Medical is made up of designers, engineers, and product managers, all with one shared goal: to create high-quality, human-centered, and impactful products for their respective users. As a Quality Engineer, you will engage with multiple product teams across One Medical to improve quality and development processes.

During your internship, you will become familiar with software development best practices, Agile development processes, our culture, and our technology stack (Cypress.io, CircleCI, Rollbars, Code Climate, Jira, TestRail).

This internship is particularly well suited for someone who gears toward collaboration, enjoys validating production features, improving developer efficiency, values having significant ownership of their work, and cares deeply about their end-user.

We are a collaborative and intellectually curious team. We are centered on staying humble because we know we don't know everything. We are eager to learn and part of that is staying open-minded so as to our peer's ideas and opinions. If these values resonate with you, we'd love to connect with you.

Projects you could work on:
Building development tooling and automation to deliver features that enable our patients to engage and manage their health through partnership with One Medical
Building tooling and automation for product features that increase our doctors' ability to be efficient and productive while they care for patients
Participating in the certification of our Electronic Health Record product
Push the boundaries of observability for performance and/or reliability of our systems
Extending tooling that identifies flaky automated tests for resolution

You'll be set up for success if you:
Are graduating between December 2022 and Summer 2023
Have experience with a modern Javascript test framework (Cypress, Selenium, Cucumber, etc)
Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or related field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Care deeply about developer tooling, automation, test coverage, and best practices
Are thoughtful about project prioritization
Have previous software development internship experience or quality engineering experience from a previous internship or project
Enjoy collaborating with a diverse group of individuals-both technical and non-technical
Are passionate about improving healthcare and/or making a difference in the world

This is an internship based in San Francisco (but operating virtually until it is safe to be back in our offices).

One Medical is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all applicants from every background and life experience.

#LI-Remote

#LI-JC2

One Medical is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage qualified applicants of every background, ability, and life experience to contact us about appropriate employment opportunities.

Proof of COVID 19 vaccination is required for employees and contractors who interact with patients, access a shared office space or engage with other team members, except where a medical or religious accommodation applies.

Full Job Description About this Job

MotionPoint is seeking software engineer interns to work 16 to 32 hours per week for 10 weeks during the Spring (January 31 – April 8) or Summer of 2022 (May 31 – August 5) at our corporate offices in Coconut Creek, Florida. Due to Covid-19, the internship will start as remote work and may convert to onsite work at our corporate office later in the Internship. The intern will report to a software engineering manager. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in Software Engineering careers. Highlights include:

Paid internship with competitive wages of $24/hr.
Professional software development work environment.
Casual work environment.
Open-door management policy.
Potential full-time employment.

Responsibilities will include hands-on, real-world tasks and projects that will have a direct impact on the ongoing growth of our company:

Develop code for application in cloud platform using Java, JavaScript, Python and SQL.
Participate in development agile planning and prioritization.
Create and maintain continuous integration and development processes.
Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) and use DevOps tools to manager cloud infrastructure.
Participate in daily Software Development team standup meetings.

Learning Objectives:
Learn how to use version control (Git/SVN).
Learn agile methods (Scrum/Kanban).
Learn Continuous Integration Technologies (Jenkins)
Learn Software Testing methods (Unit and Integration Testing).
Use mainstream technologies in a professional setting (Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL, HTML, CSS).

Qualifications:
Current college students or graduates in Computer Science or Software Engineering with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Completed courses in Intermediate Programming (Programming II or similar) and Data Structures with at least a B grade.
At least 50 completed college credits before the start of the internship (Junior or Senior level).
Ability to code in functional or Object-Oriented Programming language. (Java/JavaScript/Python/Groovy).
Knowledge of OOP, Data Structures, Unix, and SQL.
Strong consideration given to candidates that have completed a Software Testing course. Equivalent to Florida CEN 4072.

About MotionPoint Corporation

MotionPoint’s technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization.

MotionPoint’s mission is to help brands reach, engage and serve new customers around the world. Our technology and processes solve the operational complexity and cost of website localization. We work with leading brands like AT&T, Urban Outfitters and jetBlue Airways. The real challenge of website translation isn't language-it's technology. MotionPoint's industry-leading approach eliminates the numerous technical challenges, making it effortless for brands to launch and operate translated sites in global markets. We optimize those sites for organic search and user experience, too.

Location

Coconut Creek, Florida, United States of America

position: PwC Labs - Data Science Intern Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description Our team focuses on the use of the latest automation tools, apply cutting edge analytics and data science, and explore emerging technologies like artificial intelligence as part of the daily mission to deliver new and innovative solutions to business challenges.

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

As an Intern / Trainee, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

Be curious and try new things.
Learn about how PwC works as a business and adds value to clients.
Think broadly and ask questions about data, facts and other information.
Support research, analysis and problem solving using a variety of tools and techniques.
Produce high quality work which adheres to the relevant professional standards.
Keep up-to-date with technical developments for area of specialism.
Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in materials produced.
Embrace different points of view and welcome opposing and conflicting ideas.
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.

PwC’s mission is to build trust in society and solve complex client problems. PwC Labs is a big catalyst in this strategy. We write the code for tomorrow with a better world in mind. As data scientists, we create solutions to simplify the trust exchange between people and organizations, and we build solutions to solve the more complex problems our clients face. We are skilled in all facets of data science and use our skills to drive positive change. This excites us and it should excite you too.

Job Requirements and Preferences:
Basic Qualifications:
Minimum Degree Required:
Bachelor Degree

Minimum Years of Experience:
0 year(s)

Preferred Qualifications:
Preferred Fields of Study:
Data Processing/Analytics/Science, Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, Computer and Information Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Programming, Systems Engineering, Business Analytics, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics

Additional Educational Preferences:
Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Computer and Information Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Programming, Management Information Systems, Systems Engineering, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Data Science MOOCs

Additional Educational Preferences:
Preferred cumulative GPA: 3.0

Preferred Major GPA: 3.0

Eligible students should be in the 3rd year of a 4 year degree program or in the 4th year of a 5 year program. Client service interns typically join us during the winter/spring or summer prior to their intended graduation year.

Preferred Knowledge/Skills:
Demonstrates some abilities and/or a proven record of success with identifying and addressing client needs using the following tools and programs:

Machine Learning;
Deep Learning;
Natural Language Processing (NLP);
Programming skills (Python, R, Java, SQL, Jupyter Notebooks, IDEs);
Data wrangling/modeling;
Structured data storage technologies (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.);
Unstructured data storage technologies (MongoDB, Neo4j, etc.);
Big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark/PySpark, Kafka);
Testing tool experiences (e.g., Selenium, Cucumber, Postman);
Visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Zoomdata, PowerBI);
DevOps technologies & tools (e.g., Git, Jenkins, Docker/Kubernetes);
Cloud Platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP); and,
Scrum/Agile Methodologies.

For positions in Colorado, visit the following link for information related to Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act: https://pwc.to/coloradoifsintern.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at PwC without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law. PwC is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer.

PwC does not intend to hire experienced or entry level job seekers who will need, now or in the future, PwC sponsorship through the H-1B lottery, except as set forth within the following policy: https://pwc.to/H-1B-Lottery-Policy

Full Job Description Showcase your passion in video games and join our team! We are a small, startup mobile gaming company, and we are looking to fill an available Intern position ASAP. For certain candidates, this can be used for school credit. All candidates will receive developer credit, and should use this opportunity to learn more about developing mobile products and game design. We are excited about bringing someone on board to further develop the company’s website, which will feature our Beta product that we intend to release in the near future. This is the perfect opportunity for someone who is enthusiastic about working in a fast paced environment and who is looking for hands-on experience. Responsibilities: 1) Work closely with our product and design leads to come up with a modern and creative website design 2) Notice and fix errors on the company website 3) Assist with front end development 4) Create technical documentation Qualifications: 1) Recent college graduate with BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent program. OR current college student going to school for Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent program 2) Experience with PHP/JavaScript/CSS/HTML 3) Experience with Animation and Artwork a bonus! 4) Have a genuine and passionate interest in taking an idea from concept to creation Our Culture: Our team is made up of enthusiastic people looking to build high quality and fun videogames. We are an ambitious, team-oriented group of people that are motivated by great design and the opportunity to provide fun and entertainment to the public. Pros: 1) You get to have a flexible schedule and work remotely! You are required to work at least 30 hours/week, however, how you arrange your working hours is up to you. You will be given tasks that will need to be completed by set deadlines. 2) Great opportunity to boost your portfolio! You will receive a developer credit. 3) This is a great learning opportunity! If you have an interest in mobile development, web development and/or video games, this will be a good chance for you to develop the skills necessary to have success in these highly competitive industries. 4) Possible opportunity to receive school credit for works completed. Note: We do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Service Agreement, we will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Job Type: Internship Application Question(s): Explain your passion for helping others and interest in games. Work Location: Remote

Full Job Description HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?

At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.

YOUR ROLE

We are excited you are taking the first step to craft your career at Henkel. As an intern, you will play an integral part of the team, while gaining career-building experience and making an impact at a leading global organization. As a/an IT Web Developer Intern, May 2022 – August 2022, you will:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and define project goals
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, digital products, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment
Become part of a Global DevOps team by building prototypes and take part in all stages of the product lifecycle from analysis to release
Apply your knowledge to build and develop new user-facing experiences writing reusable code and libraries
Expand your skills in A/B testing framework to improve user experiences and website optimization

YOUR SKILLS
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in a Computer Science or related discipline OR have completed your studies no more than 6 months prior to the start of the internship, with a GPA of 3.2 •
Able to intern full-time beginning May through August 2022 with the opportunity for an extension if desired •
Proficiency with two or more programming languages – Java, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Understanding around concepts like Web Services, SOA, REST APIs
Collaborating and working within Agile Teams to translate user stories into technology solutions by creating designs, functional specifications, test plans, and test cases
Analytical and problem-solving skills: ability to analyze data and develop fact-based recommendations resulting from the analysis
Communication skills: a collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit and can-do attitude
The salary range for this role is $21 to $27 per hour. This is the range that we in good faith anticipate relying on when setting wages for this position. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in Connecticut. This salary range may also be modified in the future.

Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.

position: Software Engineer Intern (CodeSentry Product Team) - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description Overview:
GrammaTech’s internship program offers students the opportunity to gain real experience in a friendly, open, and supportive environment. We choose projects based on real needs, and interns work closely with engineers to make sure that projects are completed successfully. This position is on the Product side of our business, working with the CodeSentry Team. If you are new to GrammaTech, please visit the Product tab on the website to learn more about what we do and CodeSentry, https://www.grammatech.com/

Testing: As part of the screening process, we ask candidates to take a brief programming test, either in Python or in Javascript, it will be sent within the next few weeks.

GrammaTech employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Location: Preference is to have interns located in our Ithaca, NY office for the summer. (COVID Restrictions will be considered as we get closer to the summer.)

Responsibilities:
This position is for the CodeSentry Product team. This is a new SaaS tool for finding software security vulnerabilities by analyzing binary code using machine learning techniques. We have projects in mind for the web application and the analysis side, as well as for automated testing.

Qualifications:
Required

Currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science
Excellent programming skills (C++, Python, Javascript, Java) in Linux or Windows environments
Some experience with Docker

Preferred

Angular
Kubernetes
Machine learning
Machine Code (x86, PowerPC, or ARM)
Software Security

About the Company

Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech, and we are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development–from software assurance and software integrity to cyber‐security, threat mitigation and autonomic computing. We develop new technologies and see the results of our research incorporated into tools used by engineers and security professionals worldwide.

GrammaTech was founded in 1988, with the firmly‐grounded purpose of helping today’s organizations develop tomorrow’s software. With a focus on the evolving cyber‐security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems, we tackle the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs. Executive offices in Bethesda, MD, and a Research and Development Center in Ithaca, NY, as well as opportunities for remote employment.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including health care plan options, a generous paid time off program, flexible hours, 401(k) plan with company contribution, and opportunities for professional and personal development.

GrammaTech, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Disability/Veterans/Affirmative Action employer.

Members of protected groups are encouraged to apply.

Full Job Description Overview:
About Hexagon
Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.

Hexagon’s PPM division empowers its clients to transform unstructured information into a smart digital asset to visualize, build, and manage structures and facilities of all complexities, ensuring safe and efficient operation throughout the entire lifecycle.

Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 21,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 3.8bn EUR. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.

© 2021 Hexagon AB and/or its subsidiaries and affiliates. All rights reserved.

Responsibilities:
The primary job responsibility is developing software applications for our Smart3D product line which provides a 3D modeling environment for interactively creating 3D models used for the design and construction of large scale process/power plants and marine structures. Candidates considered for employment within the PPM development organization must be well-rounded, self-motivated, and team players. Candidates must be able to adapt quickly, by learning methodologies and technologies through formal and ad-hoc training as well as on-the-job training. The candidate will be working with experienced developers and software architects to provide solutions for our Smart3D customers.

Qualifications:
Working towards a Bachelors/Master degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or a related discipline.

GrammaTech’s internship program offers students the opportunity to gain real experience in a friendly, open, and supportive environment. Currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science

Compilers

Software Security

About the Company

Innovation is at the heart of GrammaTech, and we are constantly pushing the boundaries of software research and development–from software assurance and software integrity to cyber‐security, threat mitigation and autonomic computing. We develop new technologies and see the results of our research incorporated into tools used by engineers and security professionals worldwide.

GrammaTech was founded in 1988, with the firmly‐grounded purpose of helping today’s organizations develop tomorrow’s software. With a focus on the evolving cyber‐security landscape, software hardening and intelligent systems, we tackle the most challenging software issues through a constant stream of highly innovative research and commercial development programs. Executive offices in Bethesda, MD, and a Research and Development Center in Ithaca, NY, as well as opportunities for remote employment.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including health care plan options, a generous paid time off program, flexible hours, 401(k) plan with company contribution, and opportunities for professional and personal development.

GrammaTech, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Disability/Veterans/Affirmative Action employer.

Members of protected groups are encouraged to apply.

description:
Full Job Description About JLL –
We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.
Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
About JLL Technologies
JLL Technologies (JLLT) is a specialized group within JLL. We deliver unparalleled digital advisory, implementation, and services solutions to organizations globally. We provide best-in-class technologies to bring digital ambitions to life aligning technology, people and processes. Our goal is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.

JLLT is seeking for Data Analyst, responsible for the analysis and monitoring of security events to give actionable insights. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to operate in a technically complex, fast changing, and diverse environment.

Responsibilities
Research and report on various new blockchain and crypto technology implementations
Identify the block chain use cases that can be used in the CRE industry, build test and deploy smart contracts using Solidity
Build, test and deploy DApps across more than one crypto network that can be used for CRE use cases
Work on building custom blockchains and tokens that can be used in JLL projects

Skills and Qualifications
Pursuing Masters/Bachelor’s degree in Information & Computer Science, statistics, or a quantitative discipline in science.
Basic understanding of Solidity, Python, SQL and JavaScript
In-depth understanding of any one crypto network (Ethereum, Solana, Avalanche, Polkadot, Graph, etc.)
Ability to perform remote troubleshooting and provide clear instructions and ability to work in a team or with minimum supervision
Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing in English.
Technical understanding of Staking a plus
What you can expect from us
We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.
We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

Full Job Description Looking for in-house web development interns. The job will require you to commute to Burlington, MA at least 80% of the time. Must be able to commute. We’re seeking a part-time (20 hours/week) WordPress/Web Development paid intern during the Spring (January 2022-May 2022) semester. The intern will be responsible for implementing design and technical changes to RevoluSun’s WordPress website under the direction of the Marketing Manager. Benefits: Paid at $16/hour College/school credit Training and experience in Digital Marketing, SEO, HTML, CSS, Javascript, and WordPress The ability to make a positive impact on our planet by working with a renewable energy company Duties: Formatting web pages on our WordPress website for desktop and mobile browsers Basic front-end web development; Integrating plugins and modifying code using CSS, HTML, and Javascript Performing Search Engine Optimization (SEO) audits, page speed tests, and using Google Search Console to prioritize technical issues to resolve Regular maintenance, website security, asset cleanup Your preferred skills: General web development/web design principles; UX/UI knowledge preferred HTML, CSS, and/or Javascript coding languages SEO, speed optimization, image and content optimization, keyword-search best practices preferred Requirements: Must be a college/university student or recent graduate (up to 1 year) studying computer science, web design, graphic design, marketing, communications, or related fields. The position is 20 hours/week and paid at $16/hour Must be able to commute to our Burlington, MA office RevoluSun is a locally owned and operated clean energy installer in Burlington, Massachusetts. Our close-knit team is passionate about sustainability and dedicated to spreading solar and battery storage to homes and businesses across the Commonwealth. We are an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, national origin, disability, or veteran status. At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We’re looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we’ll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. At Northrop Grumman, you’ll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career.

Your opportunities for achievement are limitless with Northrop Grumman Enterprise Services.

An internship at Northrop Grumman is unique. Sure, you’ll learn new skills, explore our enterprise, network with experts, connect with thought leaders, and finish with a resume that opens doors. But you’ll gain something even more valuable: pride in what you’ve done. Join us and launch your career. We’ll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security.

Northrop Grumman is seeking a Software Developer to join the Enterprise Services Intern Program. This position will be virtual. Virtual positions may be filled in any US State and selection will be based on the most qualified candidate.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Engineering Manufacturing Systems and Infrastructure (EMS&I) organization working on research and development networks.

The selected candidate will work in a in a distributed team environment where he/she will assist with development of a Python-based (Flask) web application, including developing input forms and back-end logic/processing of collected inputs. Help to develop automation capabilities in a network environment using primarily Ansible, for data collection and automation of network operations processes (e.g. involving network routers, switches, firewalls etc.). Research and test other automation tools, including determining fitness for a network environment and integration with existing toolset.

As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of software development specializations that may include:

Roles and Responsibilities

Basic software development experience used to develop applications using Python, JavaScript and other tools based on requirements
Use GitLab for code management including bug tracking, testing and push to production
Ability to research, solve problems and carry out tasks with minimal supervision
Create and/or update documentation / instructions as directed
Ability to work well remotely with a virtual team

Basic Qualifications

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2021.
Be majoring in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or related field
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2021
Have U.S. citizenship

Preferred Qualifications

Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Good presentation and writing/communication skills.
Self-motivated, willing to learn, and interested in working in a team environment.
Web development (HTML, CSS). Preferably experience with any/all of Python Flask web framework, Gunicorn and NGINX
Familiarity with Linux operating system (package installation/removal, file permissions, network configuration, shell environment etc.)
Powershell, MongoDB, Ansible, Git
Exposure to basic networking (e.g. routing/switching and security)

Intern Pay Range:
Bachelor’s: $21.75 to $27.00 per hour

Master’s: $32.00 to $34.00 per hour

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. Full Job Description Overview:
START YOUR JOURNEY AT GM FINANCIAL’S SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

GM Financial was founded as Americredit in September 1992 and opened its first branch office in Fort Worth, Texas. On October 10, 2010, Americredit Corp. was acquired by General Motors Company and renamed General Motors Financial Company, Inc. (GM Financial). GM Financial is the captive auto finance company and subsidiary of General Motors and is headquartered in Fort Worth, U.S. We are a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in North America, South America and Asia.

GM Financial offers many unique opportunities to talented emerging professionals in our Summer Internship Program. As an intern at our company, you’ll gain hands-on, real-world experience alongside industry-leading professionals during the 10-week program. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a professional environment and build a strong foundation for your future career.

Responsibilities:
We are looking for students who are ready to take on stimulating projects and gain exposure to a variety of industry initiatives. Our program offers:

10 weeks of work experience
Competitive salary
Executive and peer networking opportunities
Independent and team project experiences
Philanthropic activities
Career development
Opportunity to apply for full-time career positions

Strong written and verbal communication skills required. This incumbent will be required to give presentations and communicate with business leaders.

Full Job Description Career Growth, Flexibility and Collaboration!

Entrust is dedicated to securing a world in motion by enabling trusted identities, payments, and data protection around the globe. Headquartered in Minnesota, we offer our colleagues the ability to work globally, in a flexible and collaborative environment. Our team makes an impact!!

The Company: Entrust relies on curious, dedicated and innovative individuals whom anticipate the future and provide solutions for a more connected, mobile and secure world. Entrust’s technologies and expertise help government agencies, enterprises and financial institutions in more than 150 countries serve and safeguard citizens, employees and consumers.

We Believe: Securing identities is most effective when we value all identities. We are committed to ensuring that, through diversity and inclusion, the many voices that make up our communities are heard. From unconscious bias training for managers to global affinity groups that create connections both within and across our enterprise, Entrust expects and encourages all individuals to accept and respect one another. And, of course, to be themselves.

Position Overview:
This is a multi-disciplined role; the successful candidate should be able to perform hardware/software setup and validation in a variety of lab configurations. This will include various OS platforms, storage products, databases, security protection software, High Availability clustering software, etc. The candidate must be a thinker, well organized and able to work within fast paced engineering environments and is also expected via collaboration with the broader Technical Support, QA and Developer teams to contribute to the continual improvements to our processes and methodologies, all with the goal of continually improving the product quality and customer experience. This internship is located in our Sunrise, Florida office location.

How You Will Make an Impact:
Configure and duplicate customers and technology partners’ environment where necessary to integrate and validate our cryptographic solutions with that of the technology partners or customers.
Work closely with global development teams to diagnose issues and validate fixes
Learn about containers and cloud technology

Basic Qualifications:
Pursuing in bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar field
Experience working with Linux/UNIX and Windows.
Familiar with Operating Systems configuration and installation

Technical understanding of:
File Systems and Storages
Databases (SQL and noSQL)
TCP/IP networking
Client-server architected environments
Skills in C, C++, Java, Python and/or shells scripting
Experience with databases, particularly with Oracle, Sybase, DB2, or MongoDB is a plus
Knowledge of virtualized server technologies and cloud services is a plus
Excellent problem solving and debugging skills

Must have good written & verbal communication skills and excellent track record of success.

As of November 12, 2021, Covid-19 vaccination is a requirement to receive an offer of employment from Entrust in the US, subject to medical or religious accommodations. If you would like to request an accommodation, please contact accommodations@entrust.com .

Entrust is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action, Veteran, and People with Disabilities employer.

Full Job Description Our Research team is looking for a summer intern to help continually improve our core derivatives pricing and parameter models. Our Quantitative Research team works closely with traders and software engineers to create and improve pricing models, volatility surfaces, yield curves, and other quantitative elements of our automated trading systems. They find solutions to pricing problems, test those solutions with historical pricing parameters and market data, and then modify various parts of our trading system so traders can see these new models operate in the real world.

Trading at Optiver:
Our researchers collaborate closely with traders and engineers to advance the capabilities of our business and improve our market-making fundamentals. We apply our quantitative expertise and scientific training to solve tough, interdisciplinary problems. We take pride in seeing the real-time impact of solutions that allow us to stay ahead in a highly competitive industry.

What you'll need:
Currently enrolled in a PhD program in mathematics, computer science, statistics, physics, or a related field with a Winter 2022 or Spring 2023 anticipated graduation date
Experience using Matlab, R, python, or other analytical tools for quantitative research
Experience analyzing large data sets
Strong research, analytical, valuation, and modeling skills
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment authorization for this job opening

Who we are:
Optiver is a proprietary trading firm and leading global market maker. As one of the oldest market making institutions, we are a trusted partner of 50+ exchanges across the globe. Our mission is to constantly improve the market by injecting liquidity, providing accurate pricing, increasing transparency and acting as a stabilising force no matter the market conditions. With a focus on continuous improvement, we participate in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets for everyone who participates.

We accept one application per role per year. If you have previously applied to the Quantitative Research Intern position during this season and have been unsuccessful, you can reapply once the next recruitment season begins in 2022.

Full Job Description The Information Technology Intern will participate in experiences to gain professional skills and experience as a member of the IT department with responsibility for certain deliverables. The Intern will also have opportunities to interact with internsfrom other departments and interact with senior management.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Assist team with project implementation, trouble shoot and help develop solutions.
Develop skills to communicate with other IT professionals.
Perform Special Projects.
Assist with Help Desk roles and responsibilities.
Document issues and assist with resolution.

Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills: express ideas and convey technical information verbally and in writing.
Ability to read, interprets, and comprehends procedures and training materials.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and move quickly through assignments to ensure deadlines are met.
Ability to work effectively with individuals and groups to manage workload.
