High School Diploma or GED and enrollment in a college or university with a concentration in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or a related IT discipline.

Full Job Description The DevOps Team designs and develops custom software tools to support the needs and processes of Optiver's engineering teams including: Site Reliability, Linux, Windows, and the Network operations teams. We are key drivers of our principled operational culture, and use our technical expertise to influence design decisions for the entirety of our operations infrastructure. We work on a broad spectrum of problems across the entire stack, designing and creating custom solutions from the ground up.

As an intern you'll work closely with development and operations teams to identify the business problems we face, and we build the tooling and infrastructure to overcome these challenges. Get ready to apply a disciplined and principled approach to operations engineering, creating simple and robust solutions that meet the dynamic needs of our production environment. We solve problems which really matter to the business, and take pride in the quality of our solutions.

Technology at Optiver:
As an engineer, you are a maker at heart. And at Optiver you will have the opportunity to take ownership of complex problems and craft solutions—to make stuff—from day one. Every day will bring fresh challenges that demand even fresher thinking. And the proprietary trading systems you build will directly impact financial markets that—either directly or indirectly—touch the lives of millions of people.

What you'll need:
Working towards a BS or MS in Computer Science, or related technical field
Have sophomore or junior standing
Experience scripting in Python, Perl, or Ruby
Interest in operating systems and network architectures
Ability to learn quickly and autonomously
Attention to detail, diligence, and a high personal bar
Strong communication, organizational, and analytical skills
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required; we will not sponsor individuals for employment authorization for this job opening

Who we are:
Optiver is a proprietary trading firm and leading global market maker. As one of the oldest market making institutions, we are a trusted partner of 50+ exchanges across the globe. Our mission is to constantly improve the market by injecting liquidity, providing accurate pricing, increasing transparency and acting as a stabilising force no matter the market conditions. With a focus on continuous improvement, we participate in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets for everyone who participates.

We accept one application per role per year. If you have previously applied to the DevOps Software Engineer Internship position during this season and have been unsuccessful, you can reapply once the next recruitment season begins in 2022.

Full Job Description Our Story:
Founded in 2008, Hightower Advisors is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations, and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., the firm operates as a registered investment advisor (RIA).

Life as a Hightower Intern:
Our Interns have the chance to learn more about Hightower’s culture and businesses while developing practical skills necessary for future success and post-graduate opportunities. The program includes weekly conversations with C-level professionals related to career development, networking opportunities with Hightower with fellow interns and colleagues, and engaging workshops related post-graduation skills and money management. The program culminates with a final presentation given to Hightower executives, managers, and fellow interns where you will highlight your experience.

The summer internship program is a 10-week long program aimed to provide opportunities to:

Learn directly from industry experts by having weekly 1:1 conversations related to career development Attend workshops related post-college career paths and personal development Gain exposure to the financial services industry Develop a comprehensive understanding of specific team and department initiatives and goal
As an intern, you will participate in development meeting, a variety of networking, mentoring and community events, all intended to reinforce the Core Values of the Program – Education, Innovation, Leadership, Collaboration and Service.

The position is full time for the 10 weeks and is a paid, non-exempt position.

Your Future Team:
Platform and innovation provide CRM and integration services to our advisor teams and corporate users. We deliver high quality applications the processes for existing teams and also attract new acquisitions by offering flexible services they cannot achieve on their own.

What You’ll Do:
Review and document existing data structures in Salesforce environment. Identify unused resources that can be deprecated. Assist in data mapping/integration for new teams. Identify redundant data patterns.
What You’ll Bring:
Adaptability. You have the instinctive need to achieve objectives despite the hurdles that may come along the way. You are ready to join a fast-paced environment and are adaptable to constant change. Agile. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and working with competing priorities. You maintain composure and remain positive under pressure and know how to influence stakeholders even when the situation might be complex. Team player. You love collaborating and sharing ideas. You’re ready to roll up your sleeves, trust your teammates, and support as needed. Clear communicator. You communicate clearly and concisely. You’re great at getting and giving respectful and productive feedback to candidates and colleagues. Highly organized. You know how to manage multiple projects and prioritize appropriately. You create clear and logical systems and processes to support your work and that of the organization. Committed to learning. You are a current full-time, undergraduate student pursing a bachelor’s degree and have a GPA of 3.0 or above.
You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future.

Hightower requires proof of COVID-19 vaccination for all employees. Reasonable accommodations will be considered. If an employee is unable to provide proof of vaccination, mask coverings and weekly COVID-19 testing will be implemented.

What We Offer:
Hightower Swag Hybrid Model Work Schedule Summer Fridays Networking Opportunities Office space in the heart of New York City and Chicago
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER: HighTower is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer-related), gender identity or expression, genetic information including sickle cell or hemoglobin C trait, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Full Job Description As a Software Developer Intern at Sandhills Global you will have the opportunity to learn the different modern tools and technologies we use to develop industry-leading software. Each intern is placed in our developer training department where you will go through a series of tasks designed to get you familiar with our processes, procedures and tech stack that we use. Many applications within the company are web-based data driven applications that utilize .NET, SQL Server, Web APIs, and front end frameworks such as javascript, jQuery, and React.js to name a few. Once through training, Software Developer Interns are placed within an agile team in an area that fits their skills and where we have a need, at which point they can put their new training and skills to work. As part of that team you will have the opportunity to be a part of a highly collaborative team that utilizes agile practices to develop real world software, whether its for improving operational efficiency for the company, developing services we sell to customers, or working on public websites that millions of users visit every month. We are primarily a Microsoft shop, and utilize technologies in that ecosystem to solve business problems. C# is our primary coding language and what we use for any new projects, but we have many mature systems that are written in VB which we maintain. There are smaller areas that utilize other languages and technology such as PHP, Swift, Objective C, and Java for example, but these are project specific and the minority. Assume other duties as assigned. Full Job Description Internship Opportunity K&C is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineering Intern for Summer 2022. The intern will work on challenging and novel solutions in the fields of modeling and simulation, protective design, and applied research. The ideal candidate will have programming experience with C or C++ and PYTHON or another object-oriented language, have a solid understanding of object oriented as well as functional programming paradigms and understand and have an interest in software engineering best practices. Other nice-to-haves include experience developing GUI applications; solving quantitative problems; a solid knowledge of algorithms and computational complexity; and experience working with large data sets. Over the course of the internship, the intern will work with Software Engineering processes and tools, potentially new concepts in computer science, structural engineering, and other disciplines, and collaborate with engineers from many different disciplinary backgrounds. The internship opportunity is a full-time position (40 hours/week) located at K&C’s headquarters in Glendale, CA. This position is on-site and will not accommodate remote work. Potential Projects · Working on K&C’s internal meshing tools to generate high-fidelity models for finite element and RKPM simulations. · Creating GUIs to assist engineers in setting up, managing, and post-processing finite element runs. · Data analysis for post-processing finite element runs. Candidate Requirements · US Citizenship is required. · Currently pursuing a BS degree from a four-year university and entering as a college Junior, Senior or pursuing a MS/PhD by Fall 2021. Must be working towards a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics and/or Physics. · Strong math skills including linear algebra and multivariate calculus. · Experience with C or C++, Python and Numpy/Matplotlib (or a similar analysis stack), or Fortran. · Minimum 3.0 GPA out of 4.0 or equivalent. · Available to work 8-12 weeks during the summer. Desired Qualifications · Familiarity with software development best practices such as unit testing, functional testing, integration testing, CI/CD. · Experience with compiled languages such as C++ or Fortran. · Experience with computational geometry, computational physics, or data processing. · Interest in solving highly technical and challenging science and engineering problems. · Strong verbal and written communication skills with an ability to convey technical concepts. Company Description Karagozian & Case, Inc. (K&C) is an internationally recognized science and engineering consulting firm that was founded in 1945. K&C’s mission is to be the leader in innovating and fielding: 1) engineering software tools, 2) high-fidelity physics-based computational tools, 3) structural and mechanical systems, and 4) engineering services by leveraging state-of-the-art research, analysis, and design methods. K&C serves clients in the defense, counterterrorism, construction, manufacturing, space, energy, and insurance industries. Our strength lies in our team of experts and our culture of collaboration. K&C’s services commonly fall into the following functional areas of expertise. · Modeling, simulation, and analysis. · Applied research and testing. · Product and software development. · Protective design. · Threat and vulnerability assessments. Job Types: Part-time, Internship Work Location: One location

The Lavon Jordan Internship celebrates diversity and aims to foster an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse communities in which we do business. FTI hopes to provide career opportunities and development to historically underrepresented individuals to support and foster the next generation of diverse leaders in the information technology business field. This internship awards interns both full-time or part-time flexibility, competitive compensation, and an Intern Featured overview on FTI’s LinkedIn page. Ideal candidates will be located in the El Segundo/Los Angeles, CA area but qualified candidates will be considered for Work at Home. As a Digital Engineering/MBSE Intern, you will collaborate directly with the Systems Engineering and Digital Engineering teams and interface with different Engineering Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to assist in their written and creative work. This position will work with various teams both internally (FTI) and externally (customer). You will learn about the dynamics in supporting a customer-facing role and working cross-functionally within a structured MBSE-based internal team. This position involves developing and refining model artifacts, identifying organizational system processes, and working with internal/external interfaces and requirements, making it a multi-hyphenate role and an excellent learning opportunity for those wanting to gain real-work experience. * Applications or required documents will not be accepted after February 4 *th , 202 2*.* Responsibilities: Help support Systems Engineering efforts including process and product development. Two personal/professional written references. As a condition of employment, you will be required prior to starting employment to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated for COVID 19 (unless prohibited by applicable law). position: Summer College Intern - NextEra Energy Retail/Gexa Energy - Innovations Team
description:
Full Job Description Requisition ID: 58049

Gexa Energy/NextEra Energy Services is one of the fastest-growing retail energy providers, delivering innovative energy solutions with affordable electricity plans, including 100 percent renewable energy plans to more than 1.1 million residential and business customers throughout North America.

Position Specific Description

Gexa Energy is one of the fastest-growing retail electricity providers in the United States. It is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NextEra Energy Resources – the world’s largest producer of wind and solar energy, and one of the top 25 companies in the world for Innovation, according to Fortune.

This internship position will support Gexa Energy’s residential Innovation and New Product Development team, which focuses on scanning and scouting for emerging technologies, new business models, and strategic partnerships to develop innovative Energy Management products and services at the intersection of Distributed Generation, Internet of Things-connected devices, Data Science, and Artificial Intelligence.

The candidate will have exposure to a wide variety of business functions including Data Science, Pricing Analytics, System Optimization, Device Integration, Product Development, Digital Marketing, and Operations. The internship will focus on providing analytical support to one or more key business functions.

Potential Opportunities Include:
Advanced Analytics & Data Science – Leverage advanced analytics, including but not limited to AI and machine learning, to better understand and predict the impact of energy management technologies on consumer behavior and energy consumption. Build on these insights to design and price new products.
New Product Design – Conduct research and competitive analysis for, as well as plan and assist with, the deployment of cutting-edge technologies focused on energy management products and services. This role will require coding to analyze API output and enable API integration.
Digital Marketing and User Experience – Create digital content. Use Google analytics and other tools to better understand customer interaction with Gexa Energy’s web assets. Work with business unit leaders to translate insights into improvements in user experience.

Preferred Qualifications

This is a “data science role”, but we do not require nor even prefer an applicant who is exclusively focused on performing a data science function. We are looking for an applicant who is quantitatively inclined and able to code in Python. But we are also looking for an applicant who is excited about thinking critically to utilize their math and coding skills to develop innovative products that improve customers’ quality-of-life while also advancing renewable energy penetration and grid sustainability.
Our team primarily codes in Python and R and uses relational databases (SQL). Our team also relies to a lesser extent on C#, C++, Java, and NoSQL databases (MongoDB). We also do a fair amount of ad-hoc Excel modeling in product design. Applicants should feel comfortable with some of these technologies and have a desire to learn.
Applicants should have experience creating quantitative prediction models. Enthusiasm for the renewable energy space is appreciated; experience with time series modeling or machine learning is preferred.
Candidate must have excellent written and oral communication skills, along with proficiency with Microsoft Office
Understanding of customer lifecycle, research, testing, and launching new products and services

Education, Experience, Skills

Academic focus in Engineering, Informatics, Statistics, Computer Science, (Applied) Mathematics. Business Administration and Economics are a plus
A student of how technology interaction and User Experience impacts business
Excellent teamwork and project management capabilities

Job Overview

To be considered for an internship, you must be actively enrolled at a college or university as a full-time student seeking a bachelor’s degree or higher. You must also have a current cumulative GPA of 3.00 or higher (on a 0.00 to 4.00 scale).

Job Duties & Responsibilities
Assists department with assigned projects
Completes challenging projects and assignments
Presents final project to senior leadership at the end of the internship
Assumes responsibility for own travel, lodging, and transportation necessary to be available for the program
Performs other job-related duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
High school grad / GED
Maintain active enrollment in a Bachelor or higher degree program
Maintain cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Preferred Qualifications
None

Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation is a pioneer in robotics, machine automation and digital services, providing innovative solutions for a diverse range of industries, from automotive to electronics to logistics. As one of the world’s leading robotics and machine automation suppliers, we have shipped over 500,000 robot solutions. We help our customers of all sizes to increase productivity, flexibility and simplicity and to improve output quality. We support their transition towards the connected and collaborative factory of the future. ABB Robotics & Discrete Automation employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries. www.abb.com/robotics

ABB US Robotics Research and development (R&D) Center seeks intern to work at the US Robotics R&D Center in San Jose, California in various areas of research for limited periods. The internship (or part-time) may last 3 months. You will work with robotics specialists who have a wide range of experiences and competencies, including but not limited to industrial robots, mechanics, user-interface design, software development, methodologies implementation for machine learning, computer vision, etc.

Your responsibilities

Take part in the development of cut-of-edge algorithms in computer vision and machine learning for intelligent software agents to enable creation of future autonomous robotics.
Build modular software systems for image processing and machine learning.
Improve robot performance using 3D vision technology, including algorithms to identify and classify meaningful structures around a robot.
Develop and integrate advanced perception technologies for robotic applications.

Your background

Currently enrolled MS/PhD student in electrical engineering, computer science or other related engineering fields.
GPA 3.0+
Strong background in 2D and 3D vision and/or machine learning techniques, such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, etc.
Experiences in machine learning spanning supervised and unsupervised learning methods and applying ML to real world problems.
Experience with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch.
Proficiency in implementing algorithms in C/C++/ Python /GPU.
Experience with robotics, Linux, ROS, PCL, OpenCV, SLAM.
Ability to interact effectively with a global team and in culturally diverse environments.
Credibility/accountability in delivering on quality and schedule commitments.
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

ABB in the United States requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or in specific and limited circumstances, be approved for a sincerely held religious belief or a medical/disability accommodation.

Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB

ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites:
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762.

Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner.

position: (Remote) Need experienced Python developer - intern or part-time
description: Full Job Description We are a startup Wall Street company focusing on FinTech news and data analysis. The platform provides 24/7 news feed covering major financial headlines and frontier financial technology including AI, big data, and blockchain. We are recruiting intern and/or part-time Python developer to help build an advanced computing engine to grab, analyze and store trading data and integrate comprehensive news content with financial data. We are looking for: B.S in Computer Science or related Engineering major 2+ years Python coding experience (at least 7 if highest Python coding skill is 10) Experience on Angular, Node.js or Electron are big plus Familiar with the back-end architecture design and data communication protocols. Experience with Java, C# or C++ is preferred If you are interested , please contact us by email. Thanks.' ' This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative Hours per week: 10-19 Job Types: Part-time, Internship Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Ability to commute/relocate: New York, NY 10006: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: blockchain: 1 year (Required) Work Location: Remote

Full Job Description Overview

This position will focus on assisting with activities related to Sarbanes-Oxley ("SOX") based IT controls testing and Internal Audit ("IA") projects. The position will report directly to the Senior Manager, IT Internal Audit. The IA Intern is expected to work approximately 30 hours per week. There is no travel requirement in this role.

Responsibilities

SOX

Assist with activities related to Section 404 certification including:
Testing and evaluating IT internal controls in accordance with Atlas Air Worldwide's SOX methodology
Documentation of testing procedures within the IA audit documentation software tool
Keep IA management informed of the status of testing and any significant findings as they arise

Other

Perform entry level professional duties of low/moderate difficulty providing the opportunity for professional training
Perform duties to acquire knowledge of methods, procedures and standards required for successful performance
Support Senior Auditors on risk-based internal audit projects
Assist the Department's efforts to develop and implement data analytical audit techniques
Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the Company's organizational structure
Perform all other tasks as assigned; specific activities vary by assignment

Qualifications

Current enrollment in college/university required; preferably Junior/Senior majoring in Management Information Systems/Computer Science/Accounting/Finance/Business/Data Science
Excellent written and communication skills, strong analytical skills and ability to maintain composure under pressure
Attention to detail
Energetic personality
Flexibility to work in a fast paced environment
Ability to work well alone or with others
Must be able to maintain absolute confidentiality and discretion
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Proficient in Tableau or Python to help develop and implement data analytical audit techniques

The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to afford equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, place of birth, age, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other characteristic or status protected by applicable in accordance with federal, state and local laws.

Full Job Description ABOUT US: Scripps Research is ranked the most influential institution in the world for its impact on innovation. We expand basic knowledge in the biosciences, and use these fundamental advancements to develop profound innovations that improve wellbeing. Our educational and training programs mold talented and committed students and postdocs into leading edge scientists. Scientists in the institute’s five academic research departments work hand-in-hand with researchers of the Scripps Research Translational Institute and Calibr to merge foundational studies in biology, chemistry and computer science with translational science to produce pioneering drugs and advances in digital and precision medicine. Together, we cultivate new scientific leaders and expand the frontiers of knowledge to deliver medical breakthroughs to better human health around the globe. If you have a passion for making a difference, this could be your opportunity to join our transformative team.

POSITION TITLE: Intern-Research

POSITION SUMMARY:
Interns receive occupational experience, closely supervised training and are able to develop their professional skills. Duties include basic laboratory maintenance such as glassware washing; autoclaving; media, solution, and buffer prep; replenish supplies and follow experimental procedures assigned by laboratory staff.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
Part-time: Up to 19 hours per week, up to 40 hours per week when school is not in session.
This position is not eligible for benefits.
This is a year-round position, not a summer intern or other short-term internship.

REQUIREMENTS

Requires current enrollment in either a high school or college/university educational program. Undergraduate enrolled in a relevant scientific program, e.g., biological or life science, strongly preferred.

This position works in a laboratory or vivarium environment. Further details of the physical requirements of established essential functions for this position will be addressed/discussed during the interview process.

The above statements describe the level of work performed and expected in general terms. The statements are not intended to list all the responsibilities, duties and/or skills required of employees so classified, and the content herein is subject to change due to the business needs of Scripps Research, with or without notice. Furthermore, nothing in this job description shall be interpreted to be in conflict with or to eliminate or modify in any way the employment-at-will status of Scripps Research staff.

EEO Statement:
Scripps is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

COVID-19 update:
The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until restrictions change, interviews will be conducted virtually.

Full Job Description We are now looking for a Compute Performance Intern!

NVIDIA is hiring passionate, extraordinary interns to work in its Compute Developer Technology (DevTech) team. GPUs are revolutionizing high-performance computing and this internship is an opportunity to contribute to this revolution.

What you will be doing:
Research and develop techniques to GPU-accelerate leading applications in high-performance computing fields within scientific computing, computational engineering, and data science.

Ensure the best possible performance on current and next-generation GPU architectures, and drive their adoption with developers.

What we need to see:
Pursuing a BS, MS, or PhD degree from a leading university in an engineering or computer science related discipline. Specialization in telecommunications, medical imaging, machine learning, deep learning, or natural sciences is helpful.

Programming fluency in C/C++ and/or Fortran with a deep understanding of software design, programming techniques, and algorithms. While not a requirement, experience with Python is useful.

Strong mathematical fundamentals, including linear algebra and numerical methods.

Experience with parallel programming, ideally CUDA C/C++ and OpenACC.

Strong communication and organization skills, with a logical approach to problem-solving, good time management, and task prioritization skills.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers with some of the most forward-thinking, inventive, and hardworking people working here - we need your help to build our future. Are you creative, ambitious, and love challenges? We want to hear from you!

The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in Colorado. The base hourly range for this position in Colorado is $31.80 - 43.73 USD.

NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave, professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.

Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description Job Objective: A brief overview of the position.
The epidemiology/data science intern will work closely with the director and program manager to learn all aspects related to epidemiologic and biostatical analysis. The intern will collect, clean, process and analyze data for approved epidemiology studies, including the use of data science and analytical techniques, such as SQL and/or Python programming language, and descriptive analyses, correlation, simple and multiple regression, and simple analysis of variance using statistical software (e.g., SPSS, STATA, R, Power BI). This internship will also include experience working with information systems teams to create epidemiologic datasets

Essential Responsibilities
Demonstrates compliance with Code of Conduct and compliance policies, and takes action to resolve compliance questions or concerns and report suspected violations.
Assists Epidemiology Department with all research and evaluation activities, including data gathering, dataset building, data cleaning, and analysis.

position: Intern - Securely Streaming PMU Data to the Cloud
description: Full Job Description ISO New England oversees the 24/7 operation of the power grid that covers the six-states of New England and administers the region’s $10+ billion “stock exchange” for the buying and selling of wholesale electricity. The power system is constantly evolving as new technologies emerge and energy policies evolve. There is a lot going on at our organization behind the scenes to make sure the grid continuously yields reliable electricity at competitive prices while addressing the unique challenges that come along with our industry. Internship Title – Securely Streaming PMU Data to the Cloud Department – Advanced Technology Solutions Minimum Education Level: PhD Preferred Majors: Computer Science Department description: Advanced Technology Solutions (ATS) is the think tank of ISO New England. It makes strategic planning and provides technical solutions to various business units at the ISO. The department conducts R&D in power system and emerging technology, market design and operation, and software development for simulation. What will you be working on: The purpose of this project is to improve a semi-completed solution that streams PMU data to the cloud via STTP protocol with publisher/subscriber authentication. You will be responsible for: Deploying the container-based data subscriber in the cloud (AWS); Integrating the cloud-hosted data adapter with the downstream applications through scalable data streaming service; Testing the data consumer with multiple PMU data producers. How will you make an impact: Completion of this project will bring a highly reliable and safe solution to ensure the operational continuity of core control functionalities in the event of a catastrophic disruption to the on-site systems Through this work, you will gain an understanding of how a power grid is operated and how real-time system measurements are currently being and will be used in power grid operation. You will have great exposure to AWS/cloud in addition to establishing connections with power industry practitioners. What we look for in a candidate: Strong programming skills and good engineering analytical mind; Familiar with various databases, especially the NoSQL database and time-series database; Experience with microservice-based architecture design, container and container orchestration solutions; Hands-on experience in AWS or other public cloud services is preferred ISO New England has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy. Equal Opportunity: We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer. Applicants for employment are considered without regard to race, creed, color, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, age, disability, status as a veteran, Vietnam Era Veteran, or being a member of the Reserves or National Guard. Drug Free Environment: We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. Social Networking Notice: ISO New England reserves the right to review the candidate's postings on any social networking site accessible in the public domain as part of the candidate assessment process. Job Type: Internship

position: D&I Software Developer/System Engineer Summer Intern
description: Full Job Description Overview: FTI is looking for a paid Software Developer or Systems Engineer Intern to join our team during the summer of 2022. Qualified interns must be actively enrolled in a STEM discipline. This position will be filled throughout Lavon Jordan Internship program. The Lavon Jordan Internship celebrates diversity and aims to foster an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse communities in which we do business. FTI hopes to provide career opportunities and development to historically underrepresented individuals to support and foster the next generation of diverse leaders in the information technology business field. This internship awards interns both full-time or part-time flexibility, competitive compensation, and an Intern Featured overview on FTI’s LinkedIn page. This position will be in Colorado Springs, CO. * Applications or required documents will not be accepted after February 4 *th , 202 2*.* Responsibilities: The intern will support analysis, development, and modeling and simulation for space and missile defense systems. The intern will work with experienced system engineers and gain experience in software assessment, digital engineering, DevSecOps methods and processes, Agile coaching, cybersecurity, and software specifications and standards. The intern can expect to work on projects such as: Using model-based systems engineering tools to develop digital engineering products. Leveraging trade analysis tools to assess courses of action to inform stakeholder decisions. Building webpages to represent customer-facing content and aggregate division program information in a user-friendly and intuitive manner. Analyzing system information to determine compatibilities and barriers to integration. Working directly with the DevSecOps team and the senior DevSecOps manager to test system integrity. Building upon knowledge of cloud computing, i.e., AWS/GovCloud or similar. Designing, developing, testing, and debugging new features or enhancements to existing services. Education/Qualifications: Programming/scripting experience with MATLAB, C, C++ and/or Python. Basic statistics fundamentals. Experience with development and automated testing. Good interpersonal and communication skills with all levels of management. Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently. Able to work independently with geographically dispersed team. Must be a U.S. citizen and be able to obtain and maintain a Government security clearance. Must be actively pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree from an accredited institution in a STEM discipline (mechanical or electrical engineering, systems engineering, computer science, software/hardware engineering, mathematics, statistics, or physics). Must have a graduation date later than spring 2022. Be an individual from historically underrepresented populations; including, but not limited to minorities, women, persons who identify as LGBTQ+, and persons with disabilities. * Note: After you submit your application, please send the following required documents to careers@fti-net.com: Your unofficial transcript with your current GPA. Submit 500-word essay that tells us about yourself, including what experiences have made you the person you are today, what Diversity & Inclusion means to you, and how this internship would be beneficial to your personal and professional development. Two personal/professional written references. As a condition of employment, you will be required prior to starting employment to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated for COVID 19 (unless prohibited by applicable law). Reasonable accommodations that do not pose an undue hardship will be considered. Follow us: Facebook Twitter Glassdoor LinkedIn #Internship Job Type: Internship

Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman is seeking an Embedded Software Engineering intern to join the Defense Systems Intern Program. This position will be located in Plymouth Minnesota.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Defense Systems / Weapon Systems division.

Roles/Responsibilities:
Develop real time embedded C/C++ code for Microchip, Atmel, or TI microprocessor/DSP per specifications defining the capabilities and interfaces
Generate and unit test code using IAR Integrated Development Environment, Code Composer or equivalent on a custom breadboard in a lab setting. Integrate multiple software items into a reliable working system.
Contribute to creation of clear and professional plan, specification, design, test and release documentation per DoD standards
Create test scripts in Python.
Create PC applications / tools using Visual Studio, MATLAB, LabVIEW, python, etc.
Assist with generating software test cases and procedures
Write/execute acceptance test procedures for test platforms

Basic Qualifications:
Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022
Be majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering student enrolled in an accredited college program
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)
Have experience or coursework in C, C++, C#, or Java Software programming

Preferred Qualifications:
3.7 Cumulative GPA or higher
Experience or coursework with embedded software programming in C
Understand the qualities of well-designed, clear and efficient software
Comfortable in a lab environment working with tools such as function generators and oscilloscopes
Strong analytical skills and the ability to work independently and organize/prioritize job assignments and tasks
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively to management and cross functional team members
Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, rapidly changing, short turn-around environment

At Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.

The pay ranges for this specific opportunity are as follows:
Undergraduate degrees (Including graduating students planning on attending/enrolled in a full-time Master’s program): $22.75 - $28.25
Masters degrees: $33.50 - 35.75

CAMPUSJOBS

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Full Job Description At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Statistical Analyst Summer Intern

YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The primary responsibilities of this role, Statistical Analyst Summer Intern, are to:

Perform Data transformations, statistical analysis, create summary tables and visualizations.
Collaborate with study/project programming/Statistical team and computational scientists to gain understanding of the processes relevant to clinical research questions in focus.
Collect user requirements, develop specifications and identify and execute appropriate programmatic analysis methods for clinical research and development data.
At the end of the internship, the intern will present their research project to the Oncology Data Analytics department and few team members from other functions.

WHO YOU ARE

Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:

Required Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Biomedical Informatics, Information Systems or related quantitative fields.
Must have excellent oral and written communication & interpersonal skills.
A good understanding of Statistics, Data analysis, data visualization or related field as demonstrated by current or prior coursework or independent research experience.
Experience with data wrangling, data transformations, visualization and analysis.
Proficiency in one or more of the following: R / R-Shiny, Python, SAS
Familiarity with data transformations, visualization and analysis;
Must be available to work full time from May/June - August/September 2022.

Preferred Qualifications:
Good knowledge of Knowledge graphs and linked data.

YOUR APPLICATION

Bayer offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and want to impact our mission Science for a better life, we encourage you to apply now. Be part of something bigger. Be you. Be Bayer.
To all recruitment agencies: Bayer does not accept unsolicited third party resumes.

Bayer is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans

Bayer is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below.

As follow up to the initial announcement, the government has shared more details about the federal contractor guidance, including that colleagues who work for businesses that perform certain federal contracts are required to be fully vaccinated by Dec. 8, 2021. As a federal contractor, Bayer must follow and implement the federal vaccination requirements. This requirement applies to all current and future Bayer employees working in Consumer Health, Pharmaceuticals and Enabling Functions supporting either of the divisions, effective 12/8/21. Currently, Crop Science (CS) colleagues, and Enabling Function colleagues who exclusively support Crop Science, are exempt from this requirement. Full Job Description Cyber Security Intern - (Requisition ID: 210000HE)

Description

Company Overview

Nabors Industries owns and operates one of the world's largest land-based drilling rig fleet and is a provider of offshore drilling rigs in the United States and multiple international markets. Nabors also provides directional drilling services, performance tools, and innovative technologies for its own rig fleet and those of third parties. Leveraging our advanced drilling automation capabilities, Nabors’ highly skilled workforce continues to set new standards for operational excellence and transform our industry.

Nabors is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants and prohibiting discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, religion, age, color, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. To learn more about our Fair Employment practices, please refer to the Nabors Code of Conduct.

JOB SUMMARY

Nabors is seeking high performing summer intern for a cyber security role in the IT department. The primary purpose of this internship is to maintain system security for all computer systems, networks, and the enterprise infrastructure as a whole, with guidance and work direction from IT security leaders. Build your skills and knowledge in real life business scenarios, keeping IT servers and networks safe from cybercrimes. Internship based in Houston, TX.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Contributes to the development of controls and processes improving information security services
Provides input and participates in IT security strategies
Conducts risk analysis assessments of systems and technologies
Research new security tools and technologies
Prepares the analysis and reporting of security activities and performance to management
Exposure to security expertise across multiple technical platforms
Provides guidance to IT colleagues and business partners on security procedures
Gather information regarding security compliance
Develops, analyzes, maintains and monitors information from enterprise security tools
Contributes to reviews of project designs to ensure security design is compliant with policy and operational requirements
Analyzes business processes, defining and documenting security requirements
Responds to security requests and problems
Produces basic documentation of a new or proposed system
Shares knowledge effectively within the work team
Monitor security tools and identify indicators of Compromise (IOCs) and work to resolving them

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS

Must be enrolled in college working towards degree in information systems, cyber security or computer science curriculum or related discipline Demonstrate strong understanding of multiple security platforms and technologies Possesses desire to learn security principles, policies, tools and procedures Ability to complete tasks independently/in a team-oriented environment with limited guidance
Ability to communicate and work across multiple teams and departments

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge of VPN/Remote Access solutions
Knowledge of Zscaler Cloud Security
Understanding of basic endpoint anti-malware technologies
Knowledge of security standards like NIST, ISO and OWASP

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES

Accountability – Level One
Excellence – Level One
Innovation – Level One
Safety – Level One
Teamwork & Collaboration – Level One
Communication – Level One
Process & Analytic Ability – Level One
Learning Agility – Level One

TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

IT Standards, Procedures, Policies - Level Two
Data Governance - Level One
Information Security Management - Level Two
Computer Crime - Level Two
Information Security Technologies - Level Two
Information Security Architecture - Level Two
Information Security Audits - Level Two
Information Security Administration - Level Two
Network and Internet Security - Level Two

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and use hands. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job includes close vision and distance vision.

Job: IT

Primary Location: United States Of America-Texas-Houston-(Nabors Corporate Services) Houston Office

position: PwC Labs Software Engineering Intern Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description Our team focuses on the use of the latest automation tools, apply cutting edge analytics and data science, and explore emerging technologies like artificial intelligence as part of the daily mission to deliver new and innovative solutions to business challenges.

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

As an Intern / Trainee, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

Be curious and try new things.
Learn about how PwC works as a business and adds value to clients.
Think broadly and ask questions about data, facts and other information.
Support research, analysis and problem solving using a variety of tools and techniques.
Produce high quality work which adheres to the relevant professional standards.
Keep up-to-date with technical developments for area of specialism.
Handle, manipulate and analyse data and information responsibly.
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner - verbally and in materials produced.
Embrace different points of view and welcome opposing and conflicting ideas.
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.

Around PwC Labs, innovation isn’t a buzzword, it is our driving force. We’re helping to lead the charge on creating cutting-edge technology solutions by joining our technology professionals with industry thought leaders. Our solutions are designed for humans, driven by data and utilize intelligent automation. Our interns are looking past tomorrow to help deliver more value than ever in key tech competencies: Software Engineering, Data Engineering, DevOps, and Low Code Engineering.

Job Requirements and Preferences:
Basic Qualifications:
Minimum Degree Required:
Bachelor Degree

Minimum Years of Experience:
0 year(s)

Preferred Qualifications:
Preferred Fields of Study:
Computer and Information Science, Computer and Information Science & Accounting, Computer Applications, Computer Engineering, Computer Engineering & Accounting, Computer Management, Computer Programming, Computer Systems Analysis, Computer Systems Analysis & Accounting, Information CyberSecurity, Information CyberSecurity & Accounting, Information Technology, Information Technology & Accounting, Management Information Systems, Management Information Systems & Accounting, Software App, Systems Engineering, Systems Engineering & Accounting, Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, Data Processing/Analytics/Science, Business Analytics, Business Application Programming, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering and Business, Engineering, Statistics

Additional Educational Preferences:
Preferred cumulative GPA: 3.0

Preferred Major GPA: 3.0

Eligible students should be in the 3rd year of a 4 year degree program or in the 4th year of a 5 year program. Client service interns typically join us during the winter/spring or summer prior to their intended graduation year.

Preferred Knowledge/Skills:
Demonstrates some knowledge and/or success with the following tools and programs:

Programming skills (e.g., C#, Java, JavaScript, Python, Scala);
Data storage technologies for structured (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and unstructured data (e.g., Cassandra, MongoDB, Neo4j);
Front end web technology skills (e.g., Angular, React JS, Vue, SCSS);
Low-Code Development and RPA tools (e.g. Power Platform, UIPath, Automation Anywhere);
Data modeling and SQL;
Analytics tools (e.g., Alteryx, R, Jupyter Notebooks, Power Query);
Big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Kafka, Kubeflow, Spark);
Data integration tools (e.g., Snaplogic, Informatica, Apache NiFi);
DevOps technologies & tools (e.g., Git, Jenkins, Docker/Kubernetes);
Cloud Platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP);
Visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Zoomdata, PowerBI);
Testing tools (e.g., Selenium, Cucumber, Postman); and,
Scrum/Agile Methodologies.

For positions in Colorado, visit the following link for information related to Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act: https://pwc.to/coloradoifsintern.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at PwC without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law. PwC is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer.

PwC does not intend to hire experienced or entry level job seekers who will need, now or in the future, PwC sponsorship through the H-1B lottery, except as set forth within the following policy: https://pwc.to/H-1B-Lottery-Policy

Please note that, at this time, to be in-person at a PwC office, client location or PwC-sponsored events, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Full Job Description Overview:
About Hexagon
Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.

Hexagon’s PPM division empowers its clients to transform unstructured information into a smart digital asset to visualize, build, and manage structures and facilities of all complexities, ensuring safe and efficient operation throughout the entire lifecycle.

Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 21,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 3.8bn EUR. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.

© 2021 Hexagon AB and/or its subsidiaries and affiliates. All rights reserved.

Responsibilities:
Hexagon PPM is looking for a Software Development Intern with responsibilities to develop solutions for SmartPlant products.

Work as a member of an agile development team comprising software developers, certification and quality assurance, and technical writers to develop and upgrade products.
Involvement in the full lifecycle of software development using agile software development, methodologies including requirements analysis.
Designing, implementing, enhancing or maintaining functionality for Smart Construction desktop and mobile applications. These applications integrate engineering design, procurement, master schedule, and documents for cutting-edge optimization of large-scale petrochemical, nuclear, and marine construction projects with plan and progress analysis using 3D/2D visualization and animation.

Qualifications:
Junior or Senior pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering.

Applicant must have practical or class experience in some of the following applicable software technologies:

Knowledge of Windows Operating Systems
Knowledge of .Net and Visual Studio
Knowledge or interest in Angular web development
Knowledge or interest in Xamarin mobile app development
Knowledge or education of relational databases (Oracle, MS SQL Server)
Understanding of agile software development methodology (scrum)

Full Job Description The opportunity

We are looking for an exceptional Machine Learning Developer Intern to push the boundaries of what is possible in the world of Computer Vision and Machine Learning on 3D data. If you're passionate about using 3D real and synthetic data to train algorithms, crafting next-gen volumetric 3D experiences, and launching products from the ground-up, then we want to talk with you!

You'll join a team of researchers and developers with experience in Machine Learning, Computer Vision and Software Engineering. You'll participate in creating algorithm and optimization efforts to ship realtime 3D volumetric experiences.

Our vision is to redefine and reinvent how users consume sports and esports content.

What you'll be doing

Develop and train Deep Learning models on 3D real-world and synthetic data.
Keep up-to-date with industrial and academic research on Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and related technologies.
Build robust microservices for model training and inference that can process gigabytes of data and scale to millions of users.
Write clean, maintainable production code and review application and test code.

What we're looking for

Students currently enrolled in university or college and pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, or an equivalent technical field
Students completing the second to last year of study or in the penultimate year
Experience with taking state-of-the-art models and algorithms from the lab to reality.
Experience in Computer Vision and Machine Learning, especially in 3D pose estimation, segmentation, multi-view geometry, 3D reconstruction, and related areas.
Hands-on experience building production models with TensorFlow, PyTorch, or equivalent deep learning framework
Experience with the Unity game engine and synthetic data generation.

You might also have

MS/Ph.D. in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, or an equivalent technical field
Published research in areas of Machine Learning at major conferences and/or journals
Experience with Unity's Machine Learning stack (Perception toolkit, Barracuda).

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

description:

ABB seeks interns to work at its US Research Center in Raleigh, NC in various areas of research for Summer 2022. You will work with power grid specialists to develop cutting edge research and development related to distribution grid applications and modeling.

Your responsibilities

Conduct literature survey and benchmarking to assess the state of art methods for a given problem
Actively participate in applied research activities in the area of distribution automation applications and modeling, resulting in proofs of concept, prototypes, patents, and/or academic publications
Contribute to the promotion of the application of distribution grid intelligence within ABB’s customer industries, and develop prototype solutions using digitalization technologies such as digital signal processing and Matlab/Python scripting and programming
Model and simulate of different types of grid following and grid forming converters using Matlab/Simulink
Model and simulate power electronics based microgrid and distribution systems at various fault scenarios using Matlab/Simulink
Support simulation system data output mechanisms, e.g., transfer simulated data to usable output format for Matlab or other systems
Debug, test and validate core algorithms in a mockup or full-blown setup

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US- PhD or master’s student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering (PhD preferred)
GPA 3.0 +
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
Digital signal processing and programming experience (e.g., Python, Java, C/C++) is a plus
Knowledge and experience with utility communication technologies (DNP3 and IEC 61850 GOOSE/Sampled Values)
Knowledge of distribution system apparatus and operations is a big plus
Knowledge of different types of grid following and grid forming converters and control
Knowledge of power system fault protection
Modeling and simulation expertise in Matlab/Simulink
Knowledge and experience with distribution system modeling systems and their related data output mechanisms
Familiarity with GridLAB-D or other modeling environments is a plus
Willingness to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of new technologies and application domains

Full Job Description About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.
Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.
The Experience
Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.
The Main Responsibilities

As a Technical Writer Intern in our North America Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our Technician Support Center team to provide assignments, programming, and order support for Mass Markets Field Technicians Tasks during the 10 weeks will have the possibility to include leveraging creative ways to communicate, train and refresh process in a clear, concise and user-friendly manner. Technical writer interns will have the potential to write new process documents and converting legacy documents to current template. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions, learn quickly, and work in a team environment. Other tasks may include:

Assist with programming for internet and phone lines Create new library for team documents Partner with frontline to understand processes and systems
What We Look For in a Candidate

Education Requirements
o Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023.
o Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Business, English, Public Relations, Operations Management, Marketing Analytics, or a related field

Proficiency and understanding of:
o Well versed in technical writing, word processing applications, Sharepoint, TEAMS and Visio.
o Knowledge creating videos for communication process changes a plus.
o Microsoft suites is a must
o Lean background is a plus

Professional Attributes
o Strong drive for results and taking initiative
o Ability to be inquisitive, critical thinking, and adaptable-
o Attention to detail with strong organizational skills
o Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions
o Strong written and verbal communication skills
o Comfortability in group settings with giving presentations
o Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation.

Work Setting
o Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Remote- Work From Home
o Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August)
o Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations)

What to Expect Next

After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you!

Full Job Description It's called an internship, but that doesn't quite do it justice. As a hardware engineering intern at Optiver, your fingerprints will be on every aspect of the FPGA development process—from researching new low-latency techniques to designing cutting-edge hardware to mastering trading strategies and software. The results of your work will be visible every day in the form of strategies with nanosecond response times, highly parallelized algorithms and customized low-level networking.

Technology at Optiver:
As an engineer, you are a maker at heart. At Optiver you will have the opportunity to take ownership of complex problems and craft solutions—to make stuff—from day one. Every day will bring fresh challenges that demand even fresher thinking. The proprietary trading systems you build will directly impact financial markets that—either directly or indirectly—touch the lives of millions of people.

What you'll need:
Working towards a BS or MS in Computer Science, or related technical field
Junior standing
Experience designing FPGAs in VHDL or Verilog
Knowledge of digital simulators and self-checking test benches a plus
Ability to communicate and collaborate with developers, traders, and business operations on a daily basis
Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required; we will not sponsor individuals for employment authorization for this job opening

Who we are:
Optiver is a proprietary trading firm and leading global market maker. As one of the oldest market making institutions, we are a trusted partner of 50+ exchanges across the globe. Our mission is to constantly improve the market by injecting liquidity, providing accurate pricing, increasing transparency and acting as a stabilising force no matter the market conditions. With a focus on continuous improvement, we participate in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets for everyone who participates.

We accept one application per role per year. If you have previously applied to the Hardware Engineering Intern position during this season and have been unsuccessful, you can reapply once the next recruitment season begins in 2022.

Full Job Description Overview:
About Hexagon
Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, and quality across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, safety, and mobility applications. Our technologies are shaping urban and production ecosystems to become increasingly connected and autonomous – ensuring a scalable, sustainable future.

Hexagon’s PPM division empowers its clients to transform unstructured information into a smart digital asset to visualize, build, and manage structures and facilities of all complexities, ensuring safe and efficient operation throughout the entire lifecycle.

Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 21,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 3.8bn EUR. Learn more at hexagon.com and follow us @HexagonAB.

© 2021 Hexagon AB and/or its subsidiaries and affiliates. All rights reserved.

Responsibilities:
Hexagon PPM is looking for a Software Development Intern with responsibilities to develop solutions for SmartPlant products.

Work as a member of an agile development team comprising software developers, certification and quality assurance, and technical writers to develop and upgrade products.
Involvement in the full lifecycle of software development using agile software development, methodologies including requirements analysis.

Designing and supporting implementation of enhancements including new functions, features and enhancements of the Smart ® Completions software product. Enhancements include development of the cloud web-based solution which include GUI, reports, and dashboards. The mobile solution is continually being grown into a world class solution using the latest technologies. Duties may include interaction with the planning/design organization, product requirements analysis, prototyping, and supporting the implementation and testing functions on all new releases and iterations.

Qualifications:
Junior or Senior pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering.

Applicant must have practical or class experience in some of the following applicable software technologies:

Knowledge of JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML and CSS
Knowledge of some web client technology such as Angular, React or Vue
Knowledge of .Net Web API
Knowledge of C#
Knowledge of Reporting (e.g.: Crystal reports) and dashboard software
Knowledge of Xamarin
Understanding of agile software development methodology (scrum)

Full Job Description Intern Job Posting

The J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI) is a dynamic non-profit research organization using science to impact the world. Our research groups focus on human genomic medicine, infectious disease, plant, microbial and environmental genomics, synthetic biology and biological energy, bioinformatics, and software engineering. We are looking for self-motivated, inquisitive minds to work with us in asking and finding the answers to questions that advance the field of genomics.

Position Summary:
JCVI’s Synthetic Biology group has openings for internships to assist the ongoing work on developing engineered strains for algal fuel applications.

What You Will Do:
Conduct PCR & analyze results with electrophoresis
Conduct E. coli & algal transformation
Maintain algal cultures
Clean glassware
Prepare samples for GC-MS analysis
Work with our investigators to reach research goals
Present your data at lab meetings

Requirements:
Current Undergraduate Student
Entry level applicants strongly encouraged
Some Biology or Computer Science coursework, or relevant experience
Ability to work independently, while respecting the needs of a larger team
A commitment to scientific discovery
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Part-time commitment (up to 20 hours per week)

J. Craig Venter Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic or status.
