position: SAP iXp Intern - Mobile Platform /Android Engineering
description:
Full Job Description What we offer

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

About the SAP Internship Experience Program
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP iXp Intern - Mobile Platform /Android Engineering
Location: Bellevue – please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings
Expected start date to end date: November 2021

In this role, you’ll:
As an Engineering Intern for the Mobile team, you will learn to innovate, design, and develop mobile solutions for enterprise customers.

We will be patient and guide you to help you develop the skills that will make you a successful engineer in the future.

Responsibilities:
Work in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, including analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging, documentation and deployment.
Work with other mobile team engineers to collaborate and share best practices.

Who you are:
Required Skills:
A Junior or Senior in college studying Computer Science, Engineering, or other related fields
Basic knowledge of iOS or Android programming
Great programming skills, with some using Swift or Kotlin, XCode, Android Studio, or other relevant products.
Some school projects or GitHub projects will be great to see

Other Useful Skills:
Familiarity with web technologies such as REST, OAuth, SAML, GraphQL, etc. is a bonus

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

SAP DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

We are SAP

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

Our inclusion promise

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Requisition ID: 305761 | Work Area: Software-Design and Development | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Student | Employment Type: Intern |

Full Job Description Experience Level: Internship
Job Type: Intern

Location:
TX - Richardson, US

Requisition ID: 2415

Qorvo is All Around You! We manufacture innovative RF solutions at the center of connectivity to enable high-performance applications for advanced wireless devices, wired and wireless networks and defense radar and communications for 5G networks, cloud computing, the Internet of Things, and other emerging applications. We are a global company thriving on a culture of innovation, diversity, and inclusion. Our people are always at the core of Qorvo’s innovation. Qorvo is a place to stretch your imagination and push boundaries to achieve success. Learn more about Top 10 Reasons to make a career at Qorvo.

This is a full-time Intern position located in Richardson, TX. The position will be temporary in nature and last approximately 3-months.

NOTE: Because this is a student internship, candidate must be a currently enrolled student in a degree-seeking accredited program.

Job Summary:
Intern will assist in the development and maintenance of test automation software, create software to automate lab/data processes, conduct maintenance of new instrument drivers, create documentation of software / usage and update and maintain software build process.

Desired Degree: Computer Science / Electrical Engineering Degree.

Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in BS/MS Computer Science or Electrical Engineering program, Completed software design courses, Familiar with C#/.NET and/or LabVIEW software, 3.0 GPA or higher Must be a US Person or Green Card Holder
The above duties are not intended to be all-inclusive or permanent. The requirements of the position may change based on the business need. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change.

Work Authorization: Because this position is located at our Richardson, TX location where we have contracts with the US government, qualified candidates must have US Worker status. This usually means they are a US citizen or hold a green card. Students on visas such as F-1 or J-1 d

Position Location: Richardson, Texas

Remote Eligible: No

#LI-CB1

Qorvo is an E-Verify Employer. For more information, please see the Right to Work and E-Verify Participation posters.

Full Job Description SHAPE THE FUTURE OF MOBILITY FROM DAY ONE.

This position is part of our Advanced Safety & User Experience segment.

Responsibilities:
Support the Engineering team with:
Develop best in class cloud and embedded software using C/C++, Java and QNX/Linux expertise

Deploy and maintain the software for future enhancements

Work with Tier 1 Automotive Supplier’s business leads and engineering specialists to identify, capture and refine system requirements.

Provide robust and elegant software solutions

Must Haves (Basic Qualifications):
Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's Engineering degree

Nice to Haves (Preferred Qualifications):
Experience doing development in embedded development, i.e. in constrained environment

Good knowledge of QNX operating system

Good understanding of interprocess communication in QNX (or equiv) solutions

Understanding of Linux operating system

C, C++

Linux Curl functions, LibCurl

Linux Command Library

Good understanding of the HTTP & FTP protocols

Knowledge of Transport Layer Security (TLS)

Knowledge of Singleton in C, C++ \

Knowledge of STL containers for C++

Gdb (gnu debugger)

Messaging, ZeroMQ

OMA-DM, FUMO, preferred, not a requirement

Scripting languages - Groovy, Python

Unit testing

Knowledge of C Unit and CPP Unit for unit testing

Experience with State machines implementation

Experience using Certicom libraries for implementing TLS

GOF Design patterns

Good understanding of data structures

Eclipse IDE

Preferable to have knowledge of CAN vehicle networking, not required though

Experience working with VM's Experience

Likely experience designing 3+ products

Aptiv Rewards and Advantages:
Learning and development opportunities

Discount programs with various manufacturers and retailers

Recognition for innovation and excellence

Opportunities to give back to the community

Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world

Relocation assistance may be available

About Advanced Safety & User Experience

Advanced Safety & User Experience encompasses our deep expertise in centralized computing platforms, advanced safety systems and automated driving, while acknowledging the growth in areas that enrich the in-vehicle experience.

Some see differences. We see perspectives that make us stronger.

Diversity and Inclusion are sources of innovation and creativity, both of which are essential to Aptiv’s success. Everyday our diverse team comes together, drives innovation, pursues solutions, and meets challenges using their unique abilities, perspectives and talents, changing what tomorrow brings. When you join our team, you’ll get encouraged to think boldly, express your viewpoint and innovate as a matter of habit.

Some see technology. We see a way to make connections.

At Aptiv, we don’t just see the world differently; we work to change reality. That means developing technology that rewrites the rules of what’s possible in the pursuit of making transportation safer, greener and more connected. Today there are more than 180,000 of us globally, located in 44 countries, and united by one mission. Join the movement and together, let’s change tomorrow.

Candidates for positions with Aptiv must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description RLI is growing and our award-winning IT team is growing too! Our IT strategy and direction are critical components of RLI’s growth and future. We are looking for highly talented people at all levels, who bring great skills, experience, collaboration, a desire for learning new things, and who thrive on making a difference. We are dedicated to imagining, designing, delivering, and supporting technologies that enable our business teams to provide great products, distribution, superior claims service, and strong financial operations in ways that keep us growing and positioned as the industry leader we have been for 25 years and counting! When you join RLI, you become part of our entrepreneurial culture and the energy it fosters. You’ll have the freedom and the authority to do things your way, the resources to help make it happen and a share of the rewards when we succeed together. At RLI, we’re always looking to hire and develop tomorrow’s leaders. Internships at RLI are design to provide college students the opportunity to gain hands on experience working on challenging projects allow you to gain real-world experience and training. You will be part of an existing team, providing impact to our business with meaningful projects and assignments. Come and apply the knowledge that has been learned via your undergraduate program and gain exposure via an Agile work environment at Enterprise scale! In addition to day-to-day assignments, you will interact with interns from other departments and build relationships through planned education and social activities. You will also have exposure to the senior leaders at RLI and have a capstone project due at the end of the summer. A valuable experience to enhance your education and help launch the rest of your career! Position Purpose As a Data Engineer, the intern would have a variety of potential jobs available based on a candidate’s background experience and expertise. Duties would entail working in a team setting in order to design, implement and test web-based solutions, utilizing RLI’s technology fabric and Microsoft .Net technologies. Candidate would gain exposure to best practice Enterprise patterns for application architecture and systems integration. The project that the intern will be assigned to will be based on annual and quarterly planning and what the current priority of project work is during the intern period. Some examples include: Create, enhance and support data services, ETL processes and reports for Enterprise Data. Document services, models, processes and policies. Modernize data warehouse architecture and visualization capability. Retire legacy artifacts and process. Assist with implementation of new Data Platform infrastructure. Principal Duties and Responsibilities Solid understanding of foundational knowledge appropriate for a developer: object-oriented programming, database management systems, etc. Additional knowledge specific to RLI’s technology is a plus, for example, specific .Net experience and web-based development. Demonstrated success in a classroom setting, natural curiosity and desire to learn. Excellent communication skills, ability to work in a team. Complete project-based assignments as assigned. Work closely with experienced professionals, colleagues, and fellow interns to gain knowledge and develop team-building skills. Attend planned education and social activities in order to gain an understanding of the RLI business as well as network. Education and Experience Preferred Majors: Computer Science; Management Information Systems; Computer Information Systems; or related discipline. Minimum 3.0 GPA required. Knowledge, Skills and Competencies Demonstrates excellent writing and grammar skills. Is self-motivated and highly organized. Has the ability to multi-task and meet quick deadlines. Is creative, flexible and has a results-oriented work ethic and attitude. Thrives in team environments. Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Full Job Description This program is a 10-week full-time opportunity that starts on June 6th, 2022 and will end on August 12, 2022.

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive, and patient focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

You will gain valuable work experience and participate in:
Projects that contribute to the success of our business Community service activities Professional development workshops Mentorship and networking opportunities Interaction with senior leaders
And our corporate interns have an increased likelihood to receive an offer for a future role with CVS Health.

About this business area:
Our team supports emerging technology research and innovation.

What you will do:
xxx xxx
Required Qualifications
See Educational Requirements Below Knowledge of programming languages such as Java and Python Familiarity with AI or Blockchain or AR/VR or IoT
COVID Requirements
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.

If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health.
If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated.

Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated leadership experience. Examples include: active roles in student or social organization activities, sports, or school or work-related projects Strong written and verbal communication skills Internship or work experience in related field such as business or healthcare Have an interest in obtaining full-time position within CVS Health upon graduation
Education
Be currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree Have an anticipated graduation date between September 2022 and August 2023 Have a major(s)/concentration in Information Technology, Computer Science or related major
Business Overview
At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

position: College Intern – May 2022 (Grad – Analytics Solution Architect – Cary, NC – EL)
description:
Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the IS Service Manager and is located in Cary, North Carolina.

Solution Architect Intern needed to train and receive hands-on experience providing solutions to ABB’s complex Data Architecture spanning from ERPs to our Global cloud-based Data Warehouse and through the delivery of analytics solutions.

Your responsibilities

Define the technical IS solution and ensures alignment with other modules and surrounding IS applications through cooperation and collaboration with IS solution architects
Engages in requirement analysis to decide which requirements are covered by available, standard functionalities, for which functionality enhancements are needed and for which functionality workarounds are accepted
Supports validation and prioritization of incoming business demand in collaboration with the relevant IS Service Manager and/or Global IS Domain Architect
Reviews the functional and technical use case specifications
Collaborates with users in projects and problem management to maintain, develop and deploy the best feasible and most cost efficient IS solutions/services for the business
Troubleshoots solution configuration, product and/or performance issues
Advises project delivery on analytical approaches, from build, test, or delivery ensuring adherence to best practices and IS delivery framework

Your background

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US, majoring in Analytics, Computer Science or related field
GPA 3.0 plus
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
In a degree program in Computer Science, IT, or a related field
Problem solving abilities, specifically, identifying and resolving issues in IS technologies
Understanding of cloud-based analytics and BI solutions
Experience in objectively evaluating IS solutions and making recommendations
Experience in translating business requirements into IS capabilities and solutions
Strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of the overall context of business processes and IS technologies
Experience in project planning and execution as well as economic aspects of system management and life cycle

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

ABB in the United States requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or in specific and limited circumstances, be approved for a sincerely held religious belief or a medical/disability accommodation.

Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB

ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites:
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762.

Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner.

Full Job Description Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.
This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

You can apply to the job with this email address: product_quality_engineer_internship_668050a62us@ivy.greenhouse.io
Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview:
Artificial intelligence enabled automation is one of the biggest opportunities of our generation. Here at TuSimple, it is more than just an opportunity, it is our mission. Led by a group of elite researchers and engineers, we are working tirelessly to bring safe and reliable autonomous trucking to reality. This transformative endeavor can reduce energy consumptions in the trucking industry, make goods and services more affordable and efficient, and eventually, profoundly improve the quality of life of everyone, including you and I.

Role Responsibilities

Support leading product quality activities, data & schedule for assigned projects
Assessing program / project risks and proactively driving mitigation plans
Partnering with Engineering to define product acceptance plans based on Product Requirement Documents (PRD's) and Product Quality Plans (APQP) for flow down to internal build locations and partner organizations
Providing Quality team's risk assessment as the advocate for the customer experience in programs and projects at a across functional team level
Analyzing field feedback reports, data and information on product performance to provide insights and direction to development teams that help key product and process decision making
Helps dept QE to form the independent unbiased communication channel and link from field quality and customer experience to engineering, development and problem resolution owners
Follow ups and helps formulates actions plans to address top risk, issues and problems that are quantifiable and measurable
Supports driving continual product performance improvement through robust issue and problem management
Monitor tracks and helps defining, monitoring, and owning product Quality KPIs and metrics
Supports Change Control Board: Impact analysis and approvals

Experience & Skills Required

B.S. - Computer Science, Engineering or Business
Data Analysis skills
Computer skills

Intern Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Work on significantly important and mission critical projects
Extensive individual support through TuSimple's Mentorship Program
Competitive salary
High full-time employment return rates after completion of Internship Program
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is onsite)

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day
Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more

TuSimple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

Full Job Description What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Side-Channel Analysis Intern – Product Security

The Role:
The AMD Product Security Office (PSO) is seeking experienced side-channel analysis interns.

Can you look at an oscilloscope trace and identify which crypto algorithm is being executed? If so, we are looking for you. The Cryptographic Engineering Team is embedded within AMD’s Product Security Office. The team's mission is to ensure that the AMD platforms provide state of the art cryptographic solutions to provide the ultimate protection of our users data.

The role entails evaluating our current cryptographic implementations, DPA/DEMA/DFA countermeasure evaluations and designs.

The Person:
You must be passionate about all aspects of side-channel analysis of cryptographic implementations. As a Side-Channel Analysis Intern, you will work closely with our Product Security Engineering team to perform side-channel analysis of AMD roadmap SoCs/products. You are expected to have excellent communication skills as you will be expected to communicate complex cryptographic topics to various disciplines to internal and external stakeholders. Deep understanding of crypto primitives and tradeoffs between area/performance/security of hardware and software implementations is crucial.

Desired Experience:
Deep understanding of state-of-the-art cryptographic algorithms and protocols.

Experience with side-channel attack countermeasures.

Understanding of mathematical and implementation aspects of Cryptography.

Understanding of micro-architecture and RTL design of cryptographic IP blocks.

Good coding skills and familiarity with languages such as Verilog, C, C++, Python, Assembly etc;

Theoretical/practical knowledge of common power/electromagnetic side channel and fault injection attacks (e.g. SPA, DPA, CPA, SEMA, DEMA, DFA, etc.).

Ability to develop and perform power/EM side channel analysis and fault injection attacks.

Knowledge of statistical techniques used in side-channel attacks such as TVLA, t-test, Pearson correlation, etc.

Key Responsibilities:
Participate in pre- and post-silicon cryptographic hardware side channel analysis and fault injection techniques.

Contribute towards typical side-channel analysis of common cryptographic hardware IP and associated silicon countermeasures.

Work with other architects, designers, and verification teams to contribute, review, and provide feedback to relevant side-channel resistant specifications and designs.

Prototype and evaluate algorithms and architecture using C/C++/RTL based architectural models.

Document assumptions with technical clarity and communicate results.

Participate in the security verification of side-channel resistant cryptographic implementations.

Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with side-channel analysis equipment/platforms/tools.

Experience working on pre-silicon power side channel analysis.

FIPS 140-3 non-invasive attack experience.

Academic Credentials:
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Mathematics.

Location: Austin, Texas, US

AMD is a government contractor and subcontractor. As required by Executive Order, our US employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 regardless of the employee’s work location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), subject to such exceptions as required by law. Full Job Description We are seeking a full-time Business Analyst Web Intern for our headquarters in the greater Kansas City area. In this role, you will be responsible for learning and training to become a Web Business Analyst by working with Agile Scrum teams to provide documentation, quality control and business analysis for Garmin’s Internet Applications.

Essential Functions

Learn to develop requirements using user stories, acceptance criteria, business and workflow analysis that align with business objectives
Learn to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to general understanding, and distinguish user request from underlying true needs
Proactively communicate and collaborate with development and QA team to ensure user stories, acceptance criteria and testing criteria documentation is complete
Partner with leader or mentor in collaboration with developers, UX team, and product manager to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs
Learn to work with language services and country business units to ensure translations are correct
In collaboration with mentor, perform performance and functionality testing and work with users to ensure appropriate testing is completed
Learn to create and manage documentation for all stages of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for application
Gain understanding of how to provide support to users to document requirements
Learn to implement documentation standards and perform documentation tracking and review
Learn to navigate conflicting priority scenarios, focusing on maximizing the value provided to Garmin and the end customer
Gain critical knowledge in identifying dependencies and collaboration with other analysts and agile scrum team
Refind ability to visualize, present and defend a given strategic recommendation and idea

Basic Qualifications

Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Telecommunications, Business or related field
Excellent academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 as a general rule)
Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Demonstrates ability to solve basic technical problems independently

Desired Qualifications

Outstanding academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.5)

Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran’s status, age or disability.

Full Job Description About CCC

CCC Intelligent Solutions Inc. is the technology platform for the P&C insurance economy. CCC technology, insights, and support connect industries – insurers, automotive manufacturers, collision repairers, parts suppliers, lenders, fleet operators and more – to advance decision-making, productivity, and customer experiences for thousands of clients worldwide. Clients leverage CCC’s network management, data management, AI, operational workflows and customer experience solutions to efficiently scale, interact, transact and achieve their unique business objectives. CCC was ranked a best mid-sized company to work for by Forbes (2019). BuiltIn Chicago, Austin and LA named CCC a top place to work in 2020 & 2021. Diverse perspectives and experiences are core to CCC’s success and award-winning culture of more than 2,000 employees worldwide. We hold inclusion as a core value and are committed to celebrating and cultivating the diversity of our team. With a 40+ year track record of innovation, CCC’s tenacious spirit and growth mindset turn next generation technology into real world solutions and empower team members to expand their knowledge and potential. Headquartered in Chicago, CCC has 7 locations worldwide and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CCCIS). Find out more about CCC Intelligent Solutions by visiting cccis.com.

Job Description Summary

Our program is designed to #CCCJumpstart your career! Joining CCC as a Java Software Engineering, you will gain experience with software engineering, product development, and understanding the business case for why our products are created

Job Duties

Teams/Projects:
Parts Team: this team has anything to do with a supplier’s auto parts. CCC has different systems that handle each of the three major groups of parts: OEMs (Original Equipment Manufacturers), After Markets, and Recycle. The members on the parts work on an ecommerce application for auto parts that is integrated with 1200 suppliers where we provide electronic quotes to make finding and buying parts easies.

CCC Product Applications: total loss valuation, commercial, and salvage application. Teams are BAs, Developers, and QAs. Fully Agile. This product application suite is one of our two founding products here at CCC.

Workflow Team: Workflow is a core product of CCC. All the applications are web developed along with mobile iOS and Android SDK applications. The Workflow Team is one of the largest teams here at CCC and looking for product development minded individuals. Members of this team are typically full-stack engineers.

Integration Team: This team is responsible for API gateway and integrations with CCC and its customers and partners, like insurance carriers, OEMs, and Third-party providers, by tailoring the customers’ workflow with CCC’s APIs.

This opportunity is a paid, full-time, summer internship. There will be two cohorts for the upcoming CCC Jumpstart class:

May 16th, 2022 – August 12th, 2022 June 13th, 2022 – September 2nd, 2022
Qualifications

If you are currently in your Senior year (or in the final year of your program) at a top-tier university and have demonstrated excellence in your academic studies, this opportunity is right for you. We are looking for candidates who offer strong collaborative skills and work well with a team. Below is a list of technologies we use and are potentially looking for

Java OO development

HTML, CSS, Angular, and Vue

Experience in Spring, REST (consuming/creating), and Hibernate

Exposure/experience with building and consuming API’s

Full Job Description Position Description:
The General Dynamics Land Systems Intern Program provides an opportunity for students looking to start or continue the transition from academia into industry. Our three-month internship assignments provide compensation based on area of study and class standing, and have the students embedded in key functional areas of our business, getting real-world experience and mentorship from seasoned professionals.

Logistics Test & Evaluation (LT&E) Engineering:
Logistics Engineering – Intern duties will involve participating in Logistics Engineering activities on Tracked or Wheeled Vehicle Programs. The intern will work alongside a Logistics Engineer (LE) or Logistics Project Lead to obtain exposure to elements of Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) which produce Logistics products that enable operation and repair of vehicles by field/test support employees and the military. The intern will support ILS activities to include project planning/management, logistics design, maintenance planning, maintenance task analysis, diagnostic/troubleshooting task analysis, spare parts analysis and provisioning of spares, technical publications development, hands-on validation and verification of procedures in our on-site maintenance shop, Logistics software development, and operations support. The intern will participate in internal production meetings, conduct analysis and create technical data (in accordance with Military Standards and Army Regulations) to be used in Logistics products, and participate in and observe procedure validation/verification alongside external customers and users.
Position Requirements:
Pursuing a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineer, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or other engineering disciplines from an accredited 4 year university or college

Attain at least a Sophomore status based on the university/college's class standing requirements at the start of the internship.

Preferred - GPA of 3.0 or higher.

Must be at least 18 years old.

Must be a U.S. Person (i.e. a lawful permanent resident of the U.S.).

Must successfully pass standard pre-employment screens and must provide an original transcript from their school before their first day of employment.

Must be able to complete a minimum of a full time, 3 month assignment

Must demonstrate good written and oral communication skills

Proficiency with MS Office applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment

Demonstrated effective time management skills

Some travel (<5%) may be required

Full Job Description Why Crestron?:
At Crestron Electronics, Inc we build the technology that integrates technology.

We are proud to be the largest and most recognized brand in automation and control solutions, and the premier technology partner for fortune 500 businesses globally.

Our products are integrated into new high-tech commercial buildings’ to include some of the most exciting real estate throughout the world. Utilize and manage Microsoft Azure

Full Job Description VW. Two letters. Endless opportunities.

The internship program at Volkswagen Group of America Chattanooga Operations is intended to provide college / university students and recent graduates the opportunity to use and develop skills they have learned in the classroom by working at our state-of-the-art production facility, and to provide experience and insight into the culture.

Our internships are full-time positions (40 hours/week). Candidates will be expected to be available to work during normal business hours (Monday – Friday; exact hours will vary by position and some positions might require work on Saturdays). To be eligible for the internship program, candidates are required to be enrolled at an accredited post-secondary educational institution, or have graduated from one within the 6 months prior to the start date of the internship. Full Job Description Symetra has an exciting opportunity join our team as a Derivatives Strategist Intern!

About the program

At Symetra, we share a deep commitment in bringing value to underserved communities and people, and helping them take steps toward financial freedom. That’s our way of describing people that are able to be and to do what they value. Our interns work on real, meaningful projects that contribute toward our goal, and are an important part of our Symetra community.

Symetra's Internship Program for Summer 2022 is entirely remote - all interns will learn and work in a virtual setting. The internship duration is 12 weeks.

Your responsibilities may include

Assist with the analysis of equities and rates derivatives trading and hedging strategies
Assist with the development and automation of analytical tools for trading decision making coding in VBA, Python, SQL including machine learning algorithms
You will gain exposure to Bloomberg and NumeriX for equity and fixed income derivatives pricing

Your education, experience and skills

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science with Quantitative Finance exposure through coursework (Black-Scholes model) OR Quantitative Finance major
Experience with programming in Python, Excel VBA, and SQL Database and machine learning algorithms
Willingness to learn
Strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills

What our Interns have to say

“I could not have asked for a better company culture and group of people for my first internship.” – 2021 Intern
“Overall, the program was run extremely well, especially for it being done virtually. I would highly recommend this program to people looking for an internship.” – 2021 Intern"My experience with the Symetra Internship program was amazing! Not only did I have tons of opportunity for my own learning and growth, but I felt fully supported and encouraged along the way." – 2021 Intern
What we offer you

We don’t take a “one-size-fits-all” approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better—both at work and at home

Fully remote internship. We ship you the equipment you need to enjoy work from the comfort of home
Wellness program offering employees a variety of resources crafted to assist you in reaching and maintaining your optimum health
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and take advantage of immediate vesting and company matching up to 6%
Paid time away accrual

Work Authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

We empower inclusion

At Symetra, we embrace and celebrate diverse experiences, identities and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and creates a stronger, more innovative company. Learn more here.

In a complex industry, we strive for clarity.

Symetra is a dynamic and growing financial services company with 60 years of experience and customers nationwide. In our daily work delivering retirement, employee benefits, and life insurance products, we're guided by the principles of VALUE, TRANSPARENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY. That means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and honestly so people understand what they're getting, and we build products that stand the test of time. We work hard and do what's right for our customers, communities and employees. Join our team and share in our success as we work toward becoming the next national player in our industry.

position: College Intern (MS/PhD) – Machine Learning Grid Application Intern, Raleigh, NC, US Research Center (Summer 2022)
description:
Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the Research Department Manager and is located in Raleigh, North Carolina.

ABB seeks interns to work at its US Research Center in Raleigh, NC in various areas of research for Summer 2022. You will work with power grid specialists to develop cutting edge research and development related to applying machine learning techniques for distribution grid applications.

Your responsibilities

Conduct literature survey and benchmarking to assess the state of art methods for a given problem
Actively participate in applied research activities in the area of machine learning applications for edge computing environments, resulting in proofs of concept, prototypes, patents, and/or academic publications
Investigate the application of machine learning for power distribution system/grid applications that satisfies customer requirements for creating value-added services and offerings
Contribute to the promotion of the application of machine learning concepts within ABB, and develop prototype solutions using digitalization technologies, including the frameworks and analytics libraries
Debug, test and validate core algorithms in a mockup or full-blown setup

Your background

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US - PhD or master’s student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering (PhD preferred)
GPA 3.0 +
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
Practical knowledge of advanced analytics (machine learning in particular) and corresponding technology stacks (both commercial and open source)
Familiarity with edge computing technologies and platforms
Experience in data processing, data collection and cleansing
Design and implementation experience in multiple platforms and languages e.g. Java, Python, Matlab, C/C++, R
Experience in data analysis and machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g. Scikit learn, TensorFlow, Theano, Caffe, PyTorch, Pylearn2, etc.)
Willingness to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of new technologies and application domains
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently in English
Background in electricity distribution is a plus

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

Full Job Description At Dominion Energy we love our jobs. That’s right. Love. Every day we go to work filled with passion to be excellent, to creatively problem solve and to innovate. These are exciting days for energy companies, and Dominion Energy aims to shape the future of energy in America. We are looking at all of our work with fresh eyes, retooling everything we do, in every part of the company, to operate more sustainably and to deliver energy more reliably than ever. We are looking for interesting, independent thinkers and doers who can help shape the culture of a forward-looking company that’s proud of its rich legacy. Are you a change agent? Do you think differently? Do you want to fall in love with your job? If you answered “yes,” then read on!

At this time, Dominion Energy cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position.

Job Summary

Dominion Energy is seeking students to participate in our internship program.

This position requires the ability to provide expert and creative solutions to user problems to ensure customer satisfaction and productivity
Research, resolve, and respond to complex questions received via telephone calls, customer generated tickets or emails, and provide support on electronic services, in accordance with current standards
The position provides support for software as described in triage documentation and has proficient knowledge of Windows10, and Office 365
The position requires close coordination with all IT infrastructure and support teams

Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities & Experience
Must have strong computer knowledge and skills with demonstrated ability to learn and utilize IT software programs
Must have strong customer service and problem solving skills; coursework or experience in PC hardware functionality, desktop imaging , network monitoring tools, Microsoft Office project support preferred
Proficient knowledge of Windows10, and Office 365
Must be able to lift 50 lbs
Must have good verbal and written communication skills; be able to work independently and as a team
Must live within a reasonable commuting distance of the assigned work location and have reliable transportation.
Education Requirements
Must have completed the first year of a 4 year college or university or 2 year college program in computer science, information technology, computer information systems, or related field
Minimum GPA of 2.5
Must be graduating Spring 2023 or later.
Licenses, Certifications, or Quals Description
Working Conditions
Office Work Environment 76 -100%
Other Working Conditions
Test Description
No Testing Required

Export Control

Other Information

We offer excellent plans and programs for employees. Employees are rewarded with a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package which may include: health benefits with coverage for families and domestic partners, vacation, retirement plans, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, and much more. To learn more about our benefits, click here dombenefits.com.

Position Description

Cadence Design Systems is seeking a highly motivated graduate student for internship in the Product Engineering team. The Cadence Digital and Signoff Group will offer you a dynamic environment in which you will work with innovative R&D and Customer Engagement teams to influence the development of software tools for advanced chip design platforms.

Position Responsibilities

Designing, developing, troubleshooting and debugging software programs on Unix/Linux platforms
Supporting Customers in performing successful tapeouts of their System-on-chip designs

Position Requirements

Currently enrolled in MS studies in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
Experience with EDA tools and with VLSI design; familiar with digital implementation challenges including clock tree synthesis, routing, optimization and silicon signoff.
Experience with UNIX and/or LINUX platforms
Strong knowledge of Tcl
Strong analysis and problem solving skills
Excellent algorithmic skills
Team Player
Strong ability and passion to learn
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

Full Job Description If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.

Requisition ID: 65920

Job Description

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.

The Role:
Join our enthusiastic, collaborative broadcast applications engineering team. Our product focus is in the area of connected automotive embedded systems including core components of the infotainment system. The software role directly impacts how drivers interact with their vehicles through the audio and visual subsystems. Experience in this niche technology can create a lifetime of exciting and challenging opportunities owing to the annual volume of vehicle production (approx. 100 Million vehicles) and due to the connected car revolution which is centered around the infotainment unit in every vehicle.

Responsibilities

Key Areas of Contributions in this Role:
Looking for a student who is available from June - August 2022
Develop code blocks which drive core functions of automotive infotainment systems
Write software drivers and/or generate scripts for automation of lab test equipment
Clearly document all work for internal and external stakeholders

Experience

Preferred Education, Experience & Capabilities:
Working toward undergraduate or graduate degrees in electrical engineering, computer engineering, or computer science Strong knowledge of engineering fundamentals and methodologies, logical thinking Excellent written and verbal presentation skills Meticulous technical documentation authoring and editing skills Knowledge of software programming tools (Visual Studio, C++, C#, Python or other scripting languages). Must be comfortable working on challenging problems while being capable of prioritizing and organizing tasks Driven to meet deadlines while held accountable to high quality standards Positive attitude with strong desire for customer and team success to maintain our winning culture.
The following skills are NOT required but interest in any of the following topics will encourage success
Automotive infotainment, head-unit design, remote tuner modules (RTM) or other automotive application (ex. ADAS) Analog or digital communications, wireless, or RF applications (ex. video, IOT, ultrasound / radar / lidar, 5G) Firmware design, working with API’s, GUI design DSP concepts (ex. FFT, convolution, digital filters, SDR / software defined radio) Embedded software (ex. Rasberry PI, SPI/I2C, Linux, ARM, HiFi, MCU, DSP) Scripting language (ex. Tcl, Python, Perl) Programming including object-oriented (ex. C, C++, C#); also machine language / assembly Dataflow programming (ex. LabView) Simulation (ex. Spice, Matlab / Mathworks, Simulink, AWR) Hands-on lab experience (ex. Oscilloscope, spectrum analyzer, network analyzer, signal generator, GPIB, Rhode&Schwarz, Audio Precision) Integrated circuit design concepts (ex. FET’s, low-noise amplifiers, mixers) Mixed-signal blocks (ex. ADC’s, DAC’s) Software development processes (ex. devOps, Agile methodology, Atlassian JIRA / Confluence) Terrestrial or satellite radio broadcast transmitter or receivers (ex. AM / FM / HD Radio / DAB / DRM / XM / Sirius / OFDM, analog or digital demodulation) Audio measurements, Audio system design (ex. SINAD, THD)
Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

position: College Intern – May 2022 (Grad – Analytics Solution Architect – Cary, NC – EL)
description:
Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the IS Service Manager and is located in Cary, North Carolina.

Solution Architect Intern needed to train and receive hands-on experience providing solutions to ABB’s complex Data Architecture spanning from ERPs to our Global cloud-based Data Warehouse and through the delivery of analytics solutions.

Your responsibilities

Define the technical IS solution and ensures alignment with other modules and surrounding IS applications through cooperation and collaboration with IS solution architects
Engages in requirement analysis to decide which requirements are covered by available, standard functionalities, for which functionality enhancements are needed and for which functionality workarounds are accepted
Supports validation and prioritization of incoming business demand in collaboration with the relevant IS Service Manager and/or Global IS Domain Architect
Reviews the functional and technical use case specifications
Collaborates with users in projects and problem management to maintain, develop and deploy the best feasible and most cost efficient IS solutions/services for the business
Troubleshoots solution configuration, product and/or performance issues
Advises project delivery on analytical approaches, from build, test, or delivery ensuring adherence to best practices and IS delivery framework

Your background

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US, majoring in Analytics, Computer Science or related field
GPA 3.0 plus
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
In a degree program in Computer Science, IT, or a related field
Problem solving abilities, specifically, identifying and resolving issues in IS technologies
Understanding of cloud-based analytics and BI solutions
Experience in objectively evaluating IS solutions and making recommendations
Experience in translating business requirements into IS capabilities and solutions
Strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of the overall context of business processes and IS technologies
Experience in project planning and execution as well as economic aspects of system management and life cycle

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

ABB in the United States requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or in specific and limited circumstances, be approved for a sincerely held religious belief or a medical/disability accommodation.

Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB

ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites:
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762.

Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner.

Full Job Description Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.
This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

You can apply to the job with this email address: product_quality_engineer_internship_668050a62us@ivy.greenhouse.io
Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview:
Artificial intelligence enabled automation is one of the biggest opportunities of our generation. Here at TuSimple, it is more than just an opportunity, it is our mission. Led by a group of elite researchers and engineers, we are working tirelessly to bring safe and reliable autonomous trucking to reality. This transformative endeavor can reduce energy consumptions in the trucking industry, make goods and services more affordable and efficient, and eventually, profoundly improve the quality of life of everyone, including you and I.

Role Responsibilities

Support leading product quality activities, data & schedule for assigned projects
Assessing program / project risks and proactively driving mitigation plans
Partnering with Engineering to define product acceptance plans based on Product Requirement Documents (PRD's) and Product Quality Plans (APQP) for flow down to internal build locations and partner organizations
Providing Quality team's risk assessment as the advocate for the customer experience in programs and projects at a across functional team level
Analyzing field feedback reports, data and information on product performance to provide insights and direction to development teams that help key product and process decision making
Helps dept QE to form the independent unbiased communication channel and link from field quality and customer experience to engineering, development and problem resolution owners
Follow ups and helps formulates actions plans to address top risk, issues and problems that are quantifiable and measurable
Supports driving continual product performance improvement through robust issue and problem management
Monitor tracks and helps defining, monitoring, and owning product Quality KPIs and metrics
Supports Change Control Board: Impact analysis and approvals

Experience & Skills Required

B.S. - Computer Science, Engineering or Business
Data Analysis skills
Computer skills

Intern Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Work on significantly important and mission critical projects
Extensive individual support through TuSimple's Mentorship Program
Competitive salary
High full-time employment return rates after completion of Internship Program
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is onsite)

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day
Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more

TuSimple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

Full Job Description RLI is growing and our award-winning IT team is growing too! Our IT strategy and direction are critical components of RLI’s growth and future. We are looking for highly talented people at all levels, who bring great skills, experience, collaboration, a desire for learning new things, and who thrive on making a difference. We are dedicated to imagining, designing, delivering, and supporting technologies that enable our business teams to provide great products, distribution, superior claims service, and strong financial operations in ways that keep us growing and positioned as the industry leader we have been for 25 years and counting! When you join RLI, you become part of our entrepreneurial culture and the energy it fosters. You’ll have the freedom and the authority to do things your way, the resources to help make it happen and a share of the rewards when we succeed together. At RLI, we’re always looking to hire and develop tomorrow’s leaders. Internships at RLI are design to provide college students the opportunity to gain hands on experience working on challenging projects allow you to gain real-world experience and training. You will be part of an existing team, providing impact to our business with meaningful projects and assignments. Come and apply the knowledge that has been learned via your undergraduate program and gain exposure via an Agile work environment at Enterprise scale! In addition to day-to-day assignments, you will interact with interns from other departments and build relationships through planned education and social activities. You will also have exposure to the senior leaders at RLI and have a capstone project due at the end of the summer. A valuable experience to enhance your education and help launch the rest of your career! Position Purpose As a Security Specialist, the intern duties would entail phishing, cyber event, and malware analysis. You will learn how a security team functions, and the technology used to defend RLI from cyber-attacks. You will work with a security team that passionate in what they do and eager to share their knowledge. The project that the intern will be assigned to will be based on experience and current projects. Principal Duties & Responsibilities Knowledge of security fundamentals Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team. Demonstrated success in a classroom setting with a natural curiosity and desire to learn. Complete project-based assignments as assigned. Work closely with experienced professionals, colleagues, and fellow interns to gain knowledge and develop team-building skills. Attend planned education and social activities in order to gain an understanding of the RLI business as well as network. Education & Experience Preferred Majors: Computer Science, Cyber Security, or related discipline. Minimum 3.0 GPA required. Knowledge, Skills, & Competencies Demonstrates excellent writing and grammar skills. Is self-motivated and highly organized. Has the ability to multi-task and meet quick deadlines. Is creative, flexible and has a results-oriented work ethic and attitude. Thrives in team environments. Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Self-motivated
Ability to provide on-call support as needed

position: Consulting Marketing and Enablement Summer Intern
description:
Full Job Description Meet Our Team:
At Pega, we offer hands-on experience in a unique and fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills and be able to prioritize and multitask in a challenging and dynamic environment.

As a key contributor to the Pega Consulting Marketing and Enablement team, you will work closely with Pega Consulting global teams throughout the summer to provide support on marketing and enablement content.

Picture Yourself at Pega:
Pega’s internship program is the perfect platform to help students transition their academic knowledge into a successful professional career. We push great students to be better, we encourage them to take on the biggest challenges, and we also believe that great ideas can come from anyone or anywhere, irrespective of hierarchy or location. The purpose our internships are to provide students with the opportunity to gain valuable business skills, work on real-time, impactful initiatives, and collaborate on a global scale, all while earning a competitive compensation.

What You'll Do at Pega:
Interface with a variety of functions within Pega Consulting, Offer Management, Marketing and Pega Academy to address cross-functional initiatives
Participate in service marketing activities that make prospective customers receptive to starting a client and services relationship with the company;
Participate in the development of digital enablement material such as videos and animated PowerPoints
Update documents and templates as required

Who You Are:
You are passionate about technology and eager to develop your skills within an enterprise environment while working with an industry-leading product. You think outside the box and use your experience for more effective collaboration.

Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in Business Management or Marketing with courses in computer science, mathematics or statistics and interested in a career in high tech and/or consulting
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Outstanding written, verbal communication, and interpersonal skills
Drive for continuous learning and development
Video editing experience nice to have (e.g., Camtasia, Adobe products, iMovie)
Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, and Outlook
Highly organized with ability to multi-task
Results driven with a can-do attitude

Pega Offers You:
Opportunity to work with diverse global teams on real-time, impactful projects and initiatives
Professional development seminars and meet & greets with Pega’s CEO and Founder, and Executive Leadership Team through our “Coffee Break Series”
Participation in Pega and intern specific events such as social events, volunteer opportunities, group projects, team outings, etc.
Potential for a full-time offer
Structured manager and mentor program
Competitive salary and perks
Casual and fun environment
