Full Job Description Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.
This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

You can apply to the job with this email address: product_quality_engineer_internship_668050a62us@ivy.greenhouse.io
Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview:
Artificial intelligence enabled automation is one of the biggest opportunities of our generation. Here at TuSimple, it is more than just an opportunity, it is our mission. Led by a group of elite researchers and engineers, we are working tirelessly to bring safe and reliable autonomous trucking to reality. This transformative endeavor can reduce energy consumptions in the trucking industry, make goods and services more affordable and efficient, and eventually, profoundly improve the quality of life of everyone, including you and I.

Role Responsibilities

Support leading product quality activities, data & schedule for assigned projects
Assessing program / project risks and proactively driving mitigation plans
Partnering with Engineering to define product acceptance plans based on Product Requirement Documents (PRD's) and Product Quality Plans (APQP) for flow down to internal build locations and partner organizations
Providing Quality team's risk assessment as the advocate for the customer experience in programs and projects at a across functional team level
Analyzing field feedback reports, data and information on product performance to provide insights and direction to development teams that help key product and process decision making
Helps dept QE to form the independent unbiased communication channel and link from field quality and customer experience to engineering, development and problem resolution owners
Follow ups and helps formulates actions plans to address top risk, issues and problems that are quantifiable and measurable
Supports driving continual product performance improvement through robust issue and problem management
Monitor tracks and helps defining, monitoring, and owning product Quality KPIs and metrics
Supports Change Control Board: Impact analysis and approvals

Experience & Skills Required

B.S. - Computer Science, Engineering or Business
Data Analysis skills
Computer skills

Intern Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Work on significantly important and mission critical projects
Extensive individual support through TuSimple's Mentorship Program
Competitive salary
High full-time employment return rates after completion of Internship Program
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is onsite)

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day
Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more

TuSimple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

description:

We welcome students who share their ideas, perspectives and understanding of new technologies with our teams. In return, we provide the opportunity to work on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time Intern, Data Analyst – Unit Train Supply Chain position in Homewood, Illinois for summer 2022.

Job Summary

The Intern, Data Analyst – Unit Train Supply Chain is responsible for interacting with and assisting multiple groups of CN employees with data analysis for various ongoing projects. The incumbent is initially working with the Senior Manager, Bulk Operations to gain experience in Supply Chain Management and to determine the data needed to complete tasks.

Major Responsibilities

Perform collection as to the performance of the CN network (Train and Car data) Analyze data for performance gaps Identify opportunities that will close gaps in the supply chain Evaluate objectives against actual performance Analyze performance targets for individual supply chain Set-up goals for future performance Update daily and weekly scorecard for commodity
Requirements

Proficient knowledge of mathematical skills Ability to analyze, model and interpret data Problem-solving skills Methodical and logical approach Makes informed and timely decisions to get things done Accuracy and attention to detail Interpersonal skills Ability to work in a team Strong communication skills, both written and verbal (English) Must be able to work in Canada Ability to work remotely if required
Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science Study in applied statistics or data analysis* Technical Skills Required: SQL, XML, Javascript, Python, Tableau, Power BI Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset
#IC

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN requires all new employees in the United States to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

Sealed Air is in business to protect, to solve critical packaging challenges and to leave our world better than we found it. Come and join our Sealed Air digital team! We deliver digital product solutions through our culture of being customer obsessed and driving business value. Our Agile teams works off innovative features and drive creative designs with unique problem solving. We are looking for someone who shows a passion to learn and make a difference to our digital product solutions. You will be part of an empowered team learning technology and contributing to a project that makes a difference to Sealed Air.

Experience in unit testing

Experience with AWS, Cloud Foundry, or Gitlab

IoT architecture and/or engineering background

It is our responsibility to leverage what we have to affect positive and meaningful change for our communities and planet using Sealed Air’s global resources and expertise.

Full Job Description The Office of Human Resources & Employee Experience (HREX) is responsible for ensuring the Department complies with applicable labor and employment laws and City and Agency rules and policies. The unit provides guidance to managers and employees on a variety of topics including recruitment, employment, civil service, job and organizational design, labor relations, youth programs, benefits, wellness, performance evaluations, salary administration, timekeeping, and time and leave administration.

The Workforce Planning Intern (College Aide) shall:
Assist with research on matters relating to labor, industry, and employment Assist with civil service administration, including, but not limited to, classification and job evaluations, exam development, and list calls Perform candidate qualification reviews for civil service titles Verify compliance with laws, rules, regulations, and policies pertaining to civil service and employment
Minimum Qual Requirements

For Assignment Level I:
Matriculation at an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in a college or graduate school.

For Assignment Level II (Information Technology):
Matriculation at an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in a college or graduate school with a specific course of study in information technology, computer science, management information systems, data processing, or closely related field, including or supplemented by 9 semester credits in an acceptable course of study.

For Assignment Level III (Information Technology Fellow):
Matriculation at an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in a college or graduate school with a specific course of study in information technology, computer science, management information systems, data processing, or other area relevant to the information technology project(s) assigned, including or supplemented by 9 semester credits in an acceptable course of study. Appointments to this Assignment Level will be made by the Technology Steering Committee through the Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications.

SPECIAL NOTE
Maximum tenure for all Assignment Levels in the title of College Aide is 6 years. No student shall be employed more than half-time in any week in which classes in which the student is enrolled are in session. Students may be employed full-time during their vacation periods.
Preferred Skills

Graduate student in organizational psychology, labor relations, public administration, or a related field

Computer literacy
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office with proficiency in Outlook, Word, and Excel
Ability to work with sensitive information in a professional and confidential manner
Exceptional communication and planning skills
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
To Apply

For Non-City/External Candidates: Visit the External Applicant NYC Careers site (nyc.gov/jobs/search) and search for the specific Job ID #

For Current City Employees: Visit Employee Self-Service (ESS) to view and apply for available positions. Click on Recruiting Activities, Careers, and search for the specific Job ID #

No phone calls, faxes or personal inquiries permitted.
NOTE: ONLY THOSE CANDIDATES UNDER CONSIDERATION WILL BE CONTACTED
Hours/Shift

Up to 17 hours/week when school is in session
Up to 35 hours/week during school break
Work Location

Office of Human Resources & Employee Experience
280 Broadway, 6th Floor, N.Y.
Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Full Job Description Symetra has an exciting opportunity join our team as a Derivatives Strategist Intern!

About the program

At Symetra, we share a deep commitment in bringing value to underserved communities and people, and helping them take steps toward financial freedom. That’s our way of describing people that are able to be and to do what they value. Our interns work on real, meaningful projects that contribute toward our goal, and are an important part of our Symetra community.

Symetra's Internship Program for Summer 2022 is entirely remote - all interns will learn and work in a virtual setting. The internship duration is 12 weeks.

Your responsibilities may include

Assist with the analysis of equities and rates derivatives trading and hedging strategies
Assist with the development and automation of analytical tools for trading decision making coding in VBA, Python, SQL including machine learning algorithms
You will gain exposure to Bloomberg and NumeriX for equity and fixed income derivatives pricing

Your education, experience and skills

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science with Quantitative Finance exposure through coursework (Black-Scholes model) OR Quantitative Finance major
Experience with programming in Python, Excel VBA, and SQL Database and machine learning algorithms
Willingness to learn
Strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills

What our Interns have to say

“I could not have asked for a better company culture and group of people for my first internship.” – 2021 Intern
“Overall, the program was run extremely well, especially for it being done virtually. I would highly recommend this program to people looking for an internship.” – 2021 Intern"My experience with the Symetra Internship program was amazing! Not only did I have tons of opportunity for my own learning and growth, but I felt fully supported and encouraged along the way." – 2021 Intern
What we offer you

We don’t take a “one-size-fits-all” approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better—both at work and at home

Fully remote internship. We ship you the equipment you need to enjoy work from the comfort of home
Wellness program offering employees a variety of resources crafted to assist you in reaching and maintaining your optimum health
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and take advantage of immediate vesting and company matching up to 6%
Paid time away accrual

Work Authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

We empower inclusion

At Symetra, we embrace and celebrate diverse experiences, identities and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and creates a stronger, more innovative company. Learn more here.

In a complex industry, we strive for clarity.

Symetra is a dynamic and growing financial services company with 60 years of experience and customers nationwide. In our daily work delivering retirement, employee benefits, and life insurance products, we're guided by the principles of VALUE, TRANSPARENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY. That means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and honestly so people understand what they're getting, and we build products that stand the test of time. We work hard and do what's right for our customers, communities and employees. Join our team and share in our success as we work toward becoming the next national player in our industry.

Learn more about our careers at www.symetra.com/careers

position: College Intern (MS/PhD) – Machine Learning Grid Application Intern, Raleigh, NC, US Research Center (Summer 2022)
description:
Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the Research Department Manager and is located in Raleigh, North Carolina.

ABB seeks interns to work at its US Research Center in Raleigh, NC in various areas of research for Summer 2022. You will work with power grid specialists to develop cutting edge research and development related to applying machine learning techniques for distribution grid applications.

Your responsibilities

Conduct literature survey and benchmarking to assess the state of art methods for a given problem
Actively participate in applied research activities in the area of machine learning applications for edge computing environments, resulting in proofs of concept, prototypes, patents, and/or academic publications
Investigate the application of machine learning for power distribution system/grid applications that satisfies customer requirements for creating value-added services and offerings
Contribute to the promotion of the application of machine learning concepts within ABB, and develop prototype solutions using digitalization technologies, including the frameworks and analytics libraries
Debug, test and validate core algorithms in a mockup or full-blown setup

Your background

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US - PhD or master’s student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering (PhD preferred)
GPA 3.0 +
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
Practical knowledge of advanced analytics (machine learning in particular) and corresponding technology stacks (both commercial and open source)
Familiarity with edge computing technologies and platforms
Experience in data processing, data collection and cleansing
Design and implementation experience in multiple platforms and languages e.g. Java, Python, Matlab, C/C++, R
Experience in data analysis and machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g. Scikit learn, TensorFlow, Theano, Caffe, PyTorch, Pylearn2, etc.)
Willingness to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of new technologies and application domains
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently in English
Background in electricity distribution is a plus

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

position: Undergrad TDP Database Software Engineering Intern (Summer 2022)
description:
Full Job Description Your Opportunity

Do you want to work on automating databases and services that process hundreds of billions of transactions per month? Do you aspire to design, build, and deploy database systems across several environments that are highly reliable, performant, and easy to operate via automation? If you find these challenges electrifying, we encourage you to apply!

As an Intern at New Relic, you will join our Product team for a full-time, paid internship opportunity beginning in either May or June and spend 10-12 weeks working as a valued member of our engineering team.

What You’ll Do

As a Software Engineering Intern, you provide our customers with real-time insights, so they can innovate faster! You will work with a team that is building a brand-new set of product components for New Relic’s customers. This involves creating high-throughput backend services and flexible, easy-to-use front-end components.

This is a chance to work on a team that values both collaboration and individual focus to solve difficult engineering problems. We support each other to do our best work through positive communication and continuous improvement.

Your Qualifications

Must-have:
Be currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program from an accredited university
Completed at least two years of an undergraduate program
Returning to your degree program after the internship
Have experience working in Postgres, MySQL, Python, AWS, and/or Azure
Driven to learn new technologies

Nice-to-have:
Degree focus in Computer Science preferred
Participation in university clubs
Examples - SWE, WiCS, SHPE, NSBE, Hacker teams, and any others focusing on the professional development of your computer science skills
Leadership experience in clubs or on projects
Exposure to mob coding

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this internship. Note that we do not sponsor candidates for O-1, F-1, or J-1 visas, or candidates who require commencement of an H-1B "cap case" petition for future work authorization.

About Our Internship Program

We offer a paid 10-12 week internship program for students to join us on our journey to create a more perfect internet! During your internship, you’ll work on real-world projects that will make an impact on our business, and develop practical skills that you can apply throughout the rest of your career. You’ll have the opportunity to:

Participate in Executive leadership roundtables
Work with a dedicated mentor through our formalized mentorship program
Gain useful skills through professional development trainings
Connect with your intern community through meetings, projects, and social events
Learn about the company and our mission to instrument, measure and improve the internet
Showcase your work via a final presentation to management

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional, and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. The Flex First model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or a combination of both.

Read more about Flex First and New Relic’s vaccine policy as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace in light of the COVID-19 pandemic.

About Us

New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based observability platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.

Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. description:
Full Job Description Company details

We are more than just a leader of financial technology.

Our mission is to contribute to the financial world of tomorrow. Accessible to each of us, everywhere, anytime. We help banks to navigate challenging and changing times, by guiding them through their digital transformation with our solutions and a strong commitment to collaboration.

Driven by an agile culture, we welcome talented individuals who want to undertake and manage transformative, unique and challenging projects. Our goal is to foster excellence, both individually and collectively. We encourage diversity in all its forms.

Ranked among the Top 10 European FinTechs by the independent firm IDC, Sopra Banking Software is a fast growing company.

We are looking for the talents of tomorrow who want to support our projects and our values.

With 5,000 experts spread over 4 continents, we have a gloabl foot print - come join our international teams.

Function

As a part of the Marketing team, at SBS you will be required to work in collaboration with all the other teams within the company.

We are looking for future talents to be a part of our company in the following areas:

Product Strategy and Marketing : launch Go-to-Market strategy for a product line and acquire new customers

Market Research : support us and work with our community of analysts to understand the industry and future trends to invest in

Content Marketing : produce and distribute quality content and support us in being positioned as a though leader

Digital Marketing: grow our digital presence and boost campaigns. We are looking for digital campaign & project managers who want to learn the science of digital marketing

Branding, & Communication : Increase our brand awareness and support our communication strategy, internally and externally.

Design & Graphics: from graphic design to web design to video editing, elevate your design and graphic expertise to help us succeed as the most valuable brand in our market

Full stack developer : join our dev team to support internal projects such as demo, web assets, and other IT systems.

Profile

You are passionate about new technologies (FinTech space would be a plus) and like to keep yourself updated with the latest market trends

You are proactive, easily adaptable, a team player as well as autonomous as this will allow you to be successful in the internship within a young and motivated team, in a company in full growth.

You have a prior experience in marketing, events, communication or in the field of digital advertising is a plus.

You are fluent in English

You are in your last year of a Master's degree (6 months) or in an MBA program (2 months). We will adapt the duration and mission according to the profiles.

Offer

A unique internship opportunity where you will be able to participate in the implementation of projects, both in a team and independently.

Language

English

Qorvo is searching for an intern in the Procurement team. This position will assist in data collection, data analysis, standardization, process documentation and reporting for the Procurement team. Projects require coordination with global sites to provide corporate alignment and standardization.

Full Job Description Your Opportunity

At New Relic, we provide our customers with real-time insights, so they can innovate faster. Our product, The .NET Agent, observes interactions between applications and the .NET framework and makes it visible to our customers to help with the performance and reliability of their product.
.NET expertise: We write instrumentation to help our customers observe their complex systems. We are sensitive to the usage of resources and the performance of our codebase. We have the opportunity to maximize our knowledge of the .NET Framework, Azure, IIS, MVC, Entity Framework, MSMQ, WCF, and async.

This is an opportunity to work on a team that values both collaboration and individual focus to solve difficult engineering problems. We support each other to do our best work through positive communication and continuous improvement.

Your Qualifications

Must-have:
Exposure to systems programming, CLR, and .NET internals
Familiarity with software design patterns, principles, and practices
Knowledge of C#, .NET, and the Microsoft environment
Good organizational skills: ability to organize, estimate, and deliver on commitments
Be currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program from an accredited university, and have completed at least two years of an undergraduate program
Returning to your degree program after the internship
You can work well independently and collaboratively when part of a team
You like to learn new technologies

Nice-to-have:
Exposure to cloud-based software (Azure, AWS, or otherwise)
Familiarity with different datastores (eg. MongoDB, PostgreSQL, etc.)
Experience with open-source projects

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this internship.

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional, and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. The Flex First model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or a combination of both.

Read more about Flex First and New Relic’s vaccine policy as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://newrelic.com/blog/how-to-relic/future-of-work

Our Office

Our office is in the center of downtown Portland, situated in a thriving tech community in the Pacific Northwest. We enjoy easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up.

About Us

New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based observability platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.

Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award-winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.

Our Hiring Process

New Relic takes seriously our stewardship of the data of our thousands of customers worldwide. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification.

We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/FCO%20poster2020.pdf

position: College Intern – May 2022 (Grad – Analytics Solution Architect – Cary, NC – EL)
description:
Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the IS Service Manager and is located in Cary, North Carolina.

Solution Architect Intern needed to train and receive hands-on experience providing solutions to ABB’s complex Data Architecture spanning from ERPs to our Global cloud-based Data Warehouse and through the delivery of analytics solutions.

Your responsibilities

Define the technical IS solution and ensures alignment with other modules and surrounding IS applications through cooperation and collaboration with IS solution architects
Engages in requirement analysis to decide which requirements are covered by available, standard functionalities, for which functionality enhancements are needed and for which functionality workarounds are accepted
Supports validation and prioritization of incoming business demand in collaboration with the relevant IS Service Manager and/or Global IS Domain Architect
Reviews the functional and technical use case specifications
Collaborates with users in projects and problem management to maintain, develop and deploy the best feasible and most cost efficient IS solutions/services for the business
Troubleshoots solution configuration, product and/or performance issues
Advises project delivery on analytical approaches, from build, test, or delivery ensuring adherence to best practices and IS delivery framework

Your background

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US, majoring in Analytics, Computer Science or related field
GPA 3.0 plus
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
In a degree program in Computer Science, IT, or a related field
Problem solving abilities, specifically, identifying and resolving issues in IS technologies
Understanding of cloud-based analytics and BI solutions
Experience in objectively evaluating IS solutions and making recommendations
Experience in translating business requirements into IS capabilities and solutions
Strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of the overall context of business processes and IS technologies
Experience in project planning and execution as well as economic aspects of system management and life cycle

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

ABB in the United States requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, or in specific and limited circumstances, be approved for a sincerely held religious belief or a medical/disability accommodation.

Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB

ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites:
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf
http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762.

Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner.

Full Job Description Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly.
This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

You can apply to the job with this email address: product_quality_engineer_internship_668050a62us@ivy.greenhouse.io
Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview:
Artificial intelligence enabled automation is one of the biggest opportunities of our generation. Here at TuSimple, it is more than just an opportunity, it is our mission. Led by a group of elite researchers and engineers, we are working tirelessly to bring safe and reliable autonomous trucking to reality. This transformative endeavor can reduce energy consumptions in the trucking industry, make goods and services more affordable and efficient, and eventually, profoundly improve the quality of life of everyone, including you and I.

Role Responsibilities

Support leading product quality activities, data & schedule for assigned projects
Assessing program / project risks and proactively driving mitigation plans
Partnering with Engineering to define product acceptance plans based on Product Requirement Documents (PRD's) and Product Quality Plans (APQP) for flow down to internal build locations and partner organizations
Providing Quality team's risk assessment as the advocate for the customer experience in programs and projects at a across functional team level
Analyzing field feedback reports, data and information on product performance to provide insights and direction to development teams that help key product and process decision making
Helps dept QE to form the independent unbiased communication channel and link from field quality and customer experience to engineering, development and problem resolution owners
Follow ups and helps formulates actions plans to address top risk, issues and problems that are quantifiable and measurable
Supports driving continual product performance improvement through robust issue and problem management
Monitor tracks and helps defining, monitoring, and owning product Quality KPIs and metrics
Supports Change Control Board: Impact analysis and approvals

Experience & Skills Required

B.S. - Computer Science, Engineering or Business
Data Analysis skills
Computer skills

Intern Perks

Work with world class AI Engineers
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Work on significantly important and mission critical projects
Extensive individual support through TuSimple's Mentorship Program
Competitive salary
High full-time employment return rates after completion of Internship Program
Gym membership reimbursement
Monthly team building budget
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is onsite)

Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day
Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more

TuSimple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company does not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ

Full Job Description This program is a 10-week full-time opportunity that starts on June 6th, 2022 and will end on August 12, 2022.

Locations: CT - Hartford; RI- Woonsocket

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive, and patient focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

You will gain valuable work experience and participate in:
Projects that contribute to the success of our business Community service activities Professional development workshops Mentorship and networking opportunities Interaction with senior leaders
And our corporate interns have an increased likelihood to receive an offer for a future role with CVS Health.

About this business area:
Enterprise Products is a technology organization focusing on delivering and operating enterprise technology assets. Our vision is to bring together our digital and physical assets to deliver a connected experience that transforms the way consumers engage in their health.
You will gain valuable work experience and participate in: • Projects that contribute to the success of our business
Community service initiatives Mentorship and networking opportunities Interaction with senior leaders Our corporate interns have an increased likelihood to receive an offer for a future role with CVS Health. What this business area supports: PBM/Retail Health Care Benefits Clinical Services Data Platform Ecosystem Platform Interoperability Transformation Initiatives
You will work on:
Project Management Data Engineering and Data Science Product Management Computer Programming Learn about SAFe Methodology Learn to think strategically
Required Qualifications
Meet educational requirements (see education section)
COVID Requirements
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.

If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health.
If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated.

Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated leadership experience. Examples include: active roles in student or social organization activities, sports, or school or work-related projects Strong written and verbal communication skills Internship or work experience in related field such as business or healthcare Have an interest in obtaining full-time position within CVS Health upon graduation
Education
Be currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree Have an anticipated graduation date between September 2022 and August 2023 Have a major(s)/concentration in Information Technology, Computer Science or related major
Business Overview
At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. Full Job Description Reuters, the world’s largest international multimedia news provider, is looking for aspiring journalists for its 2022 Summer Internship Program. We welcome passionate, curious reporters who want to tell stories for a global audience. Our paid internships are hands-on reporting positions covering business, political and general news.

Internships last for 10 weeks and begin in mid-June 2022. Most are in our New York and Washington bureaus, but opportunities may also exist in Chicago, Houston and San Francisco. Applicants must have completed at least two years of university. The application deadline is December 31, 2021.

As Intern you will:
Work on a tightly knit team covering spot news, contributing collaboratively on deadline
Pitch enterprising story ideas
Participate in journalism training programs

To be our Intern, you will likely have:
Some prior journalism experience
Excellent writing and communication skills
A background in journalism, economics, business, law, accounting or computer science
Ambitious journalistic goals and a hunger to develop news-wire reporting skills to meet them

Founded 170 years ago, Reuters provides society with the news it needs to be free, prosperous and informed. Each day, 2,500 journalists in nearly 200 locations around the globe deliver unparalleled international and national news coverage in 16 languages with speed, impartiality and insight. Reuters stays true to the letter and spirit of the Thomson Reuters Trust Principles, valuing independence, integrity and freedom from bias.

Reuters news is read and seen by billions of people worldwide every day. Our stories reaches more than 750 broadcasters in 115 countries and 1,000 publishing clients, including eight of the world’s top 10 newspapers.

Our audience includes:
35 million unique monthly visitors to Reuters.com. Hundreds of thousands of professionals using Thomson Reuters premium products.
Each year, we deliver:
2+ million unique news stories. 1.4+ million news alerts. 730,000+ pictures and images. 110,000+ video stories. 4,600+ expert views. Nearly 100 investigative reports.
If this sounds like the journalism experience you want, apply now. Serious candidates should include a cover letter referencing the Reuters reporting they admire most and a relevant reporting idea or two of their own.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Full Job Description Overview:
AceInfo is currently seeking an Intern to support our federal project, in Kearneysville, WV.

If you are looking for an opportunity to gain real-life IT experience, earn a real-life paycheck, and get on the fast track to an IT career, look no further than the Ace Info Solutions Intern Program. This is a hands-on technical, on-the-job training position for candidates enrolled in Associate or Bachelor’s degree programs.

Position Description:
Paid internship position at the United States Coast Guard Operations Systems Center located in Kearneysville, WV.

Schedule

Part-time: Typically 20-29 hours per week. Work days/hours can be flexible (within M-F normal business hours) to accommodate your academic schedule.

Duties & Responsibilities:
The United States Coast Guard (USCG) Command, Control, Communication, Computers, Cyber and Intelligence Service Center (C5ISC) Kearneysville Core Technology Services (CTS II) Contract has an opening for a Security Intern to join the Service Management Team. The Service Management Team supports IT infrastructure engineering and operations efforts across CTS, including:

Holistic management of IT infrastructure capacity that includes processes and technology
Report and dashboard creation and support for Key performance indicators (KPI) and metrics
Report and dashboard creation and support for Capacity Management
Business Analysis
Onboarding of new business sytems
End user support for CTS service offerings
Issue escalation in coordination with technical and management staff
Design and testing of services offered via the CTS Service Catalog
Standard template/process creation and maintenance
Security compliance tracking and reporting
Security assessment and audit analysis and support
Comprehensive OS STIG posture for 100% of currently supported servers through creation of STIG Checklists and Scorecards
Creation and updates of technical specifications and business documentation
Configuration and release management

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Ensure STIG Score Cards are created, STIG rule exceptions documented.
Work closely with Business system applications on STIG Exceptions, required documentation.
Coordinate the updating/creation of STIG scorecards.
Coordinate PaaS Engineering and Security team activities to include monthly COS update cycle, ensuring STIG exceptions are placed within the server compliance automation process, and prioritization of STIG remediation.
Document and track PaaS image updates
Assist in tracking PaaS vulnerability mitigation
Assist in tracking PaaS STIG analysis and mitigation
Assist with the collection and provision of PaaS audit/assessment artifacts
Facilitate and participate in PaaS Image technical working groups
Provide PaaS image standards instruction and feedback
Provide CTS Server Services assistance as needed
Ensure adherence to CM processes and reporting standards
Ensure adherence to Project Management and CCB guidelines
Provide input for process improvement and standardization

Requirements:
Required Education:
Currently enrolled in an accredited Computer Science, IT Engineering or related degree program.
Security + Certification required. Certification may be obtained while undergoing background investigation.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong computer skills and the ability to create high-value deliverables
Effective communication skills (oral and written)
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team environment
Self starter who can think ahead
Proficiency with the MS Office tool suite
Proficiency in spreadsheet data manipulation and presentation building
Strong customer service and consultation skills

Additional Requirement:
U.S. Citizenship is required for the position. Candidate must successfully pass a Federal Background Investigation to obtain a government granted security clearance.

Full Job Description Data/Software Engineer

Summer 2022 Paid Internship

Mid May – Mid August

Zions Bancorporation’s Enterprise Technology and Operations (ETO) team is transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. We operate in a fast-paced, information-driven environment, which means we need people who bring diverse experiences, perspectives, and expertise to meet the ever-changing demands of a technology-driven world. We are grounded in the belief that “improving the work is the work” as we drive to create simple, easy, and fast solutions for our customers. Your ability to adapt, learn, and innovate helps increase revenue, reduce operational costs, and mitigates risk.

ETO provides opportunities for you to own your career growth through Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, Women in Technology, and Workforce of the Future initiatives that allow you to network across the organization, volunteer in our community, and build your technical and soft skills. Together we are building a culture that values diversity and creates a space of belonging for all our team members. We believe that investing in your success is an investment in our customers and our business. Our people are what sets us apart and make us great.

As a Data/Software Engineer , you will help Enterprise Data & Analytics team to acquire data from operational systems and position it to support data engineering and analytics.

Things you do:
Design and implement solutions that enable Data as a Service.

Adhere to internal development best practices/lifecycle (e.g. Testing, Code Reviews, CI/CD, Documentation).

Design and integrate with internal and external APIs.

Gather business requirements and propose robust and scalable solutions.

Document and showcase feature designs/workflows.

Participate in team meetings and discussions around product development.

Stay up to date on industry latest industry trends and design patterns.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
Development experience with Python
Experience with Git.
Experience developing on Linux OS.
Comfortable communicating with teams via showcases/demos.
Experience building/consuming web services is a plus
Basic understanding of distributed systems, data structures, design principles is a plus
Experience with agile development methodologies (e.g. SAFe, Kanban, Scrum) is a plus

position: Advanced Digital Innovation Center (ADIC) Internship - Summer 2022
description:
Full Job Description At Oshkosh, we build, serve and protect people and communities around the world by designing and manufacturing some of the toughest specialty trucks and access equipment. We employ over 15,000 team members all united by a common purpose. Our engineering and product innovation help keep soldiers and firefighters safe, is critical in building and keeping communities clean and helps people do their jobs every day.

JOB SUMMARY:
The intern position, with the unique Digital Technology and Business skills/competencies listed below, would join our internship program with a summertime commitment. We are looking for a technology enthusiast who can help us managing our local lab in the Advanced Digital Innovation Center (ADIC), while also assisting the local Digital Technology team on creating demos across client computing, datacenter, and Internet of Things business groups. If you like to learn while having fun, study everyday as a way of living, we'd like to have you at Oshkosh Corporation. This will be a summer internship from June -August. Housing and relocation options available for the duration of the internship.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.

Working closely with the Digital Technology team and business specialists to learn and experiment with technologies related to AI, Computer Vision, Internet of things, among others. Assisting the team with demonstrations, i.e., help them show the customers how to convert technologies and solutions into valuable business opportunities Managing the lab, being your main responsibilities: keep control of the assets, preparing and testing hardware for customer demos, and assist with purchase orders Producing technical documentation to make demos easier to conduct Learning about current and new technologies and training yourself in any area of your interest.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Active student of Bachelor's degree in IT, Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, Telecommunication, Data/Statistics or related majors Availability to work 40 hours per week over the summer. Advanced English level Preferred Technical qualifications and experience related to Cloud e.g. Azure/AWS Proficient in Microsoft Office to include Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship. Demonstrated ability to perform the Essential Duties of the position with or without accommodation. Interest of laboratory operations.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Working knowledge of server provisioning Experience with machine learning hardware/software Working knowledge of robotics and PLC programming. Experience with CAD software Working knowledge of industrial automation. Experience in coding languages such as SQL, C#, Python
Oshkosh is committed to working with and offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability for any part of the employment process, please contact us at: 920-502-3009 or corporatetalentacquisition@oshkoshcorp.com.

Oshkosh Corporation is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. This company will provide equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Information collected regarding categories as provided by law will in no way affect the decision regarding an employment application.

Oshkosh Corporation will not discharge or in any manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Oshkosh Corporation's legal duty to furnish information.

Certain positions with Oshkosh Corporation require access to controlled goods and technologies subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations or the Export Administration Regulations. Applicants for these positions may need to be "U.S. Persons," as defined in these regulations. Generally, a "U.S. Person" is a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident, or an individual who has been admitted as a refugee or granted asylum.

Full Job Description Symetra has an exciting opportunity join our team as a Derivatives Strategist Intern!

About the program

At Symetra, we share a deep commitment in bringing value to underserved communities and people, and helping them take steps toward financial freedom. That’s our way of describing people that are able to be and to do what they value. Our interns work on real, meaningful projects that contribute toward our goal, and are an important part of our Symetra community.

Symetra's Internship Program for Summer 2022 is entirely remote - all interns will learn and work in a virtual setting. The internship duration is 12 weeks.

Your responsibilities may include

Assist with the analysis of equities and rates derivatives trading and hedging strategies
Assist with the development and automation of analytical tools for trading decision making coding in VBA, Python, SQL including machine learning algorithms
You will gain exposure to Bloomberg and NumeriX for equity and fixed income derivatives pricing

Your education, experience and skills

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science with Quantitative Finance exposure through coursework (Black-Scholes model) OR Quantitative Finance major
Experience with programming in Python, Excel VBA, and SQL Database and machine learning algorithms
Willingness to learn
Strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills

What our Interns have to say

“I could not have asked for a better company culture and group of people for my first internship.” – 2021 Intern
“Overall, the program was run extremely well, especially for it being done virtually. I would highly recommend this program to people looking for an internship.” – 2021 Intern"My experience with the Symetra Internship program was amazing! Not only did I have tons of opportunity for my own learning and growth, but I felt fully supported and encouraged along the way." – 2021 Intern
What we offer you

We don’t take a “one-size-fits-all” approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better—both at work and at home

Fully remote internship. We ship you the equipment you need to enjoy work from the comfort of home
Wellness program offering employees a variety of resources crafted to assist you in reaching and maintaining your optimum health
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and take advantage of immediate vesting and company matching up to 6%
Paid time away accrual

Work Authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

We empower inclusion

At Symetra, we embrace and celebrate diverse experiences, identities and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and creates a stronger, more innovative company. Learn more here.

In a complex industry, we strive for clarity.

Symetra is a dynamic and growing financial services company with 60 years of experience and customers nationwide. In our daily work delivering retirement, employee benefits, and life insurance products, we're guided by the principles of VALUE, TRANSPARENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY. That means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and honestly so people understand what they're getting, and we build products that stand the test of time. We work hard and do what's right for our customers, communities and employees. Join our team and share in our success as we work toward becoming the next national player in our industry.

Learn more about our careers at www.symetra.com/careers

position: College Intern (MS/PhD) – Machine Learning Grid Application Intern, Raleigh, NC, US Research Center (Summer 2022)
description:
Full Job Description Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB’s Electrification Global Markets organization is responsible for the go-to-market strategy and generating profitable growth for the Electrification Business Area. Our 10,000 strong commercial team represents the portfolio of all Electrification Business Area Divisions in over 100 countries. Our unmatched domain expertise across key industry verticals and channels combined with our truly global footprint makes us able to deliver extraordinary business results, supporting our customers with solutions which address their current needs, whilst considering the future emerging trends such as Urbanization, Digitalization and Shift to Electricity and Sustainable Energy.

The role reports to the Research Department Manager and is located in Raleigh, North Carolina.

ABB seeks interns to work at its US Research Center in Raleigh, NC in various areas of research for Summer 2022. You will work with power grid specialists to develop cutting edge research and development related to applying machine learning techniques for distribution grid applications.

Your responsibilities

Conduct literature survey and benchmarking to assess the state of art methods for a given problem
Actively participate in applied research activities in the area of machine learning applications for edge computing environments, resulting in proofs of concept, prototypes, patents, and/or academic publications
Investigate the application of machine learning for power distribution system/grid applications that satisfies customer requirements for creating value-added services and offerings
Contribute to the promotion of the application of machine learning concepts within ABB, and develop prototype solutions using digitalization technologies, including the frameworks and analytics libraries
Debug, test and validate core algorithms in a mockup or full-blown setup

Your background

Currently enrolled in a degree program in the US - PhD or master’s student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering (PhD preferred)
GPA 3.0 +
Must be currently authorized to work for ABB in the US
Practical knowledge of advanced analytics (machine learning in particular) and corresponding technology stacks (both commercial and open source)
Familiarity with edge computing technologies and platforms
Experience in data processing, data collection and cleansing
Design and implementation experience in multiple platforms and languages e.g. Java, Python, Matlab, C/C++, R
Experience in data analysis and machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g. Scikit learn, TensorFlow, Theano, Caffe, PyTorch, Pylearn2, etc.)
Willingness to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of new technologies and application domains
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently in English
Background in electricity distribution is a plus

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

Full Job Description This program is a 10-week full-time opportunity that starts on June 6th, 2022 and will end on August 12, 2022.

Locations: Ri-Woonsocket; CT-Hartford

This program has positions available at multiple work office locations across the country. By applying to this position, you understand that you will be considered for opportunities at these multiple locations. and your final location will be assigned and shared with you closer to your start date. Should you accept a position in this program, we will take your preferred work location into consideration and will attempt to accommodate.

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive, and patient focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

You will gain valuable work experience and participate in:
Projects that contribute to the success of our business Community service activities Professional development workshops Mentorship and networking opportunities Interaction with senior leaders
And our corporate interns have an increased likelihood to receive an offer for a future role with CVS Health.

About this business area:
Our goal is to provide comprehensive documentation and point all of CVS Health IT and business to clear guidance that details exactly what they should be doing, where and how, as part of a new, more agile and cloud-oriented but compliant Greenfield Software Lifecycle or Brownfield Software Lifecycle, depending on whether you are developing a new system from scratch or migrating.

Our mission is to cover all areas of the lifecycle to make sure anyone at any level can understand and follow CVS’ target state and recommendation. In addition, this site will define and publish any foundational areas in our Enterprise where we should be leveraging Agnostic platforms which are portable across cloud providers and not purely native services tied to a provider (e.g. we consider Identity a foundational area where we should take an Agnostic approach.)

You will work on:
Evaluate new features and system requirements by developing working prototypes Support design, implementation, and testing of reusable software components for cloud platforms
Required Qualifications
Meet educational requirements (see education section) Experience with cloud technologies such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, AWS etc. Ability to Write architecture/design documentation
COVID Requirements
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.

If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health.
If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated.

Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated leadership experience. Examples include: active roles in student or social organization activities, sports, or school or work-related projects Strong written and verbal communication skills Internship or work experience in related field such as business or healthcare Have an interest in obtaining full-time position within CVS Health upon graduation Demonstrated leadership experience and initiative Strong aptitude for learning new technologies Scripting skills in the area of nodejs/python, bash/shell
Education
You should currently be pursuing an MS in Computer Science or similar post-graduate degree. Have an anticipated graduation date between September 2022 and August 2023
Business Overview
At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Full Job Description Full Stack Developer

Summer 2022 Paid Internship

Mid May – Mid August

Zions Bancorporation’s Enterprise Technology and Operations (ETO) team is transforming what it means to work for a financial institution. We operate in a fast-paced, information-driven environment, which means we need people who bring diverse experiences, perspectives, and expertise to meet the ever-changing demands of a technology-driven world. We are grounded in the belief that “improving the work is the work” as we drive to create simple, easy, and fast solutions for our customers. Your ability to adapt, learn, and innovate helps increase revenue, reduce operational costs, and mitigates risk.

We believe that investing in your success is an investment in our customers and our business. Our people are what sets us apart and make us great.

Things you do:
Develop web applications utilizing modern JavaScript frameworks and Java to enable effective utilization of company’s key data assets
Develop automation workflows
Work with Data Governance to catalog and visualize data assets

Qualifications

Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
Experience in front-end or full-stack development
Experience in web development using ReactJS or Angular JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, CSS, and Bootstrap.
Experience with Git.
Experience with Java and Spring boot framework is a plus
Experience with Docker containers is a plus
